articles.title: Reminder! Last Day to Grab Dividend Proposed by Salt Trading Corporation Limited
articles.content: Today is the last day to grab the 10% dividend that Salt Trading Corporation Limited (STC) proposed. The company called its 58th AGM on 15th Chaitra, 2081. The meeting will be held in the Tribhuvan Army Officers Club, Bhadrakali, Kathmandu, starting at 11 AM that day. Among the other agendas, the AGM will endorse a 10% dividend from the profits of FY 80/81 for shareholders. The board of directors' meeting on Poush 26 decided to distribute the dividend from the FY 2080/81 profits. A 10% cash dividend has been proposed. The book closure date is Chaitra 01, 2081. Therefore, the shareholders who have maintained their shares until today are entitled to dividend payout and can attend this AGM.

articles.title: Salt Trading Corporation Calls 58th AGM on Chaitra 15 to Endorse 10% Dividend; When's the Book Closure?
articles.content: Salt Trading Corporation Limited (STC) has called its 58th AGM on 15th Chaitra, 2081. Among the other agendas, the AGM will endorse a 10% dividend from the profits of FY 80/81 for shareholders. The board of directors meeting held on Poush 26 decided to distribute the dividend from the profits of FY 2080/81. A 10% cash dividend has been proposed. Furthermore, there is an agenda to endorse the auditor's report with PL statements, financial reports, and cash flow reports and appoint an auditor for the fiscal year 2081/82. The book closure date is from Chaitra 01 to Chaitra 15. Therefore, the shareholders maintained before that day are entitled to dividend payout and can attend this AGM. AGM Notice:

articles.title: Salt Trading Corporation Raises Salt Prices
articles.content: Salt Trading Corporation Limited has announced an increase in the price of salt, effective from midnight Tuesday. In a statement released on Tuesday, the company detailed the adjusted prices. The price of a kilo packet of iodized salt has risen from Rs 23 to Rs 26. Similarly, the price of New Shakti salt has increased from Rs 17 per kg to Rs 20 per kg. Meanwhile, the price of one kilo of Bhanu salt has been set at Rs 9.

articles.title: Salt Trading Corporation Distributed 15% Bonus Shares Directly To Shareholders' DEMAT Account
articles.content: Salt Trading Corporation Limited (STC) has distributed a 15% bonus share directly to the DEMAT accounts of its shareholders and has urged them to dematerialize their shares. The company convened its 57th AGM on 23rd Chaitra, 2080, and endorsed a 15.79% dividend for the fiscal year 2079/80. 15% bonus shares and a 0.79% cash dividend (including tax) were proposed. The same bonus shares are now deposited in Demat accounts. Also, the company has urged the shareholders to dematerialize their shares, if they haven't updated their bank information in the Demat account are requested to do so to receive the bonus share. Note that the bonus shares of the company are already listed in NEPSE. As of writing, STC has an LTP of Rs. 4,919.00. Notice:

articles.title: Bonus Shares of Deprosc Laghubitta and Salt Trading Corporation Limited Listed in NEPSE
articles.content: 15,51,088.1661 unit bonus shares of Deprosc Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (DDBL) have been listed in NEPSE. The company convened its 22nd AGM on 25th Chaitra, 2080, and endorsed a 10.52632% dividend for the fiscal year 2079/80. The 344th board of directors meeting held on Falgun 3 decided to distribute the dividend on the paid-up capital of Rs. 1.55 Arba. 10% bonus shares worth Rs. 15.51 crores and 0.52632% cash dividend (including tax) worth Rs. 81.63 lakhs were proposed. The same bonus shares are now listed in NEPSE. DDBL closed at Rs. 720.00. Similarly, 4,18,326.46 unit bonus shares of Salt Trading Corporation Limited (STC) have been listed in NEPSE. The company convened its 57th AGM on 23rd Chaitra, 2080, and endorsed a 15.79% dividend for the fiscal year 2079/80. The board of directors meeting held on Poush 25 decided to distribute the dividend. 15% bonus shares and 0.79% cash dividend (including tax) were proposed. The same bonus shares are now listed in NEPSE. STC closed at Rs. 4,719.00.

articles.title: Salt Trading Corporation's Q3 Net Profit Surges by 40%, Revenue Jumps to Rs. 9.45 Arba; EPS at Rs. 21.60
articles.content: Salt Trading Corporation Limited (STC) has announced its remarkable third-quarter results for the fiscal year 2080-81. The company's net profit has soared to 5.19 crores in Q3 FY 2080-81, marking a surge of 40% from the Rs. 3.71 Crores reported in the previous fiscal year (FY 2079-80). STC has a paid-up capital of Rs. 32.07 crores and Reserves and Surplus reaching Rs. 1.39 Arba till the third quarter of FY 2080-81. The company's revenue from sales has notably increased by 63.91%, totaling Rs. 9.45 Arba in the same period. Similarly, other income rose by 4.78% reaching Rs. 2.73 Crores. It is essential to note that the company faced increased interest expenses, rising by 52.85% and reaching Rs. 41.61 crores in Q3 FY 2080-81. STC has incurred increased administrative expenses, totaling Rs. 16.12 crores, reflecting a rise of 5.09%. Similarly, staff expenses rose by 8.78%, amounting to Rs. 27.17 crores until the end of the third quarter of FY 2080-81. The Annualized Earnings per Share (EPS) stands at Rs. 21.60. Simultaneously, the Net Worth per Share stood at Rs. 534.06. Click here for the Q3 report: Major Financial Highlights:

articles.title: Don't Forget! Last Day to Grab Dividend Proposed by Salt Trading Corporation Limited And Green Development Bank
articles.content: Today is the last day to grab the 15.79% dividend proposed by Salt Trading Corporation Limited (STC). The company has called its 57th AGM on 23rd Chaitra, 2080. The AGM will be held in Majestic Lake Front Hotel & Suites, Pokhara-6, Kaski. The company has proposed a 4% dividend. The 206th meeting of the board of directors held on Falgun 24 has decided to distribute 3.8% bonus shares worth Rs. 1.97 crore and 0.2% cash dividend (for tax purposes) worth Rs. 10.38 lakhs from the paid-up capital. The current paid-up capital of the company is Rs. 51.90 crore. The book closure date is on Chaitra 9. Thus, shareholders maintained before that day are entitled to the dividend payout and can also attend this AGM.

articles.title: "8.5% RBBL Debenture 2083" and "8.75% Prime Debenture 2085" Distribute Semi-Annual Interest
articles.content: Rastriya Banijya Bank Limited has deposited the semi-annual interest of "8.5% RBBL Debenture 2083" directly to the bank accounts of debenture holders. The public issue of "8.5% RBBL Debenture 2083" had opened on 25th Jestha and closed on 28th Jestha, 2078. 25,00,000 units were issued at a par value of Rs. 1,000 per unit. As the name suggests, the "8.5% RBBL Debenture 2083" has a maturity period of 6 years and will yield an 8.5% annual interest payment to unitholders. Similarly, Prime Commercial Bank Limited has deposited semi-annual interest of "8.75% Prime Debenture 2085" directly to the bank accounts of the debenture holders. As the name suggests, this debenture pays an annual 8.75% interest to investors.

articles.title: "8.75% Prime Debenture 2085" and "9.50% NCC Rinpatra 2086" Allotted to Applicants
articles.content: Prime Commercial Bank Limited opened the debenture issue titled "8.75% Prime Debenture 2085" from 28th Falgun. The issue was supposed to close on Chaitra 03, 2077. Since the issue was not fully subscribed by the closing date, the deadline was then extended till Chaitra 13. 35,00,000 units were issued at Rs.1000 per unit. While 21 lakh units were to be subscribed via private placement, 14 lakh units were offered to the general public (mutual funds included). The issue manager has now allotted the debenture issue on 26th Chaitra. As the name suggests, this debenture will pay 8.75% interest/ returns to investors annually. Announcement Similarly, Nepal Credit and Commerce Bank Limited also issued "9.50% NCC Rinpatra 2086" from Chaitra 13. The Rinpatra issued a total of 30,00,000 units at a par value of Rs. 1,000 per unit. This issue closed on 18th Chaitra, 2077, at the end of banking hours. While 18 lakh units were to be subscribed via private placement, 11.4 lakh units were issued to the general public. The remaining 60,000 units were then reserved for mutual funds. The issue manager of this issue has also allotted the units on Chaitra 27th. Announcement

articles.title: Sanima Bank’s debenture issue receives 2,279 application for 110,837 units; total of 3.80 Lakh units available for public
articles.content: Sanima Bank Limited (SANIMA) was issuing 10% debentures worth Rs 2 arba from Kartik 30, 2075. “10% Sanima Debenture 2085”will be issuing yield 10% interest annually. Kathmandu Capital has been appointed as the issue manager for the debenture issuance. As per the issue manager, 2,279 applicants have been received for a total of 110,837 units of debentures. The issue will be closed on 1st Poush, 2075. The bank has been issuing 20 lakh unit debentures at Rs 1,000 per unit. Out of the total debentures, 20% of the issue (i.e. issue of Rs 40 crore from 4 Lakh units) is being issued for the general public. And the remaining 80% will be issued from private placement. Out of the offered 4 Lakh units, 20,000 units have been kept for mutual funds and the remaining 380,000 units are available for the public. Applications can be placed for minimum 25 units of debentures while the maximum applications can be placed for 380,000 units.

articles.content: Sanima Bank Limited (SANIMA) has been issuing 10% debentures worth Rs 2 arba from Kartik 30, 2075. “10% Sanima Debenture 2085”will be yielding 10% interest annually. Kathmandu Capital has been appointed as the issue manager for the debenture issuance. As per the issue manager, 2,617 applicants have been received for a total of 126,537 units of debentures. The issue will be closed on 1st Poush, 2075. The bank has been issuing 20 lakh unit debentures at Rs 1,000 per unit. Applications can be placed for minimum 25 units of debentures while the maximum applications can be placed for 380,000 units. If the extension is not allowed by SEBON, the issue will be closed for now and might be re issued in the future.

articles.title: “10% Sanima Debenture 2085” receives 2,783 applications for 1.35 lakh units from general public; 66% issue for public goes unsubscribed
articles.content: Kathmandu Capital has closed the issue for “10% Sanima Debenture 2085” yesterday. As per the issue manager, the debenture was able to collect only 2,783 applications for 1,35,737 units from the general public. The bank has been issuing 20 lakh unit debentures at Rs 1,000 per unit. Out of the total debentures, 20% of the issue (i.e. issue of Rs 40 crore) is being issued for the general public. And the remaining 80% was issued from private placement. Hence, about 66% from the issue to general public remains unsubscribed. Sanima Bank will be able to issue to the unsubscribed debentures along with other debentures issued in future. “10% Sanima Debenture 2085” will be issuing yield 10% interest annually and the allotment will be made to the valid applicants.

articles.title: NEPSE lists more than 3.50 Million units of debentures issued by Siddhartha Bank and Sanima Bank
articles.content: Nepal Stock Exchange (NEPSE) has published a notice regarding the listing of debentures issued by Siddhartha Bank and Sanima Bank. 2,162,559 units of ‘10.5% S.B.L Debenture 2082’ has been listed in NEPSE. Debentures worth Rs.2.25 Arba were issued at par value of Rs.1000 per unit. The debentures with maturity period of 7 years will be providing interest rate of 10.5% annually to the debenture holders. Similarly, 1,354,712 units of ‘10% Sanima Debenture 2085’ has been listed in NEPSE. The bank had issued 20 lakh unit debentures at par value Rs.1000 per unit. These debentures have a maturity period of 10 years. They will be yielding interest rate of 10% p.a. Both these debt instruments can now be traded on the secondary market.

articles.title: As time has changed, will your investment product also change? What can be your next purchase from the market?
articles.content: “The equity shares, fixed deposits and debentures resemble the three hands namely hour hand, minute hand and second hand of a clock.” The current declining secondary market is an accurate resemblance of an hour hand which travels in a relatively slow pace. Similarly, the minute hand, establishing balance between the second hand and hour hand, represents the fixed deposit interest rate which is decided on the basis of demand and supply of loan in the economy. Thirdly, the second hand that moves in the fastest pace can be regarded as non-convertible debenture that provides highest return. Finally, the clock symbolizes the financial system of our economy. Besides, the clock also symbolizes how time has changed and investors can be in benefit by choosing other types of investment products. Investors usually prefer higher return from the invested capital. Until few years ago, investors had limited alternative between fixed deposit and equity shares to invest their capital. The later involved high amount of risk whereas the former provided lower return. The era of non-convertible debenture began however; most of these debentures did not stand to the expectation of investors. The main feature of non-convertible debentures is higher return. If we analyze the current situation, the average interest rate provided by commercial banks in FD is 8.92%. Similarly, the average interest rate provided in fixed deposits for last 10 years is 7% approx. Besides, the NEPSE 25 years historical CAGR is 11% approx along with the risk that equity investment possess. However, the newly issued and issuing debentures provide return of around 10% or more. This shows that debentures can be a good purchase to investors. The table provides detailed information on current return provided by fixed deposits, NEPSE and debentures: What are the major benefits of debentures over fixed deposits? One of the major benefits of debentures over fixed deposits is the higher return that debenture provides. Besid

articles.title: Mountain Energy Nepal’s Net Profit Soars by 50.45% to Rs. 46.50 Crores in Q3; Annualized EPS Reaches Rs. 23.82
articles.content: Mountain Energy Nepal Limited (MEN) has posted a strong net profit of Rs. 46.50 crores in the third quarter of fiscal year 2081/82, marking a significant 50.45% growth compared to Rs. 30.91 crores in the corresponding quarter of the previous fiscal year. The company’s annualized earnings per share (EPS) has surged to Rs. 23.82, up from Rs. 18.21 in Q3 of 2080/81. Revenue stood at Rs. 92.28 crores, a 6.05% increase from last year’s Rs. 87.02 crores, while finance costs dropped by 12.56% to Rs. 18.18 crores, contributing to improved earnings. Administrative expenses remained largely stable at Rs. 2.81 crores. On the balance sheet front, the company’s paid-up capital rose by 15% to Rs. 2.60 Arba, and retained earnings grew by 2.01% to Rs. 1.19 crores. However, borrowings decreased by 12.64% to Rs. 2.77 Arba, indicating better financial discipline. The company's net worth per share declined slightly to Rs. 145.87 from Rs. 151.72. Its PE ratio at the quarter’s end stood at 23.76 times, with the market price per share recorded at Rs. 566.10. Report: Major Highlights:

articles.title: Bonus Shares of Mountain Energy Nepal and Mahalaxmi Bikas Bank Listed in NEPSE
articles.content: 33,94,846.58 unit bonus shares of Mountain Energy Nepal Limited (MEN) have been listed in NEPSE. The company convened its 11th AGM on 28th Poush, 2081 and endorsed a 15.7895% dividend for the fiscal year 2080/81. The 117th meeting of the board of directors held on Mangsir 17 proposed a 15.7895% dividend for the fiscal year 2080/81. 15% bonus shares and 0.7895% cash dividends (for tax purposes) were proposed. The same bonus shares are now listed in NEPSE. As of writing, MEN has an LTP of Rs. 582.95. Similarly, 12,51,395.58 unit bonus shares of Mahalaxmi Bikas Bank Ltd. (MLBL) have been listed in NEPSE. The company convened its 23rd AGM on 29th Poush, 2081, and endorsed a 7% dividend for the fiscal year 2080/81. The 610th meeting of the board of directors held on Poush 01 proposed a 7% dividend for the fiscal year 2080/81. 3% bonus shares worth Rs. 12.51 Crores and 4% cash dividends (for tax purposes) worth Rs. 16.68 Crores were proposed. The same bonus shares are now listed in NEPSE. As of writing, MLBL has an LTP of Rs. 405.76.

articles.title: Mountain Energy Nepal Limited Holds General Meeting, Approved Dividend and Rights Issue
articles.content: The general meeting of Mountain Energy Nepal Limited for the financial year 2080/81 was held on January 12, 2025, under the chairmanship of Pradeep Jung Pandey. The meeting proposed a total dividend of 15.7895%, including 15% bonus shares and a 0.7895% cash dividend for tax purposes. The company’s paid-up capital will rise to NPR 2.6 billion after the bonus share distribution. A proposal to issue rights shares worth NPR 1.33 billion for the 65 MW Dudh Khola hydropower project was also passed. The meeting approved the annual financial statements and elected Rachana Adhikari unopposed as a woman director. Additionally, resolutions to amend the company’s articles of association and regulations were passed. The company currently generates electricity from the 42 MW Mistri Khola and 5 MW Tadikhola projects.

articles.title: Mountain Energy Nepal Unveils Book Closure Date for its 15.78% Dividend; Calls AGM With Agenda to Issue Right Shares
articles.content: Mountain Energy Nepal Limited (MEN) has called its 11th AGM on 28th Poush, 2081. The meeting will be held in Amrapali Banquet Catering & Events, Bhatbhateni, Kathmandu, starting at 10:00 AM that day. Among the other agendas, the AGM will endorse a 15.7895% dividend for the fiscal year 2080/81. The 117th meeting of the board of directors held on Mangsir 17 has proposed a 15.7895% dividend for the fiscal year 2080/81. 15% bonus shares and 0.7895% cash dividends (for tax purposes) have been proposed. Furthermore, there is an agenda to endorse the auditor's report along with the profit and loss statements, financial reports, and cash flow reports, and to appoint an auditor for the fiscal year 2081/82. And there is an agenda to elect one female director. Similarly, The company has resolved to issue 50% right shares worth Rs. 1.30 Arba after adjusting for the allocation of 15% bonus shares from the existing paid-up capital of Rs. 2.26 Arba. This adjustment will result in an enhanced paid-up capital, reaching Rs. 2.60 Arba after incorporating the bonus shares. The book closure date is from Poush 11. Therefore, the shareholders maintained before that day are entitled to dividend payout and can attend this AGM. AGM Notice

articles.title: Mountain Energy Nepal Proposes 15.7895% Dividend for FY 2080/81; How much in Bonus shares and Cash?
articles.content: Mountain Energy Nepal Limited (MEN) has proposed a 15.7895% dividend for the fiscal year 2080/81. The 117th meeting of the board of directors held on Mangsir 17 has proposed a 15.7895% dividend for the fiscal year 2080/81. 15% bonus shares and 0.7895% cash dividends (for tax purposes) have been proposed. The dividend will be distributed only after approval by the Electricity Regulatory Commission and endorsement by the company's upcoming AGM. Poush 11 is the book closure date. Thus, shareholders who have maintained their shares until today are entitled to the dividend payout and can attend the AGM. MEN closed at Rs. 719.00 yesterday. Dividend History:

articles.title: Mountain Energy Nepal Ltd. Announces Investment in Dudh Khola Hydropower Project
articles.content: Mountain Energy Nepal Limited (MEN) has made a significant move in its growth and expansion strategy by announcing an investment in the Dudh Khola Hydropower Project (65 MW). The decision was made during the 116th meeting of the company's Board of Directors, held on 6th Mangsir, 2081, at 3:00 PM. In compliance with the Securities Listing Regulations, 2075, the company has officially informed the Nepal Stock Exchange Limited (NEPSE) about this decision. The Board of Directors reviewed and discussed the economic and technical aspects of the project, ultimately deciding to proceed with the investment. Mountain Energy Nepal Ltd. has authorized Mr. Arun Kumar K.C., a director of the company, to sign the memorandum of understanding for the investment in the Dudh Khola Hydropower Project. This strategic move underscores the company’s commitment to diversifying its energy portfolio and contributing to Nepal's renewable energy sector.

articles.title: Mountain Energy Nepal Posts 15.81% Profit Growth in Q1; Annualized EPS Reaches Rs. 53.97
articles.content: Mountain Energy Nepal (MEN) delivered an impressive first-quarter performance for fiscal year 2081/82, posting a net profit of Rs. 30.53 Crores—a 15.81% increase from Rs. 26.36 Crores in the same period last year. This growth was fueled by a rise in power sales revenue, which climbed to Rs. 49.6 Crores compared to Rs. 45.48 Crores in Q1 of the previous fiscal year. A strategic reduction in finance expenses by 8.01% further supported MEN’s profit, though administrative expenses saw a slight increase of 8.90%. MEN’s paid-up capital rose by 15%, reaching Rs. 2.26 Arba from Rs. 1.96 Arba, which strengthened its financial base. Although assets in property, plant, and equipment declined by 2% to Rs. 2.8 Crores, the company made progress in financial stability with an 11.61% decrease in long-term borrowings, reducing them to Rs. 2.91 Arba. The company's annualized earnings per share (EPS) hit Rs. 53.97, while net worth per share reached Rs. 158.77. With a price-to-earnings (PE) ratio of 12.23 and a market price per share of Rs. 660. Report:

articles.title: 100% Right Shares of Rapti Hydro And General Construction Listed in NEPSE
articles.content: 61,27,938 unit right shares of Rapti Hydro And General Construction Limited (RHGCL) have been listed in NEPSE. The company issued a 1:1 ratio right share i.e. 61,27,938 units to its shareholders from 1st Ashadh, 2082 to 24th Ashad, 2082. Out of which only 54,23,827 units were allotted to the eligible shareholders of the company. The remaining 7,04,111 units of unsubscribed right shares were later sold through an auction from the 13th Shrawan, to the 20th Shrawan, 2082. The same 61,27,938 units of right shares are now listed in NEPSE. Muktinath Capital Limited was the company's auction manager. As of writing, RHGCL has an LTP of Rs. 281.00 .

articles.title: Bids Received in Auction of Rapti Hydro & General Construction Limited Ordinary Shares Opened; What is the Cut-Off Rate?
articles.content: Rapti Hydro & General Construction Limited (RHGCL) opened the bids for its ordinary shares (unsold right shares) auction on 25th Shrawan, 2082. Muktinath Capital was appointed as the auction manager. The bidding process took place at the Muktinath Capital premises in Naxal, Kathmandu, starting at 8:00 am. The auction opened on 13th Shrawan, 2082, and concluded on 20th Shrawan, 2082, at the end of banking hours. In total, 7,04,111 units of ordinary right shares were auctioned. Individuals and companies were all eligible to bid in the auction. This is the unclaimed portion of the rights offering. The company opened a 1:1 ratio right share issue to its shareholders from 1st Ashadh to 22nd Ashadh, 2082. The same unsold rights shares were auctioned to the general public. The minimum bid rate for the auction was Rs. 100. While the minimum bid quantity for shares was 100 units, there was no upper limit. Although bidders could bid for the entirety of the issue, they were required to abide by the regulatory body's rule not to exceed the specified quantity of shares per entity. Around 1800 applications were received for ordinary right shares; the tentative cut-off rate is Rs. 276, according to the auction manager. Once all checks are reconciled and cleared, the cut-off prices may be subject to change. The last traded price of the scrip stands at Rs. 318.78 per share.

articles.title: Rapti Hydro & General Construction Limited Auctioning 7,04,111 Unclaimed Right Shares from Today
articles.content: Rapti Hydro & General Construction Limited (RHGCL) is set to auction 7,04,111 units of unclaimed rights shares from its previous 1:1 rights offering. The auction will open from today, i.e,. from 13th Shrawan to 20th Shrawan, 2082. A total of 54,23,827 shares have been allotted to the valid applicants. Thus, 7,04,111 (11.49%) shares were unclaimed by eligible investors. Of the total right shares issued, only 54,23,827 (88.51%) units were allotted to eligible shareholders. 11.49% of shares were unclaimed by eligible investors. Thus, the same 7,04,111 units of unsold right shares are in auctioned to the general public from today. This is the unclaimed portion of the rights offering. The company had issued a 1:1 ratio right share issue to its shareholders from 1st Ashadh to 22nd Ashadh, 2082. Individuals and institutions are all eligible to bid for the auction. Muktinath Capital Limited has been appointed as the issue manager of this rights share. The minimum bid rate for the auction is set at Rs. 100. For ordinary right shares, the minimum bid quantity is 100 units. Although bidders are allowed to bid for the entire issue, they must adhere to the regulatory board's rule, which restricts exceeding the specified share quantity per entity.

The company has allotted the shares to applicants, and the non-allotted applicants received their money from 2nd Shrawan, 2082. 61,27,938 units of right shares were issued from 1st Ashadh to 22nd Ashadh, 2082. articles.title: Universal Power Company Announces Sale of Shares Of Rapti Hydro and General Construction Limited
articles.content: Universal Power Company Limited has decided to sell 14,42,187 units of shares it holds in Rapti Hydro and General Construction Limited through the secondary market. The decision has been made per Clause 11 of the "Electricity Regulatory Commission's Directive on Public Offering and Regulation of Shares of Electricity-Related Companies, 2078," which mandates prior notice to the public for such transactions. This 15-day public notice has been issued to inform the general public about the share sale process as per regulatory requirements. The notice has been published under the authorization of the Board of Directors of Universal Power Company Limited, located in Tripureshwor, Kathmandu. Notice:

articles.title: Rapti Hydro & General Construction Limited Closing Issue of 1: 1 Right Shares from Today
articles.content: Rapti Hydro & General Construction Limited (RHGCL) is closing its rights offering today. Initially opened on 1st Ashadh, 2082, the issue was scheduled to close on 22nd Ashadh, 2082. However, as per the latest notice, the rights offering will close today. The company will be issuing 100% right shares worth Rs. 61.27 Crores through the issue of 6,127,938 (1: 1) units of right shares to its existing shareholders. articles.title: Sanjen Jalavidhyut Company Limited Announces Conclusion of Lock-in Period for Project-Affected Area Locals on Kartik 28
articles.content: Sanjen Jalavidhyut Company Limited (SJCL) published a notice regarding the expiration of the lock-in period for its local residents of the project-affected area, and the lock-in period will expire on 28th Kartik, 2082. According to the recent guidelines issued by the Securities Board of Nepal (SEBON), Sanjen Jalavidhyut Company Limited has officially notified its investors and stakeholders of the conclusion of the lock-in period for the shares held by its residents of the project-affected area. In the next month of the 28th Kartik, 2082, the lock-in period will end. SJCL now has 36,500,000 units of shares listed on the Nepal Stock Exchange (NEPSE). Of these, the residents of the project-affected area are 36,50,000 units. These shares have been subject to a lock-in period since the IPO allotment three years ago. As outlined in the official notice, the shares held by the Board of Directors and employees at higher management won't be tradable after the lock-in period. SJCL closed at Rs. 282.40. Notice:

articles.title: 36.5 Lakh Unit Additional Shares of Sanjen Jalavidhyut Company Now Listed in NEPSE
articles.content: 36,50,000 unit additional shares (Locals of Rasuwa District) of Sanjen Jalavidhyut Company Limited (SJCL) have been listed in NEPSE. Earlier, the company had issued 36,50,000 units worth Rs. 36.5 crores to the project-affected locals of the Rasuwa district (Aama Chhodingmo VDCs) from 5th Bhadra to 30th Ashwin, 2079. The same additional shares are now listed in NEPSE. SJCL closed at Rs. 350.

articles.title: Sanjen Jalavidhyut Company Cancelled Its 13th AGM
articles.content: Sanjen Jalavidhyut Company Limited (SJCL) has cancelled its 13th Annual General Meeting (AGM) until further notice. The company had previously called its 13th AGM on 5th Chaitra, 2080 at Kundalini Banquet, Chandol, Kathmandu. The company has cited specific reasons for this delay. Due to the unfavorable conditions surrounding the circumstances that led to the postponement of the general meeting, caused by the current situation preventing its convening, SJCL has deemed it necessary to reschedule the AGM. However, the company assures stakeholders that the meeting will be conducted per the established rules and regulations at the most suitable time. Further details will be communicated through official notice channels. Notice:

articles.title: Upper Sanjen Hydropower Commences Production
articles.content: The Simbu Hydropower Centre, constructed by the Sanjen Hydropower Company, has started generating electricity. The hydropower project, officially named Upper Sanjen, boasting a capacity of 14.8 MW, has successfully initiated energy production since August 5. The energy harnessed from this hydropower project has been seamlessly integrated into the national transmission grid. According to Sunil Kumar Dhungel, the Managing Director of Sanjen Hydropower Company, the construction of the Upper Sanjen Hydropower Project, which was initiated back in 2013, has now seamlessly transitioned into its operational phase. The energy generated is being efficiently routed to the central storage through the Chilime Hydropower's national transmission line. Further elaborating, Dhungel shared that the Upper Sanjen Hydropower Project is projected to yield an impressive annual energy output of 88.5 million units. This substantial output is anticipated to translate into a considerable yearly revenue of Rs 400 million. Notably, the powerhouse is strategically positioned at an altitude of 2,180 meters above sea level. Source: Rastriya Samachar Samiti (RSS)

articles.title: Sanjen Hydropower Company allots its 36.50 lakh shares to project-affected locals of Rasuwa district; most affected locals receive biggest chunk of 510 unit shares per person
articles.content: Sanjen Hydropower Company has concluded the allotment of its 36.50 lakh unit shares to project-affected locals of Rasuwa district on Kartik 29, 2079. The issue had received an application from 28,608 applicants who applied for 56.79 lakh unit shares which were allotted as per the degree of affected areas. Most affected category: 1342 applicants from Aamachodingmo gaupalika-5 who applied for at least 510-unit shares received a total of 510-unit shares while 823 applicants who applied between 520 units to 700 received 510-unit shares. affected category: 504 applicants from Aamachodingmo gaupalika-4 who applied for at least 300-unit shares received the total 300-unit shares while 233 applicants who applied between 310 units to 450 received 348-unit shares and 515 demanding between 460 units to 700 units received 360-unit shares. Low affected category: 2,483 applicants from Aamachodingmo gaupalika-1,2,3 who applied for at least 150-unit shares received a total 150 unit shares while 413 applicants who applied between 160 units to 200 units received 150 unit shares, 419 demanding between 160 units to 200 units received 165 unit shares, 100 applicants demanding 310 to 450 units received 174 units and 173 applying for more received 180 units. The least affected category:11,489 applicants from Rasuwa district who applied for at least 100 unit shares received a total 100 unit shares while 5,666 applicants who applied between 110 units to 200 received 100 unit shares, 2,207 demanding between 210 units to 300 units received 116 unit shares, 1,236 applicants demanding to 700 units received 120 units, as per the media statement.

articles.title: Sanjen Jalavidhyut Company Closing Its IPO to Project Affected Locals of Rasuwa District Today
articles.content: Sanjen Jalavidhyut Company Limited (SJCL) is concluding IPO issue of 36,50,000 units shares for the project-affected locals of Rasuwa Districts (Aama Chhodingmo VDCs) today at the end of banking hours. The company has been issuing its 36,50,000 unit IPO shares to the project-affected locals of Rasuwa Districts (Aama Chhodingmo VDCs) from 5th Bhadra and was supposed to conclude on 19th Bhadra but the deadline was extended till Ashoj 04, 2079. However, the issue was unsubscribed and the deadline was re-extended till today i.e. 30th Ashwin, 2079. This is 10% of the company's issued capital i.e Rs. 3,65,00,00,000. Sunrise Capital is appointed as the issue manager for the IPO issuance. Interested investors can apply for a minimum of 10 shares to a maximum of 700 shares. Sanjen Jalavidhyut Company Limited (SJCL), a company promoted by Chilime Hydropower Company Limited (CHPCL), is a public limited company established in 2010 AD with the objective of harnessing hydropower potential of the county with maximum participation of local people in the projects’ ownership and mobilization of local resources for the successful implementation of various hydroelectric projects. In the context of current annual growth in electricity demand in the country, the Company has planned to develop two hydroelectric projects, namely, Sanjen (Upper) Hydroelectric Project (14.8 MW) and Sanjen Hydroelectric Project (42.5 MW) in cascade, with its own equity and loan from financial institutions of Nepal as the first initiative. Notice

articles.title: Sun Nepal Life Insurance Launches ‘One Million Trees Campaign’ in Partnership with Lumbini World Peace Forum
articles.content: Sun Nepal Life Insurance Company Limited has partnered with the Lumbini World Peace Forum (LWPF) to launch the ambitious “One Million Trees Campaign,” a major corporate social responsibility initiative focused on environmental conservation. The campaign aims to plant one million trees across Nepal to restore ecological balance, expand greenery, reduce carbon emissions, and mitigate climate change impacts. Leveraging its extensive network of 148 branches nationwide, Sun Nepal Life will implement and monitor localized plantation efforts with community involvement. This partnership underscores the company’s commitment to sustainability, positioning it as a socially responsible corporate citizen contributing to long-term environmental and societal well-being.

articles.title: Sun Nepal Life Insurance Receives Upgraded ‘Triple B Plus (BBB+)’ Rating
articles.content: Sun Nepal Life Insurance Company Limited has achieved an upgraded ‘Triple B Plus (Care NP BBB+)’ rating from Care Ratings Nepal Limited, reflecting improved financial stability, credibility, and ability to meet obligations. The rating highlights the company’s strong performance, moderate credit risk, high-quality asset base, effective claims management, and experienced management team. The upgrade was driven by consistent premium growth, robust underwriting, enhanced risk management through reinsurance, and strengthened capitalization exceeding NPR 5 billion. With a growing Life Insurance Fund of NPR 10.10 billion, a network of over 40,000 agents, and operations across 49 branches and 99 sub-branches, Sun Nepal Life is positioned to enhance customer trust, expand its market share, and capitalize on its strengthened financial standing in Nepal’s life insurance sector.

articles.title: Sun Nepal Life Insurance Receives ‘BBB+’ Credit Rating from CARE Ratings Nepal
articles.content: Sun Nepal Life Insurance Company Limited has been awarded a ‘BBB+’ rating by CARE Ratings Nepal Limited, reflecting significant improvement in its financial strength and ability to meet obligations. The rating highlights the company’s strong financial performance, experienced management team, effective governance system, and high-quality investment portfolio. A ‘BBB+’ rating denotes a stable financial outlook and reliable capacity to fulfill financial commitments on time. Expressing gratitude to its customers, agents, and shareholders, the company reaffirmed its commitment to delivering robust and responsible insurance services. Sun Nepal Life currently operates through 148 branches and sub-branches across Nepal.

articles.title: Sun Nepal Life Provides Rs. 30 Lakh Insurance to Nepali Cricket Team for World Cup
articles.content: To mark the historic third World Cup appearance of the Nepali men’s cricket team, Sun Nepal Life Insurance Company will provide Rs. 30 lakh insurance coverage to each team member. The package includes Sun Medicare, Nepal’s first emergency medical facility, offering treatment for accidental injuries. The company believes this initiative will motivate and support players, reflecting its motto “Courage and Inspiration through Safety.” Through this effort, Sun Nepal Life Insurance reaffirms its commitment to protect lives and empower dreams, while honoring the nation’s cricket heroes.

articles.title: Sun Nepal Life Launches Cashback Offer on Digital Premium Payments
articles.content: Sun Nepal Life Insurance has introduced a cashback offer for customers paying insurance premiums via eSewa or Khalti. Customers renewing their policy before the due date or within seven days after will receive 0.5% cashback, up to Rs. 1,000. The offer is valid from Ashwin 1 to Mangsir 29, 2082. The company aims to promote digital payments while making insurance services more convenient, secure, and customer-friendly.

articles.title: Sun Nepal Life Strengthens Compliance with Nationwide AML/CFT & Governance Training
articles.content: Sun Nepal Life Insurance Limited organized a specialized training program on Anti-Money Laundering (AML), Combating the Financing of Terrorism (CFT), and Institutional Governance at Hotel Central Plaza, Kohalpur. The program, led by key regulatory figures including Nepal Insurance Authority’s Executive Director Sushil Dev Subedi and Deputy Director Padam Prasad Sodari, aimed to enhance employee skills in compliance, reporting, and governance. Senior leadership, including CEO Raj Kumar Aryal and Deputy CEO Kabi Phuyal, actively participated, reflecting the company’s top-level commitment to regulatory adherence and ethical practices. With 143 branches nationwide, Sun Nepal Life is prioritizing sustainable and responsible growth by integrating capacity-building programs, digital monitoring systems, and ethical standards into its operations, reinforcing its position as a trusted and responsible market leader in Nepal’s life insurance sector.

articles.title: Sun Nepal Life Hosts AML/CFT Training to Strengthen Compliance and Risk Awareness
articles.content: Sun Nepal Life Insurance organized a specialized training on Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Combating the Financing of Terrorism (CFT) at Ratnagiri Resort in Nagarkot to enhance employee skills and ensure regulatory compliance. The session, led by Head of Legal Subash Bhandari, focused on global risks like money laundering, international AML/CFT standards, government and insurance authority directives, and practical workplace procedures. Senior officials and branch heads from Koshi, Madhesh, and Bagmati provinces attended. The company currently operates life insurance services through 143 branches nationwide.

articles.title: 2,24,728 Unit Right Shares (Auctioned) of SNLI Listed in NEPSE
articles.content: 2,24,728 units of right shares (Auction) of Sun Nepal Life Insurance Company Limited (SNLI) have been listed in NEPSE. SNLI had issued 10,696,320 unit right shares to it's shareholders from 30th Baishakh, 2082 to 3rd Ashadh, 2082. Out of the total issued units, only 10,471,592 units were subscribed, which has already been listed in NEPSE. The remaining 2,24,728 units of right shares were later sold via auction. The same remaining right shares are now listed in NEPSE. SNLI closed at Rs. 466.38 today.

articles.title: Sonapur Minerals Calls AGM With Election Agendas
articles.content:
Sonapur Minerals and Oil Limited (SONA) has called its 17th AGM on 29th Poush, 2081. The meeting will be held at Lisara Receptions, Naxal, Kathmandu, starting at 10:30 a.m. that day. These are the agendas of the AGM: 1) Endorsement of the annual report of the company.
2) Endorse the auditor's report of 2080/081 with PNL statements, financial reports, and cash flow reports.
3) Appointment of the auditor and determination of their remuneration for the fiscal year 2081/82.
4) To elect 4 boards of directors from the public shareholding group.

Following the latest directives from the Securities Board of Nepal (SEBON), this lock-in period will expire on 23rd Chaitra, 2080. SONA, with a total of 30,750,500 units of shares listed on the Nepal Stock Exchange (NEPSE). articles.title: Sonapur Minerals and Oil Limited Successfully Conducted 16th AGM
articles.content: Sonapur Minerals and Oil Limited (SONA) conducted its 16th annual general meeting on Magh 26, 2080 (Friday) at Hotel Mala Inn Pvt Ltd, Ghorahi, Dang. During the meeting, the chairman presented the financial report for the fiscal year 2079/80, which included discussions on profits and losses, cash flow, and other financial details. The company also approved the appointment of auditors and determined their remuneration. The Annual General Meeting also appointed Mr. Ankit Khadka and Rachana Kumari Ojha as representatives of public shareholders to the company's Board of Directors.

Sonapur Minerals and Oil Limited (SONA) has called its 16th AGM on 26th Magh, 2080. The meeting will be held at Hotel Mala Inn Pvt Ltd, Ghorahi, Dang, starting at 10:00 a.m. that day. These are the agendas of the AGM: 1) Endorsement of the annual report of the company.

articles.title: SONA Plummets 10% on First Trading Day: Market Faces Sharp Decline Amid Supply-Demand Imbalance
articles.content: Sonapur Minerals and Oil Limited (SONA), which debuted with much anticipation and had its IPO priced at Rs. 237.58 per share, witnessed a troublesome start, plunging by Rs. 35, hitting a negative circuit of 10% on its first day of trading. The company has a total of 30,750,500 unit shares listed in NEPSE. From its opening range of Rs. 142.01 to Rs. 426.03, the stock commenced at Rs. 350 but closed at a worrisome Rs. 315, indicating a challenging day for the new entrant. The scenario appeared to be a reflection of an imbalance in the market, evident in the disparity between the number of sellers and buyers. The prevailing downtrend could be attributed to an excess of supply over demand, leading to a stark decrease in the stock’s value. Notably, the downward trend was not limited to SONA alone. Manufacturing giants like GCIL and SHIVM were also affected, with their current trading prices at Rs. 396 and Rs. 500 respectively, signifying a broader market concern beyond a single company. The unsettling performance of these key companies contributed to a sharp drop in the NEPSE Index. Before the festive break, the market had seen a gain of 1.56%. However, the first trading day after the break took a surprising turn, experiencing a double-digit loss of 28.78 points, translating to a significant 1.51% downturn in the market, leaving investors and analysts on edge. The disparity in supply and demand, along with a general market sentiment downturn, prompted concerns among investors about the stability and trajectory of the Nepalese stock market as it navigates these turbulent times.

articles.title: IPO Shares of Sonapur Minerals and Oil Limited Listed In NEPSE; What are the Opening Ranges?
articles.content: 3,07,50,500 unit IPO shares of Sonapur Minerals and Oil Limited have been listed in NEPSE. This includes the shares held by promoters and the quantity issued to the general public and project-affected locals. The opening range for the first transaction is Rs. 142.01 to Rs. 426.03. The IPO shares will be traded in the secondary market the next day if the company signs an agreement with NEPSE. Out of a total of 3,07,50,500 unit shares, 9,732,544 unit IPO shares were issued to general public while 1,216,568 units were issued to Nepalese citizens working abroad at Rs. 237.58 per share (Rs. 100 face value + Rs. 137.58 premium price) from 14th Ashwin to 18th Ashwin, 2080. Note that the listed shares will traded under the symbol 'SONA'.

articles.title: IPO Allotment of Sonapur Minerals and Oil Limited Concludes: 10,40,770 Applicants Allotted 10 Units Each; Only 8,638 Applicants Return Empty-Handed
articles.content: The IPO allotment of Sonapur Minerals and Oil Limited is concluded today at the premises of the issue manager NIMB Ace Capital Limited, Kathmandu. Sonapur Minerals and Oil Limited had issued 97,32,544 unit IPO shares at par value of Rs 100 to the general public from Asoj 14 to Ashwin 18, 2080. Earlier, the company had issued 15,37,525 unit shares to the project-affected locals of Dang and Rolpa District out of which only 1,34,520 units were allotted to valid applicants. Thus, the remaining 14,03,005 units of unsubscribed shares of project-affected locals are added to 1,07,62,675 units (35% of the issued capital which is reserved for the general public) to make a total of 12,165,680 units for the general public. Out of the total 12,165,680 units; 10% i.e. 1,216,568 units have already been issued and allotted to Nepalese citizens working abroad, 608,284 units have been set aside for the mutual funds while 608,284 units have been set aside for the employees of the company. However, only 19,500 units were subscribed by employees and the remaining 588,784 units of unsubscribed shares of employees added to the general public. Thus  1,03,21,328 units are for the general public. The shares was issued for Rs. 225 per share (Rs 100 face value + Rs 125 premium price) for employees of the company and for the general public at a price of Rs. 237.58 (Rs. 100 face value + Rs. 137.58 premium price). The issue had received applications from 10,40,770 valid applicants who had applied for a total of 1,19,75,520 units. The issue was oversubscribed by more than 1.47 times. As per the allotment module, a total of 10,32,132 applicants were allotted 10 units each via lottery, and lucky 8 applicants got 1 unit extra and the remaining 8,638 applicants were returned with empty hands. A total of 608,284 units were allotted to the mutual funds and 19,500 units were allotted to the employees of the company. In total 5,689 applicants who applied for 94,370 units were disqualified. Allotment Modul

articles.content: The IPO allotment of Sonapur Minerals and Oil Limited will take place this Wednesday, i.e. on 24th Ashwin, 2080. The allotment program will be held at the premises of the issue manager NIMB Ace Capital Limited, Kathmandu at 9 AM. Out of the total 12,165,680 units; 10% i.e. 1,216,568 units were allotted to Nepalese citizens working abroad, 608,284 units were set aside for the mutual funds while 608,284 units were set aside for the employees of the company. The remaining 97,32,544 units were for the general public. The shares were issued for the general public at a price of Rs. 237.58 (Rs. 100 face value + Rs. 137.58 premium price). According to CDSC, 11,14,697 applicants applied for a total of 1,47,73,900 units worth Rs. 3.50 Arba as of closing day. Thus, the issue was oversubscribed by 1.51 times so far. Looking at the data, it is apparent that only 9,73,254 lucky applicants will get ownership of the company. Infomerics Credit Rating Nepal Limited (Infomerics Nepal) has assigned a long-term rating of IRN BBB-(Triple B Minus) to the long-term bank facilities and a short-term rating of IRN A3 (A Three) to the short-term bank facilities.

articles.title: Last Day to Grab Dividend Proposed by Mutual Funds of Sanima Capital Limited And Siddhartha Capital Limited
articles.content: Today is the last day to grab the Sanima Large Cap Fund and Sanima Growth Fund dividends. The meeting of the board of directors of Sanima Capital Limited held on Bhadra 14 has decided to distribute a 21.05% cash dividend (including tax) worth Rs. 25.26 Crore to the unitholders of Sanima Large Cap Fund (SLCF), and 15.79% cash dividend (including tax) worth Rs. 10.61 to the unitholders of Sanima Growth Fund (SAGF) for the fiscal year 2081/82. The book closure date is 6th Bhadra, 2082. Therefore, shareholders who have maintained their shares are entitled to a dividend payout and are eligible to attend this AGM. Similarly, Today is the last day to claim the dividends of Siddhartha Investment Growth Scheme 3, Siddhartha Equity Fund, and Siddhartha Investment Growth Scheme-2. In a meeting of the board of directors of Siddhartha Capital Limited decided to distribute a 20% cash dividend (including tax) worth Rs. 30 Crores for Siddhartha Equity Fund (SEF), 20% cash dividend (including tax) worth Rs. 24 Crores for Siddhartha Investment Growth Scheme-2 (SIGS2), and a 17% cash dividend (including tax) worth Rs. 13.69 Crores for Siddhartha Investment Growth Scheme 3 (SIGS3) for the fiscal year 2081/82. The book closure date is 6th Bhadra, 2082. Therefore, shareholders who have maintained their shares are entitled to a dividend payout and are eligible to attend this AGM.

articles.title: Reliable Nepal Life Insurance Celebrates 8 Years with Strong Performance and Community Initiatives
articles.content: Reliable Nepal Life Insurance Limited (RNLI) marked the completion of eight years in the life insurance business and entered its ninth year. The company expressed gratitude to its nearly 70 lakh policyholders, regulators, advisors, shareholders, employees, and media for their trust and support. RNLI reported a profit of Rs. 57 crore in the last fiscal year, a total capital of Rs. 5.19 Arba, and investments of around Rs. 20 Arba, while settling claims worth Rs. 1.43 Arba. To celebrate its annual event, RNLI organized a series of community-focused activities, including awareness rallies, blood donation drives, health camps, tree planting, distribution of educational and food materials to schools and old-age homes, and sanitation programs across multiple branches. The company reaffirmed its commitment to providing customer-friendly services and excellence in insurance operations while seeking continued support from stakeholders.

The same bonus shares are now listed in NEPSE. As of writing, RNLI has an LTP of Rs. 473.57 .

articles.title: Reminder! Last Day to Grab Dividend Proposed by Reliable Nepal Life Insurance Limited
articles.content: Today is the last day to grab the 12.6315% dividend that Reliable Nepal Life Insurance Limited (RNLI) proposed. The company called its AGM on 2nd Ashadh, 2082. The meeting will be held in the Amrapali Banquet, Bhatbhateni, Kathmandu, starting at 11 am that day. Among the other agendas, the AGM will endorse a 12.6315% dividend for FY 2080/81. The 151st board of directors meeting on Baishakh 23 decided to distribute the dividend on the paid-up capital of Rs. 4.64 Arba. 12% bonus shares worth Rs. 55.68 crore and 0.6315% cash dividend worth Rs 2.93 crore have been proposed. Therefore, shareholders who have maintained their shares to date are entitled to a dividend payout and are eligible to attend this AGM.

articles.title: Reliable Nepal Life Insurance Q2 Report: Net Profit Surges 52.76%, Net Premiums Rise 26.59%, Investment Income at Rs. 69.19 Crores
articles.content: Reliable Nepal Life Insurance Limited (RNLI) has delivered a remarkable financial performance in the second quarter of fiscal year 2081/82, achieving a 52.76% increase in net profit. The company’s net profit rose to Rs. 35.28 Crores, up from Rs. 23.09 Crores in the same quarter of the previous year. RNLI's financial base includes a paid-up capital of Rs. 4.64 Arba and a share premium of Rs. 1.75 Arba, with additional reserves comprising Rs. 1.04 Arba in retained earnings, Rs. 9.92 Crores in other equity, and Rs. 19.85 Crores in catastrophe reserves. The quarter saw a 26.59% growth in net premiums, totaling Rs. 2.21 Arba, alongside Rs. 69.19 Crores generated from investments, loans, and other financial activities. However, net claims surged by 28.35% to Rs. 2.10 Arba, and commission expenses rose by 10.39% to Rs. 24.13 Crores. RNLI’s key financial indicators remain strong, with an annualized earnings per share (EPS) of Rs. 15.21, a net worth per share of Rs. 166.66, and a Price-to-Earnings (P/E) ratio of 33.47. Report: * Figure is of Immediate Fiscal Year Ending

According to the financial report, the mutual fund scheme’s NAV stands at Rs. 9.67 as of Bhadra's end, 2082, which was Rs. 11.92 in the previous month. The scheme, which began with a total fund of Rs. 1.25 Arba, has invested Rs. 1.01 Arba in the listed shares and Rs. 40.43 lakhs in public issues, rights shares, and bonus shares. This scheme has Rs. 4.65 crores in the bank balance. The scheme has Rs. 3 crore in fixed deposits and has invested Rs. 11.88 crore in bonds and debentures. RBB Mutual Fund-1 posted a net loss of Rs. 4.35 crore in the month of Bhadra. It posted a net loss of Rs. 1.11 crores in the month before. Report: "RBB Mutual Fund-2 (RMF2)" has also unveiled its NAV report for the Bhadra month. It is a closed-end fund and has a maturity period of 10 years. According to the financial report, the mutual fund scheme’s NAV stands at Rs. 10.44 as of Bhadra's end, 2082, which was Rs. 12.02 in the previous month. The scheme, which began with a total fund of Rs. 84.61 crores, has invested Rs. 72.37 crores in the listed shares and Rs. 60.21 lakhs in public issues, rights shares, and bonus shares. This scheme has Rs. 5.49 crores in the bank balance. The scheme has Rs. 7 crores in fixed deposits and has invested Rs. 3.11 crores in bonds and debentures. RBB Mutual Fund-2 posted a net loss of Rs. 3.31 crores in the month of Bhadra. However, it posted a net loss of Rs. 99.94 lakhs in the month before that. Report:

articles.title: RBB Mutual Fund 1 Proposes 20% Cash Dividend And RBB Mutual Fund 2 Proposes 13% Cash Dividend for FY 2081/82; When is the Book Closure?
articles.content: "RBB Mutual Fund 1" and "RBB Mutual Fund 2" have announced dividends for the fiscal year 2081/82. In a meeting of the board of directors of RBB Merchant Banking Limited decided to distribute a 20% cash dividend (including tax) for RBB Mutual Fund 1 and a 13% cash dividend (including tax) for RBB Mutual Fund 2 for the fiscal year 2081/82. RBB Mutual Fund 1 is a closed-ended mutual fund with a 7-year maturity period, while RBB Mutual Fund 1 has a 10-year maturity period. Both funds are managed by RBB Merchant Banking Limited. As of the month of Ashadh, the Net Asset Value (NAV) of RMF1 is reported at Rs. 12.01, with a closing price of Rs. 10.22. RMF2's NAV stands at Rs. 12.14, with a closing price of Rs. 10.30. The book closure date for dividend eligibility is 9th Bhadra, meaning unit holders on record till 8th Bhadra are entitled to receive the dividend. Notice:

articles.title: Sanima Reliance Life Sponsors NPL 2 Trophy, Celebrates Cricket in Nepal
articles.content: Sanima Reliance Life Insurance Ltd. hosted the Nepal Premier League (NPL) 2 trophy at its Naxal headquarters, continuing as co-sponsor for the tournament starting from Mangsir 1 at Kirtipur Cricket Ground. Chairman Ratan Lal Kedia highlighted the growing importance and popularity of cricket in Nepal, emphasizing NPL as a platform to showcase top Nepali players internationally and boost their morale. The trophy features a black stone from Mount Everest, carefully brought by Nima Sherpa and Mingma David Sherpa, connecting it symbolically to the Himalayas with support from the Department of National Parks and Wildlife Conservation. Sanima Reliance Life, with over 169 branches, 20,000+ agents, 5+ billion NPR in capital, and 20+ billion NPR in investments, expressed pride in supporting the tournament and wished for its success.

articles.title: Sanima Reliance Life Honors Top Advisors at Club Achievers Event 2025
articles.content: Sanima Reliance Life Insurance Company Limited hosted its prestigious Club Achievers Event 2025 at Lemon Tree Premier, Budhanilkantha, to honor top-performing advisors who met exceptional sales and service targets in FY 2081-82. Advisors earning membership in exclusive clubs like Godhuli, Prithvi, Agni, Aakash, and Galaxy were formally recognized for their achievements. Chairman Ratan Lal Kedia and CEO Shivnath Pandey praised the advisors as the backbone of the company, emphasizing their role in expanding insurance awareness nationwide. The event also featured motivational sessions, entertainment, and strategic discussions to enhance professional growth. With record premium income of NPR 7.53 billion and net profit of NPR 377.4 million, the event reinforced the company’s mission of building a motivated, skilled, and customer-focused advisor network.

articles.title: Sanima Reliance Life Insurance Strengthens Compliance with AML/CFT and Ethics Training
articles.content: Sanima Reliance Life Insurance Limited has completed a two-day residential training program focused on corporate ethics, workplace culture, and compliance with anti–money laundering (AML) and counter-terrorist financing (CFT) regulations. The program, attended by senior executives and staff, included expert-led sessions from the Nepal Insurance Authority and Synergy Milestone, covering regulatory frameworks, red-flag indicators, and strategies for fostering ethical workplace values. CEO Shiva Nath Pandey emphasized full commitment to compliance and ethical standards. The initiative strengthens the company’s credibility, aligns with stricter directives from the Nepal Insurance Authority, and highlights its dedication to sustainable growth, employee education, and public trust.

articles.title: Sanima Reliance Life Insurance’s Bravo Annual Conclave 2082: Celebrating Success and Charting a Bold Future
articles.content: Sanima Reliance Life Insurance successfully held its three-day Bravo Annual Conclave 2082 in Kathmandu, gathering leadership and top performers to celebrate past achievements and plan for the future. The event highlighted the company’s remarkable collection of over NPR 7 billion in premiums in the previous fiscal year and emphasized motivation, teamwork, innovation, and digital transformation. Key leaders, including the Chairman and CEO, encouraged expanding the agent network, embracing challenges, and focusing on customer-centric services. The conclave also featured an awards ceremony recognizing outstanding employees and presented a strategic blueprint for FY 2082/83, aiming to introduce innovative products and strengthen market leadership. The event marked a renewed commitment to growth, innovation, and excellence in Nepal’s life insurance sector.

articles.title: Sanima Reliance Life Insurance Honors Top Agents at Star Agency Meet 2082, Celebrates NPR 700 Crore Milestone
articles.content: Sanima Reliance Life Insurance Limited (SRLI) successfully organized the “Star Agency Meet 2082” to reward top-performing agents of FY 2081/82 and motivate regional teams. The event recognized outstanding agents from Banepa, Chabahil, Kaushaltar, and Patan regions based on first-year premium collection, policy numbers, and team performance. Deputy CEO Nirajan Kandel highlighted the essential role of insurance advisors in the life insurance business and urged participants to apply their learnings to help elevate the company further. He also thanked agents for helping SRLI achieve over NPR 700 crore in premium collection during the fiscal year. More than 700 participants, including regional managers, area managers, and branch heads, attended the event. Regional top agents, including Namita Neupane (Kaushaltar), Ran Bahadur Tamang (Chabahil), Narayan Bahadur Gurung (Banepa), and Yogendra Maharjan (Patan), shared their strategies and commitment to maintaining top performance. The event also featured renowned speaker Sudeep Basnet, who emphasized the importance of cultivating effective habits for successful sales.

articles.title: 1.2489% Bonus Share of Sanima Reliance Life Insurance Listed in NEPSE
articles.content: 6,18,588 unit bonus shares of Sanima Reliance Life Insurance Limited (SRLI) have been listed in NEPSE. The company convened its 8th AGM on 8th Chaitra, 2081, and endorsed a 9.2489% dividend for the fiscal year 2080/81. The 38th Board of Directors meeting on Falgun 12 proposed a 9.2489% dividend for the fiscal year 2080/81. 1.2489% bonus shares and 9% cash dividends were proposed from the paid-up capital of Rs. 4.51 Arba. The same bonus shares are now listed in NEPSE. As of writing, SRLI has an LTP of Rs. 404.01.

articles.title: Sanima Reliance Life Insurance Offers 100% Late Fee Waiver to Renew Lapsed Policies
articles.content: Sanima Reliance Life Insurance has launched a special Lapsed Policy Renewal Campaign from May 15 to June 8 (Jestha 1–25), offering a 100% waiver on late fees for policyholders who missed their premium payment deadlines. This one-time waiver helps customers restore their life insurance coverage without financial penalties. The campaign aims to reduce the burden of late fees and encourage people to maintain continuous financial protection for themselves and their families. Renewals can be done at 169 branch offices or through online platforms for added convenience. The initiative reflects the company’s customer-first approach and commitment to strengthening financial security across Nepal.

articles.title: Sanima Reliance Life Strengthens AML/CFT Compliance with High-Level Training for Senior Officials
articles.content: Sanima Reliance Life Insurance Limited recently conducted a high-level training session on Anti-Money Laundering and Countering the Financing of Terrorism (AML/CFT) at Hotel Yak and Yeti, Kathmandu. The program, held in line with Clause 17(a) of the AML/CFT directive, targeted top-level officials, including board members, major shareholders, and department heads. Facilitated by experts from the Insurance Regulatory Authority, including Director Shambhu Raj Lamichhane and Deputy Director Sabita Thapa, the training focused on identifying financial crime risks, strengthening internal controls, and ensuring legal compliance. Key topics included governance responsibilities, internal policies, and operational procedures. Chairman Ratan Lal Kedia and CEO Shivanath Pandey emphasized the company’s dedication to national laws and global standards, reaffirming a zero-tolerance approach to financial crimes. The event was also aligned with Nepal’s national observance of Anti-Money Laundering Day on Magh 14, showcasing Sanima Reliance’s proactive leadership in fostering a compliant and ethical corporate culture.

articles.title: Prabhu Capital Declares Book Closure Date for Proposed Dividend of Prabhu Select Fund and Prabhu Smart Fund
articles.content: Prabhu Capital Limited has declared the book closure date for the dividend of its closed-end mutual fund scheme: 15th Bhadra, 2082. Thus, unit holders maintained until the 13th Bhadra are entitled to the dividend payout. The meeting of the board of directors of Prabhu Capital Limited has decided to distribute a 12% cash dividend to the unitholders of Prabhu Select Fund (PSF), and a 10% cash dividend (including tax) to the unitholders of Prabhu Smart Fund (PRSF) for the fiscal year 2081/82. Prabhu Select Fund is a closed-ended mutual fund with a 7-year maturity period, while Prabhu Smart Fund has a 10-year maturity period. Prabhu Capital Limited manages both funds sponsored by Prabhu Bank Limited. Book Close Notice:

articles.title: Public Ownership in Nepal Telecom to Rise to 30%
articles.content: The government has announced its plan to increase public ownership in Nepal Telecom by reducing its own stake. Presenting the budget for the upcoming fiscal year, Finance Minister Bishnu Prasad Paudel stated that the government will lower its current shareholding—currently exceeding 90%—to expand public participation. As per the new policy, the shareholding of the general public in Nepal Telecom will be raised to 30%, aligning with efforts to promote public ownership in state-owned enterprises.

articles.title: Nepal Telecom Reports 32.97% Decline in Net Profit in Q2 2081/82 Following Drops in Revenue and Other Income
articles.content: Nepal Doorsanchar Company Limited (NTC) has reported a net profit of Rs. 2.63 Arba in the second quarter (Q2) of the fiscal year 2081/82, marking a decline of 32.97% compared to Rs. 3.93 Arba in the same period of the previous year. The company's revenue from operations stood at Rs. 17 Arba, reflecting a slight decrease of 1.40% from Rs. 17.24 Arba in Q2 2080/81. Meanwhile, other income witnessed a significant drop of 38.11% to Rs. 2.51 Arba from Rs. 4.06 Arba. The telecom giant's paid-up capital stood at Rs. 18 Arba, while its other equity, including retained earnings, fell by 4.90% to Rs. 73.14 Arba. The company’s total investment, comprising both long-term and short-term assets, decreased by 19.69% to Rs. 44.61 Arba. Similarly, property, plant, and equipment declined by 4.81% to Rs. 45.99 Arba. However, trade receivables rose by 26.96% to Rs. 1.92 Arba. On the expense side, Nepal Telecom’s finance cost remained stable at Rs. 76.79 Crore, with a marginal decline of 0.19%. Operating and maintenance expenses were recorded at Rs. 3.14 Arba, down by 1.16% from the corresponding quarter last year. The company's annualized earnings per share (EPS) stands at Rs. 29.28, while its net worth per share is Rs. 506.34. The price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio at the quarter’s end was 30.33, and the current ratio, indicating liquidity strength, was recorded at 2.01. Report: *Figure is of Immediate Fiscal Year Ending

articles.title: Nepal Doorsanchar Company Limited Distributed Cash Dividends Directly to Shareholders' Bank Accounts
articles.content: Nepal Doorsanchar Company Limited (NTC) has been distributing 30% cash dividends directly to the bank accounts of its shareholders since 29th Poush, 2081 (today). The company convened its 17th AGM for the FY 2080/81 on 28th Poush, 2081. The company endorsed a cash dividend of Rs 30 per share, from the net profit of FY 2080/81. The same cash dividend is now being deposited. The company has urged its shareholders to dematerialize their shares if they haven't or are yet to update their bank information in the Demat account and are requested to do so to receive the dividend. Additionally, if eligible investors had taken a loan against the shares of the company before the book closure date should present a No Objection Letter from their lending institution to receive the dividend. According to the notice, some investors haven't collected the dividend for the fiscal year 2072/73 itself. The dividend payment is due in the fiscal year 2072/73 when the bank distributed a cash dividend. The company has urged investors who haven't claimed their share of dividends to be present with an identity at NMB Capital Limited, Baluwatar. Notice:

articles.title: Nepal Doorsanchar Company (NTC) Calls AGM; When's the Book Closure for Rs. 30 Per Share Cash Dividend?
articles.content: Nepal Doorsanchar Company Limited (NTC) has called its 17th AGM on 28th Poush, 2081. The AGM will be held in Rastriya Sabha Griha, Pradarshani Marg, Kathmandu, starting at 10 am that day. Among other proposals, the AGM will endorse the dividend for the fiscal year 2080/81. The 1047th meeting of the board of directors held on Poush 06, 2081 decided to distribute a Rs. 30 per share cash dividend to its shareholders on the paid-up capital of Rs. 18 Arba. Furthermore, an agenda is to endorse the auditor's report with PL statements, financial reports, and cash flow reports and appoint an auditor for the fiscal year 2081/82. The book closure date is from Poush 18 to Poush 28. Thus, investors maintained before that day are entitled to the dividend and can attend the AGM. AGM Notice:

articles.title: Nepal Telecom's Net Profit Drops 16.44% in Q4 FY 2080/81; Revenue and Investments Decline
articles.content: Nepal Telecom (NTC) has released its fourth-quarter financial results for the fiscal year 2080/81, revealing a 16.44% decline in net profit, which dropped to Rs. 6.62 Arba from Rs. 7.92 Arba in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. This decline is largely attributed to a 4.99% decrease in revenue from operations, which amounted to Rs. 34.46 Arba. The company also reported a significant 22.52% reduction in its investments, now standing at Rs. 55.76 Arba, alongside a 16.68% drop in finance income, which totaled Rs. 6.48 Arba. On a positive note, Nepal Telecom's reserves and surplus slightly increased by 0.83% to Rs. 76.58 Arba. Additionally, the company successfully reduced its operating and maintenance expenses by 12.98%, bringing them down to Rs. 6.64 Arba. Despite these cost-saving measures, the overall financial performance was impacted, with the annualized Earnings Per Share (EPS) declining to Rs. 36.77 from Rs. 44.00 in the previous year. The Net Worth per Share was reported at Rs. 525.43. Report: Major Financial Highlights:

articles.title: Nepal Telecom to Suspend Services for Four Hours Tonight
articles.content: Various services provided by Nepal Telecom will be suspended for four hours tonight, starting from 11 PM. The company announced that services such as balance recharge, package purchase, and queries will be temporarily unavailable during this period due to an upgrade of the billing system. Nepal Telecom has urged customers to complete their balance recharges and package purchases beforehand. Other services, including Mobile Voice, Data, SMS, PSTN/FTTH, Voice/Data/IPTV, will remain operational as usual. For any service-related issues like Recharge or Package Subscription, customers are advised to contact the hotline numbers: 1498 and 198.

articles.title: Government Invites Applications for Managing Director Position at Nepal Telecom
articles.content: The government has announced the opening of applications for the position of Managing Director at Nepal Doorsanchar Company Limited (NTC). The Ministry of Communication and Information Technology (MoCIT) issued an official notice today, inviting qualified individuals to apply for the role. The notice outlines the requirements and qualifications necessary for the position, encouraging interested candidates to step forward. Qualified applicants are directed to contact the Institute Coordination Branch of the MoCIT for further information and application details. The ministry aims to attract capable and experienced professionals to lead Nepal Telecom in its ongoing development and service expansion.

articles.title: Nepal Doorsanchar Company (NTC) Reports Incremental Growth in Q3 Net Profits, Achieving Rs. 5.59 Arba; EPS at Rs. 41.44
articles.content: Nepal Doorsanchar Company Limited (NTC), popularly known as Nepal Telecom, has recently unveiled its third-quarter report for the fiscal year 2080/81, indicating a notable uptick in Net Profits compared to the corresponding quarter in the previous fiscal year. In Q3, the company achieved a Net Profit of Rs. 5.59 Arba, showing an incline from Rs. 5.41 Arba in the corresponding quarter of FY 2079/2080. Despite a marginal decrease of 6.82% in revenue, totaling Rs. 25.48 Arba, NTC showcased substantial growth in income from other sources, with a remarkable surge of 229.08% to reach Rs. 53.02 Crores from Rs. 16.11 Crores in the third quarter of the previous fiscal year. In terms of expenses, NTC witnessed a reduction in administrative costs by 5.28% to Rs. 5.84 Arba, alongside a 5.8% decrease in operating and maintenance expenses, totaling Rs. 4.97 Arba compared to Rs. 5.28 Arba in the corresponding quarter of FY 2080/81. NTC has significantly augmented its investments, reaching a cumulative figure of Rs. 65.23 Arba, encompassing both long-term and short-term investments. The company maintains a paid-up capital of Rs. 18 Arba and possesses Rs. 74.33 arba in reserves and surplus. Key financial metrics for NTC include an annualized Earning per Share (EPS) of Rs. 41.44, a net worth per share of Rs. 512.99, and a Price-to-Earnings (P/E) ratio of 20.13 times. Click here for the Q3 report: Major Financial Highlights: * Figures are of the Previous Year's Quarter Ending (Ashad 31, 2080)

articles.title: Nepal Telecom and Civil Aviation Authority of Nepal (CAAN) Collaborate to Introduce Free Wi-Fi Services at Airports
articles.content: Nepal Telecom and the Civil Aviation Authority of Nepal (CAAN) have officially inked an agreement to offer free Wi-Fi internet services at all airports across Nepal. The memorandum was formalized through the signing of the agreement by representatives from both organizations. As part of this collaboration, Nepal Telecom has committed to the initial implementation of free Wi-Fi networks at Tribhuvan International Airport, with plans to subsequently extend this service to other airports throughout the country. CAAN, in turn, will play a crucial role in facilitating the installation process by identifying suitable locations for the placement of necessary equipment. In addition to the introduction of free Wi-Fi, CAAN is set to further enhance passenger convenience by providing mobile charging stations at the airports. This initiative aims to address the increasing need for travelers to stay connected and charged during their time at the airports. Nepal Telecom is going a step further by establishing an information and assistance room within the airports. This dedicated space is designed to cater to the needs of travelers, providing them with support and information to ensure a seamless and enjoyable airport experience.
