articles.title: Lumbini Bikas Bank Honours Record-Holding Climber Kami Rita Sherpa
articles.content: Lumbini Bikas Bank Limited (LBBL) organized a felicitation program on Kartik 23, 2082, to honor record-setting mountaineer Kami Rita Sherpa for his 31st successful ascent of Mt. Everest. During the climb, Sherpa carried a banner bearing the bank’s logo to the summit. Chief Executive Officer Naresh Singh Bohara presented the honor, wishing him continued success. Kami Rita, associated with Lumbini Bikas Bank for over two decades, expressed pride in his achievement, noting it as an honor for himself, his family, the Sherpa community, and the entire nation. The bank, operating 89 branches and one extension counter across all seven provinces, continues to provide modern and secure banking services under the motto Continuous Partnership.

articles.title: NRB Takes Action Against Saptakoshi and Lumbini Development Banks
articles.content: Nepal Rastra Bank (NRB) has taken regulatory action against Saptakoshi Development Bank and Lumbini Bikas Bank following its recent inspection report for the first quarter of the current fiscal year. Saptakoshi has been placed under prompt corrective action after failing to maintain the required Capital Adequacy Ratio (CAR), while Lumbini’s board has been cautioned for revising the service facilities of its CEO in violation of regulatory provisions. The central bank found that Saptakoshi’s CAR stood at 7.51% as of Ashad-end 2082, which is 24.9% lower than the mandatory 10% threshold. Even after adjustments for loan loss provisions, the bank’s capital ratio remained below the required level in the previous fiscal year as well. NRB’s report further pointed out issues such as loan term extensions without proper documentation, unreliable loan loss data, and failure to comply with reporting standards. Consequently, CEO Dinesh Kumar Pokharel has been formally warned, and the board of directors instructed to strengthen internal governance. In the case of Lumbini Bikas Bank, NRB discovered that the board had increased the CEO’s benefits shortly after his reappointment for a second term, which breached regulatory norms. As a result, the central bank issued a caution notice to the former board members, directing them to prevent such non-compliance in the future and to ensure transparency in executive compensation decisions.

articles.title: Lumbini Bikas Bank Honors Kami Rita Sherpa as He Heads for Historic 31st Everest Ascent
articles.content: Lumbini Bikas Bank Limited organized a special event to extend best wishes to record-holding mountaineer Kami Rita Sherpa as he embarks on his 31st successful ascent of Mt. Everest. A long-time partner of the bank, Kami Rita will carry the bank’s logo banner to the summit for the third time. Recognizing his achievements, CEO Naresh Singh Bohora handed over the banner during the ceremony. Kami Rita highlighted that this climb is a matter of pride not just for him but also for his family, the Sherpa community, and all of Nepal. Operating across all 7 provinces, Lumbini Bikas Bank runs 89 branches and 1 extension counter, providing modern and secure banking services under the slogan “Nirantar Sahayatra” (Continual Partnership).

articles.title: 3% Bonus Share of Lumbini Bikas Bank Listed in NEPSE
articles.content: 10,55,440.24 unit bonus shares of Lumbini Bikas Bank Ltd. (LBBL) have been listed in NEPSE. The company convened its 17th AGM on 29th Poush, 2081, and endorsed 3% bonus shares worth Rs. 10.55 crores and 4% cash dividend (including tax) worth Rs 14.07 crores from the paid-up capital of Rs. 14.07 Crores. The same bonus shares are now listed in NEPSE. As of writing, LBBL has an LTP of Rs. 421. .

articles.title: Lumbini Bikas Bank Joins NEPALPAY Card Scheme to Boost Nepal’s Domestic Card Ecosystem
articles.content: Lumbini Bikas Bank Limited has partnered with Nepal Clearing House Limited (NCHL) to become a principal member of the National Card Switch (NPS-NCS) and the domestic card scheme, NEPALPAY. This partnership allows Lumbini Bikas Bank to issue and acquire NEPALPAY cards for its customers. The NPS-NCS infrastructure aims to improve the domestic card transaction system by ensuring interoperability, reducing costs, and supporting data localization. The commercial rollout of NEPALPAY is expected to enhance Nepal's card ecosystem, with Lumbini Bikas Bank serving over 5 lakh customers nationwide.

articles.title: ICRA Nepal’s Critical Update: Maruti Cements & Lumbini Bikas Bank Under Negative Watch
articles.content: ICRA Nepal Limited has reaffirmed the Issuer Rating of [ICRANP-IR] BBB@ for Maruti Cements Limited, maintaining a ‘Watch with Negative Implications.’ This rating indicates a moderate degree of safety regarding timely financial obligations but also signifies moderate credit risk. The ‘@’ symbol denotes that the rating is under watch due to potential negative developments. The rating reflects the general creditworthiness of the company rather than any specific debt instrument. In ICRA’s rating system, BBB+ is one notch higher than BBB, while BBB- is one notch lower. Similarly, ICRA Nepal Limited has reaffirmed the [ICRANP-IR] BB@ issuer rating for Lumbini Bikas Bank Limited, maintaining a ‘Watch with Negative Implications.’ This rating indicates a moderate risk of default in meeting financial obligations. The ‘@’ symbol signifies that the rating remains under watch due to potential negative developments. The rating reflects the bank’s overall creditworthiness rather than any specific debt instrument. In ICRA’s rating system, BB+ is one notch higher than BB, while BB- is one notch lower.

articles.content: 31,63,000 unit right shares of People's Power Limited (PPL) have been listed in NEPSE. The company issued a 1:0.50 ratio right share i.e., 31,63,000 units to its shareholders from 22nd Ashadh to 26th Shrawan, 2082. Out of which only 27,71,221 units were allotted to the eligible shareholders of the company. The remaining 3,91,779 units of unsubscribed right shares were later sold through an auction from the 15th Bhadra to the 22nd Bhadra, 2082. articles.title: People's Power Limited Halts Operations Following Flood and Landslide Damage
articles.content: People's Power Limited has temporarily suspended electricity production at its Puwa 2 Hydropower Project (4.96 MW) after heavy rainfall triggered floods and landslides, causing damage to multiple structures in the project’s headworks area. The company reported that continuous high water levels in the Puwa Khola have prevented a detailed assessment and valuation of the damage so far. Due to these exceptional circumstances, the project remains non-operational, and electricity generation has been completely halted. People’s Power Limited has assured stakeholders that restoration efforts will commence once the situation stabilizes and further information regarding the extent of damage will be shared in due course.

articles.title: Bids Received in Auction of People's Power Limited Ordinary Shares Opened; What is the Cut-Off Rate?
articles.content: People's Power Limited (PPL) opened the bids for its ordinary shares (unsold right shares) auction on 30th Bhadra, 2082. Prabhu Capital Limited was appointed as the auction manager. The bidding process took place at the Prabhu Capital Limited premises in Kamaladi, Kathmandu, starting at 9:00 am. The auction opened on 15th Bhadra 2082 and concluded on 22nd Bhadra 2082, at the end of banking hours. In total, 3,91,779 units of ordinary right shares were auctioned. Individuals and companies were all eligible to bid in the auction. This is the unclaimed portion of the rights offering. The company opened a 1:0.50 ratio right share issue to its shareholders from 22nd Ashadh to 26th Shrawan, 2082. The same unsold rights shares were auctioned to the general public. The minimum bid rate for the auction was Rs. 100. While the minimum bid quantity for shares was 100 units, there was no upper limit. Although bidders could bid for the entirety of the issue, they were required to abide by the regulatory body's rule not to exceed the specified quantity of shares per entity. With 602 applications received for ordinary right shares, the tentative cut-off rate is Rs. 261.50, according to the auction manager. Once all cheques are reconciled and cleared, the cut-off prices may be subject to change. The last traded price of the scrip stands at Rs. 299.20 per share.

articles.title: Swet-Ganga Hydropower Posts Rs. 10.25 Crore Profit in Q2, Reversing Loss from Previous Year; EPS at Rs. 12.88
articles.content: Swet-Ganga Hydropower & Construction Limited (SGHC) has delivered a strong financial performance in the second quarter of the fiscal year 2081/82, reporting a net profit of Rs. 10.25 crores. This marks a significant turnaround from the net loss of Rs. 2.53 lakhs recorded in the same period last year. The impressive recovery is primarily driven by a 10.85% increase in power sales revenue, which rose to Rs. 51.26 crores from Rs. 46.24 crores in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. Additionally, the company managed to reduce administrative expenses by 1.81%, although finance costs saw a 22.13% increase. SGHC maintains a paid-up capital of Rs. 1.59 Arba, while its retained earnings showed a deficit of Rs. 34.21 crores in the previous year. The company’s property, plant, and equipment assets grew by 7.48% to Rs. 1.82 crores, and long-term borrowings decreased by 2.60% to Rs. 4.58 Arba. For shareholders, the company reported an annualized Earnings Per Share (EPS) of Rs. 12.88, with a net worth per share of Rs. 78.54. SGHC's Price-to-Earnings (P/E) ratio stands at 39.83, with the stock trading at Rs. 513 per share.

articles.title: Swet-Ganga Hydropower Set to Conclude Lock-in Period for 38,51,000 Units Shares on 2nd Falgun
articles.content: Swet-Ganga Hydropower & Construction Limited (SGHC) has announced the expiration of the lock-in period for Dolma Impact-1 (Foreign Investor) shares, in accordance with the Securities Board of Nepal (SEBON) guidelines. The lock-in period concludes on Falgun 2, 2080. SGHC, listed on the Nepal Stock Exchange (NEPSE) with 15,930,000 units of shares, highlights that Dolma Impact-1 holds 38,51,000 units of shares that were subject to the lock-in period. Following the specified date, these shares will be eligible for trading. Notably, under Private Equity/Venture Capital (PE/VC) guidelines, the standard lock-in period is typically one year after the shares are allotted, deviating from the general three-year lock-in period. In the case of SGHC, the company adheres to a one-year lock-in period following the resignation of a director. Consequently, the aforementioned shares are scheduled to be released on the 2nd of Falgun as per this one-year timeframe. Dolma Impact Fund, established by the Dolma Foundation in 2003, focuses on poverty alleviation through investments in education, health, and sustainable businesses. Dolma Fund Management, founded in 2014, launched Dolma Impact Fund I (Dolma I), investing in sectors aligned with Nepal's SDGs. Dolma I received USD 36.6 million in investments, and its successor, Dolma II, closed at USD 71.96 million in 2022. Dolma, managing over USD 100 million, is Nepal's largest private equity fund manager, contributing to SDGs and adhering to international ESG standards. Notice:

articles.title: Siddhartha Premier Insurance Sees Moderate Profit Growth in Q4; Investment Income Slumps
articles.content: Siddhartha Premier Insurance (SPIL) closed the fourth quarter of FY 2081/82 with a net profit of Rs. 71.31 crore, marking a 3.63% rise from Rs. 68.81 crore in the same period last year. Earnings per share increased to Rs. 25.41, compared to Rs. 24.52 a year earlier. Net premium income advanced by 11.58% to Rs. 2.05 Arba, but income from investment, loans, and other sources plunged by 35.18% to Rs. 47.59 crore. Net claim payments eased by 5.29% to Rs. 1.13 Arba. The insurer’s balance sheet showed insurance funds climbing 16.02% to Rs. 5.75 Arba, while total investments dipped 3.27% to Rs. 9 Arba. Paid-up capital remained steady at Rs. 2.80 Arba, with a solvency ratio of 3.18. Despite the profit uptick, retained earnings dropped 13.21% to Rs. 95.51 crore, and net worth per share edged down to Rs. 274.56 from Rs. 276.63. articles.title: Siddhartha Premier Insurance Boasts Remarkable 138.56% Surge in Net Premiums, Accompanied by 109.65% Jump in Net Profit for Q3
articles.content: Siddhartha Premier Insurance Limited (SPIL) has announced its third-quarter financial results for the fiscal year 2080/2081, showing a remarkable surge in net profit. The company's net profit jumped by 109.65% to Rs. 59.71 crores from Rs. 28.48 crores in the same quarter of the previous fiscal year. SPIL's has a paid-up capital of Rs. 2.8 Arba and a share premium of Rs. 4.75 lakhs. The company also holds substantial reserves, including Rs. 71.02 Crores in retained earnings, Rs. 96.04 Crores in other equity, Rs. 16.74 crores in catastrophe reserves, and Rs. 2.5 Arba as special reserves. During the quarter, Siddhartha Premier Insurance saw a notable increase of 138.56% in net premiums, reaching Rs. 1.32 Arba in Q3 FY 2080/81 compared to the same period last year. The company also generated Rs. 52.73 Crores from income derived from investments, loans, and other financial activities. After the third quarter ended in Chaitra 2080, the company sold 20,73,446 promoter shares of Nepal Reinsurance Company (NRIC) at Rs. 280 per share, resulting in a net profit before tax of Rs. 41.71 crores. However, there was a significant 93.09% increase in net claims during the quarter, totaling Rs. 66.25 Crores. Key financial metrics further highlight SPIL's performance, with an annualized earnings per share (EPS) of Rs. 28.37 and a net worth per share of Rs. 254.59. articles.title: Shangrila Development Bank Proposes 10.3583% Dividend for FY 2081/82
articles.content: Shangrila Development Bank Limited (SADBL) has proposed a 10.3583% dividend worth Rs. 36.83 crores for the fiscal year 2081/82. The 374th meeting of the board of directors held on Kartik 28 decided to distribute the dividend on the paid-up capital of Rs. 3.55 Arba. 5% bonus shares and 5.3583% cash dividend (for tax purposes) have been proposed. Thus, the bonus shares are a little over Rs. 17.78 crores, and the cash dividend is worth Rs. 19.05 Crores. The dividend will be distributed only after approval by the central bank and endorsement by the company's upcoming AGM. As of writing, SADBL has an LTP of Rs. 391.10. Dividend History:

articles.title: Shangrila Development Bank Celebrates 21st Anniversary with Social Initiatives
articles.content: Shangrila Development Bank Limited (SADBL) celebrated its 21st anniversary at its central office in Baluwatar. Bank officials, including Chairman Ujwal Satyal and CEO Suyog Shrestha, expressed gratitude to stakeholders and reaffirmed commitment to providing modern, smart banking services. As part of the celebration, SADBL launched the “Warmth with Care” campaign in collaboration with Lead for Nepal, collecting warm clothes through 10 clusters for flood-affected citizens in Ilam. Additionally, a blood donation program saw 32 participants, and 20 employees completing 5, 10, and 15 years of service were honored. Currently operating 109 branches and 30 ATMs, SADBL emphasizes strong governance, risk management, and internal control, and pledges to continue expanding services while maintaining public trust.

articles.title: Shangrila Development Bank Joins SCT-UnionPay Card Network
articles.content: Shangrila Development Bank Limited (SADBL) has partnered with SCT-UnionPay, allowing its customers to obtain SCT-UnionPay cards directly from the bank. This collaboration aims to make digital payments more convenient, accessible, and secure. SCT, Nepal’s first domestic card scheme, has been providing reliable payment services for over two decades. Shangrila Development Bank, with 109 branches and 30 ATMs nationwide, continues to uphold strong governance, risk management, and internal controls, while committing to further expand its services in the future.

articles.title: Shangrila Development Bank Supports Darbarmarg Police Circle with CSR Contribution
articles.content: Shangrila Development Bank Limited (SADBL) has donated two computers, a scanner, and a photocopier to the Darbarmarg Police Circle under its Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) initiative. The support aims to assist in resuming police operations after recent fire damage caused by protests. The equipment was handed over by COO Mr. Apoorba Prasad Joshi to DSP Rajkumar Shrestha, who acknowledged the contribution while noting that more support is still needed due to extensive losses. Shangrila Bank, currently operating 109 branches and 30 ATMs nationwide, reaffirmed its commitment to expanding services while upholding strong governance, risk management, and internal control practices.

articles.title: 89,759 Promoter Shares of Shangrila Development Bank in Auction from Today
articles.content: The existing promoter of Shangrila Development Bank Limited (SADBL) is auctioning 89,759 units of shares to the general public/institutions from today. 89,759 units of promoter shares of SADBL will be auctioned. Interested general public/institutions are eligible to bid for the auction within 15 days from the date of publication of this notice, i.e., 12th Bhadra The shareholders should submit their bids at the central office of the bank located at Baluwatar, Kathmandu. No bids were received from existing founder shareholders within the specified timeframe; the shares are auctioned to the general public. SADBL closed at Rs. 448.75. Meanwhile, SADBLP has an LTP of Rs. 197.00. Notice

articles.title: SADBL Partners with Kids Clinic to Offer Health Service Discounts for Customers and Staff
articles.content: Shangrila Development Bank Limited (SADBL) has signed an agreement with Kids Clinic, Mid Baneshwor, Kathmandu, to provide discounts on medical services. Under the agreement, SADBL shareholders and employees will receive 15% off on OPD, lab services, and medicines, while customers using debit cards or mobile banking will get 10% off. The agreement was signed by Manohar Mahotra, Manager of SADBL Baluwatar Branch, and Dr. Pushparaj Awasthi, Director of Kids Clinic. SADBL currently operates 109 branches and 30 ATMs nationwide, while Kids Clinic is run by pediatric specialists.

articles.title: Shangrila Development Bank Provides Insurance Payout for Minor’s Savings Account After Guardian’s Death
articles.content: Shangrila Development Bank Limited (SADBL) has transferred an insurance payout to the family of a minor account holder, Shristi Tripathi, after the accidental death of her guardian, Sagar Tripathi. The bank’s Talchowk branch manager, Rajib Paudel, handed over a check of Rs. 300,000 to Shristi and her mother, Shila Tripathi. The amount has been deposited in a fixed-term account and will be accessible to Shristi upon turning 18. SADBL has a policy to provide Rs. 300,000 insurance for minors’ accounts in the event of a guardian’s death. Operating across 109 branches and 30 ATMs, the bank continues to uphold strong governance, risk management, and internal controls while expanding its services nationwide.

articles.title: Global IME Bank Partners with Shangrila Development Bank to Provide Non-Fund-Based Banking Services
articles.content: Global IME Bank Limited and Shangrila Development Bank Limited (SADBL) have signed a memorandum of understanding to provide non-fund-based banking services to SADBL customers. Under this agreement, Global IME Bank will offer services such as letters of credit, bank guarantees, documents against payment/acceptance, and trade transaction banking. Global IME Bank, recognized as Nepal’s best bank in 2024 and 2025, operates over 350 branches, 384 ATMs, and 1,000+ service points nationwide, also providing international remittance services. Shangrila Development Bank serves customers through 109 branches and 30 ATMs across Nepal.

articles.title: Shangri-La Development Bank Urges Shareholders to Claim Uncollected Cash Dividend
articles.content: Shangri-La Development Bank Limited (SADBL) has issued a public notice urging its shareholders to claim unclaimed cash dividends and for depositors to reactivate dormant accounts. The bank informed that cash dividends declared in various general meetings up to the fiscal year 2081/82, which have exceeded a five-year claim period, remain unclaimed by some shareholders. Shareholders who have not yet received their pending dividends are requested to contact the bank’s share registrar, NIMB ACE Capital Limited, located in Lazimpat, Kathmandu, to claim their amounts promptly. In addition, the bank has appealed to depositors whose accounts have remained inactive or dormant for ten years or more to visit their respective branches with the necessary documentation to reactivate their accounts. The notice emphasizes that unclaimed dividends and deposits will be handled according to prevailing laws if not claimed within the stipulated period. Shangri-La Development Bank has also made the details of unclaimed dividends, shareholders, and dormant accounts available on its official website, for shareholders and depositors to verify their records. Furthermore, accounts with zero balance and no transactions for the past ten years will be closed, and details of such accounts are also available on the bank’s website. The bank has urged all concerned shareholders and depositors to take prompt action to secure their dividends and reactivate inactive accounts to ensure uninterrupted access to banking services. articles.title: Nepal Life Insurance Becomes First Insurer to Receive Double A Minus Rating from ICRA Nepal
articles.content: Nepal Life Insurance Company Limited, Nepal’s most trusted life insurer, has received a prestigious Double A Minus (ICRA NP AA–) credit rating from ICRA Nepal, the highest in the country’s life insurance sector. This rating signifies very high safety and a strong capacity to meet financial obligations on time. The recognition reflects Nepal Life’s robust financial stability, leading 27% market share, and 150.40% solvency ratio, well above the regulatory minimum. The company manages over 190 branches, maintains an investment portfolio exceeding NPR 240 billion, and has paid more than NPR 67 billion in claims. With 98.8% of its business in traditional life insurance and a disaster fund of NPR 1.32 billion, it demonstrates strong long-term stability. CEO Pravin Raman Parajuli expressed gratitude to all stakeholders, emphasizing Nepal Life’s commitment to diversifying investments, strengthening financial resilience, and adhering to best national and international practices to ensure sustainable growth and trust.

articles.title: ICRA Nepal Assigns AA- Credit Rating to Nepal Life Insurance for High Financial Safety
articles.content: ICRA Nepal Limited has assigned an issuer rating of [ICRANP-IR] AA- to Nepal Life Insurance Company Limited, indicating a high degree of safety in meeting financial obligations and very low credit risk. The rating reflects the company’s strong creditworthiness but is a general opinion, not tied to any specific debt instrument. The “AA-” rating falls one notch below “AA” and one above “A+” in the rating scale.

articles.title: Project Care: Nepal Life Leads Everest Clean-Up to Tackle Mountaintop Pollution
articles.content: Mount Everest is facing a growing pollution crisis, and Nepal Life Insurance Company, in partnership with Round Table Nepal, has launched “Project Care,” an Everest Clean-Up Campaign. The first phase successfully collected 5,000 kg of waste, with plans to manage an additional 25,000 kg. Biodegradable waste is disposed of responsibly at base camp, while non-biodegradable waste, including plastics, climbing gear, and oxygen cylinders, is transported to Kathmandu for recycling through Khaalisisi, promoting a circular economy. Supported by the Sagarmatha Pollution Control Committee (SPCC), the campaign exemplifies effective corporate social responsibility, collaborative environmental action, and innovative logistical solutions. The initiative demonstrates that strategic partnerships can tackle even the most challenging environmental problems while preserving Nepal’s natural heritage for future generations.

articles.title: Nepal Life Insurance Concludes Grand Leadership Excellence Awards 2025, Honoring 440 Top Achievers
articles.content: Nepal Life Insurance Company, Nepal’s most trusted life insurer, successfully concluded its three-day Leadership Excellence Awards 2025 at The Soaltee, Kathmandu, from Shrawan 16–18 under the theme "Lion Year: Lead, Roar, Repeat." The grand event saw the participation of 440 top-performing agents, agency managers, and company staff from across the country. The program was inaugurated by board members Kamlesh Kumar Agrawal, Bimal Dhakal, and CEO Praveen Raman Parajuli. Leaders praised agents for achieving a historic milestone of NPR 10 billion in first-year premiums during FY 2081/82 despite economic challenges. The event included motivational speeches, strategic insights for FY 2082/83, and appreciation for contributions to the company’s growth. A total of 440 high achievers were honored: 111 agency managers and 329 individual agents, with 96 awarded the Samrat Padak, 87 the Ratna Padak, and 257 the Samriddhi Padak. National-level winners also received cash awards. Motivational speaker and comedian Sandeep Chhetri delivered a special performance to conclude the event.

articles.title: Nepal Life Insurance Bags Silver in NBPA-2024, Becomes First Life Insurer to Win Prestigious Reporting Award
articles.content: Nepal Life Insurance Company, Nepal's most trusted life insurance provider, has been honored with the Silver Award in the National Best Presented Annual Report Award (NBPA-2024) by the Institute of Chartered Accountants of Nepal (ICAN). The award was conferred for the fiscal year 2080/81, recognizing the company’s excellence in financial reporting, transparency, accountability, and adherence to both national and international standards. This makes Nepal Life the first life insurance company in Nepal to receive such recognition. The award was presented by Auditor General Toyam Raya to CEO Pravin Raman Parajuli and Deputy CEO Amit Kumar Keyal at an event in Hotel Radisson. CEO Parajuli expressed pride in the achievement and emphasized the company's continued commitment to financial transparency and good governance. He also extended gratitude to stakeholders, including board members, policyholders, agents, employees, shareholders, and regulatory bodies.

articles.title: Nepal Life Achieves Historic Rs. 10 Arba First Premium Milestone
articles.content: Nepal Life Insurance Company Limited (NLIC), Nepal’s most trusted life insurance provider, has achieved a historic milestone by earning Rs. 10 Arba in first premium income as it approaches its 25th anniversary. CEO Pravin Raman Parajuli extended gratitude to the board, policyholders, agents, employees, shareholders, regulators, and all stakeholders for their support. He emphasized that this achievement sets a benchmark in the insurance sector and reaffirms NLIC’s commitment to innovation, investment diversification, skill development, and delivering world-class insurance services using technology-driven solutions.

articles.title: Nepal Life Contributes Rs. 10 Million to Boost Child Healthcare Infrastructure
articles.content: Nepal Life Insurance Company has provided Rs. 1 crore to the Kathmandu Institute of Child Health (KIOCH) under its corporate social responsibility (CSR) program to support the construction of a multi-specialty children's hospital in Budhanilkantha, Kathmandu. The agreement was signed by Dr. Bhagwan Koirala, KIOCH's founding chairperson, and Nepal Life CEO Pravin Raman Parajuli. KIOCH’s hospital project is in its final phase, with a clinical research building already operational. During the signing event, both parties expressed their commitment to improving pediatric healthcare in Nepal. Nepal Life highlighted its ongoing CSR efforts and pledged future support for establishing similar hospitals across all provinces. Dr. Koirala appreciated Nepal Life’s contribution, stating it would accelerate the project and strengthen their mission. KIOCH aims to function as a national resource center for pediatric healthcare, training, policy development, and quality standards. The organization has already launched its first operational hospital, KIOCH-Damak, which offers a full range of pediatric services, including emergency care, intensive care units, and modular operating theaters.

articles.title: Nepal Life Insurance Powers Kathmandu Skills Fair 2082 to Empower Youth and Boost Employment
articles.content: Nepal Life Insurance Company has partnered as an institutional collaborator in the 'Kathmandu Metropolitan Skills Fair 2082' organized by Kathmandu Metropolitan City, showcasing its strong commitment to corporate social responsibility. The fair aims to provide free training in 37 professions across 10 fields, targeting unemployed youth, residents, taxpayers, and returnees from abroad. CEO Pravin Raman Parajuli emphasized the importance of the fair in equipping youth with self-employment skills and bridging the gap between workforce supply and demand. Nepal Life sees the initiative not just as a training event, but as a transformative campaign for national prosperity and youth empowerment. The fair, operating under the slogan "Employment and Income Growth, Prosperity of Kathmandu," is part of a three-year national pride project. It is conducted daily in three shifts and accommodates 25 trainees per session. Participants have expressed optimism about the future opportunities the training will bring. Kathmandu Metropolitan representative Devendra KC praised the public-private collaboration, especially Nepal Life’s involvement. With over 3 million insured individuals, Nepal Life reaffirmed its ongoing commitment to providing quality services and supporting socially impactful initiatives like this skills fair.

articles.title: Sanima Bank Offers Up to 20% Discount on Daraz 11:11 Campaign Purchases
articles.content: Sanima Bank has announced a special discount offer for customers shopping on Daraz during the 11:11 campaign from November 11 to 21, 2025. Customers making pre-payments through Sanima Bank’s cards can enjoy a 15% discount (up to Rs. 1,500) on debit card transactions and a 20% discount (up to Rs. 2,000) on credit card transactions. Discounts will be available on a first-come, first-served basis, and customers must collect vouchers from the Daraz platform to redeem them. The offer is part of Sanima Bank’s ongoing initiative to promote digital payments. The bank currently operates 134 offices and 127 ATMs across all seven provinces.

articles.title: Sanima Bank Appoints Pawan Kumar Acharya as New CEO
articles.content: Sanima Bank Limited has announced the appointment of Mr. Pawan Kumar Acharya as its new Chief Executive Officer (CEO). According to the decision made by the bank’s Board of Directors during its meeting held on Monday, Kartik 24, 2082, Mr. Acharya, who has been serving as the Deputy Chief Executive Officer, has been promoted to the position of CEO for a four-year term effective from Magh 12, 2082. This appointment follows the completion of the tenure of the current Chief Executive Officer, Mr. Nischal Raj Pandey, whose term officially concludes on Magh 11, 2082.

articles.title: Reminder! Last Day to Grab Dividend Proposed by Sanima Bank Limited
articles.content: Today is the last day to grab the 7.3685% dividend that Sanima Bank Limited (SANIMA) proposed. The company called its 21st AGM on 2nd Kartik, 2082. articles.title: Synergy Power Development Limited Announces Investment in Two Hydropower Projects
articles.content:
Synergy Power Development Limited (SPDL) has announced significant investments in two hydropower projects, as per the decision made during its 164th board meeting held on 6th Shrawan 2082. According to the resolution passed during the meeting, the company will invest in the following projects: 1. Mid Hongu Khola A Hydropower Project
Promoter Company: Apex Makalu Hydropower Limited
Number of Shares: 1,100,000 units
Investment Amount: Rs. 110,000,000 2. Mid Hongu Khola B Hydropower Project
Promoter Company: Gaurishankar Power Development Limited
Number of Shares: 1,400,000 units
Investment Amount: Rs. 140,000,000 In total, Synergy Power Development Limited will acquire 25 lakhs units of shares, committing an investment of Rs. 25 crores across both projects. The move highlights SPDL’s strategic initiative to diversify its energy portfolio and strengthen its position in Nepal’s growing hydropower sector.

articles.title: ICRA Nepal Issues Crucial BB Rating to Elevation Energy, Withdraws Synergy Power Rating
articles.content: ICRA Nepal has assigned a rating of [ICRANP-IR] BB to Elevation Energy Management Limited, indicating a moderate risk of default in meeting financial obligations on time. This rating reflects the company's general creditworthiness and is not tied to any specific debt instrument. Within this rating scale, symbols like "+" or "–" may be added to show relative standing; for example, BB+ is stronger than BB, while BB– is weaker. Similarly, ICRA Nepal has withdrawn the [ICRANP-IR] BB “Issuer Not Cooperating” rating assigned to Synergy Power Development Limited due to the company's failure to provide necessary information for the rating process.

articles.title: 50% Right Shares of Synergy Power Development Listed on NEPSE for Trading
articles.content: 40,32,875 units of right shares of Synergy Power Development Limited (SPDL) have been listed in NEPSE. Earlier, Synergy Power Development Limited (SPDL) had allotted its 1: 0.5 ratio right share issue to its shareholders from 3rd Bhadra to 31st Bhadra, 2080. Out of 40,32,875 unit right shares, the eligible shareholders of the company applied for a total of 34,69,614 units. The shares were allotted to applicants accordingly. Subsequently, The hydropower company conducted an auction of 5,63,261 units of unsubscribed right shares from 1st Kartik to 15th Kartik, 2080. Sanima Capital Limited was the auction manager for the company. As of writing, SPDL has an LTP of Rs. 172.

articles.title: Bids Received in Auction of Synergy Power Ordinary Shares Opened; What is the Cut-Off Rate?
articles.content: The bids received in the auction of 5,63,261 unit ordinary shares of Synergy Power Development Limited (SPDL) opened on today i.e. 22nd Kartik, 2080. The auction opened on 1st Kartik and concluded on 15th Kartik at the end of banking hours. 5,63,261 units of ordinary right shares were auctioned. This is the unclaimed portion of the rights offering. The company opened a 1: 0.50 ratio right share issue to its shareholders from 3rd Bhadra to 31st Bhadra, 2080. The same unsold right shares were auctioned to the general public. Sanima Capital Limited was appointed as the auction manager. Bids opened at the head office of the company located at Naxal, Kathmandu, starting today at 10 a.m. The general public and institutions were all eligible to bid for the auction. Rs. 100 was the minimum bid rate for the auction. While the minimum bid quantity for shares was 100 units, there was no upper limit. Although bidders could bid for the entirety of the issue, they were required to abide by the regulatory body rule to not exceed the specified quantity of shares per entity. According to the auction manager, a total of 683 applicants placed bids for around 5,63,261 unit ordinary shares. The tentative cut-off rate is Rs. 142.60 whereas the maximum bid rate stood at Rs. 161. Once all of the checks get reconciled and cleared, the cut-off price may vary. The last traded price of the scrip stands at Rs 166. per share.

The hydropower company declared the book closure date for its rights offering on Shrawan 12. Thus, investors maintained before that day were eligible to apply for the shares. A total of 34,69,614 shares have been allotted to the valid applicants. Thus, 5,63,261 (13.96%) shares were unclaimed by eligible investors. This remaining quantity of shares will be auctioned. The paid up capital of the company before the issue and allotment of 50% shares was Rs. 80 crores, which will now reach to Rs. 120.98 crores. Notice:

articles.title: Last Day to Apply for 1: 0.50 Rights Offering of Synergy Power Development
articles.content:
Synergy Power Development Limited (SPDL) is closing the issue of its ongoing 1: 0.50 ratio right share to its shareholders from today i.e. 31st Bhadra, 2080. This issue was open from the 3rd Bhadra. Therefore all the eligible investors are requested to apply for the right shares before banking hour today. The hydropower company has been issuing 50% right shares worth Rs. 40.32 Crores through the issue of 4,032,875 (1: 0.50) units of right shares to its existing shareholders. The current paid-up capital of the company is Rs. 80,65,75,000. After the adjustment of the proposed right share, the paid-up capital of the company will increase to Rs. 120.98 crores. Sanima Capital Limited is appointed as the issue manager of this right share. Previously, the company had unveiled the book closure date for its rights offering which was Shrawan 12. Thus, shareholders maintained before that day are entitled to apply for the rights offering.

articles.title: River Falls Power Limited Auctioning 10,38,924 Unclaimed Right Shares From Today
articles.content: River Falls Power Limited (RFPL) is auctioning 10,38,924 units of unclaimed rights shares from its previous (1: 1) rights offering. The auction opens from today, i.e,. from 26th Kartik to 3rd Mangsir 2082. A total of 59,61,076 (85.15%) shares have been allotted to the valid applicants. Thus, 10,38,924 shares were unclaimed by eligible investors. Of the total right shares issued, only 22,24,173 units were allotted to eligible shareholders. Thus, the same 10,38,924 (14.85%) units of unsold right shares are in auction to the general public. This is the unclaimed portion of the rights offering. The company had issued a 1:1 Ratio right share issue to its shareholders from 23rd Bhadra to 26th Ashwin, 2082. Individuals and institutions are all eligible to bid for the auction. LS Prabhu Limited has been appointed as the issue manager of this rights share. The minimum bid rate for the auction is set at Rs. 100. For ordinary right shares, the minimum bid quantity is 100 units. Although bidders can bid for the entire issue, they must adhere to the regulatory board's rule, which restricts exceeding the specified share quantity per entity.

articles.title: Soaltee Hotel Limited (SHL) Proposes 31.57% Dividend for FY 2081/82; Calls AGM on Mangsir 28
articles.content: Soaltee Hotel Limited (SHL) has proposed a 31.57894737% dividend for FY 2081/82. The company has also called its 51st AGM on Mangsir 28, 2082. The meeting of the board of directors held on Kartik 11, 2082, has decided to distribute a 31.57% dividend for FY 2081/82. 16.57894737% cash dividend and 15% bonus shares are proposed from the paid-up capital. The paid-up capital of the company stands at Rs. 1.02 Arba. Thus, cash dividends are worth Rs 16,94,14,078. The cash dividend includes the tax amount for the bonus shares. The book closure for the proposed dividend and AGM is on 5th Mangsir, 2082. Therefore, the shareholders who maintained before that day are entitled to dividend payout and can attend the AGM.

articles.title: Soaltee Hotels & Resorts Expands into Birgunj with Westend Luxury Resort
articles.content: Soaltee Hotels & Resorts is set to expand its presence in Madhesh Province with the upcoming Soaltee Westend Resort Birgunj, scheduled to open in December 2025. Strategically located in Birgunj, near the national highway and the India border, the resort aims to serve both business and leisure travelers. The property will offer modern, luxurious accommodations, diverse dining options, a casino, wellness and recreational facilities, and spaces for events and conferences. Owned by Himal Water Park & Village Hotel Limited, the resort marks a strategic partnership with Soaltee Hotels & Resorts to enhance hospitality services in Nepal’s key commercial hubs. The expansion is expected to elevate Birgunj’s tourism landscape, boost the local economy, and create employment opportunities while providing world-class hospitality experiences.

articles.title: Soaltee Hotel Posts 14.65% Increase in Net Profit with 16.06% Revenue Growth in Q2 2081/82
articles.content: Soaltee Hotel Limited (SHL) has posted a net profit of Rs. 30.17 crores in the second quarter (Q2) of the fiscal year 2081/82, marking a 14.65% increase from Rs. 26.31 crores in the same period of the previous year. The company’s total revenue saw a significant rise of 16.06%, reaching Rs. 1.21 Arba in Q2 2081/82, compared to Rs. 1.05 Arba in the corresponding quarter of the previous fiscal year. Meanwhile, total expenses for the quarter stood at Rs. 84.88 crores. Finance expenses recorded a sharp decline of 25.32%, amounting to Rs. 2.66 lakhs. Soaltee Hotel Limited’s investment portfolio stands at Rs. 28.12 crores. The company’s reserve and surplus increased by 0.37%, reaching Rs. 1.49 Arba. The paid-up capital remained unchanged at Rs. 92.89 crores. The net worth per share of the company was recorded at Rs. 260.42, while the annualized earnings per share (EPS) stood at Rs. 64.96 for the quarter. Report:

articles.title: Reminder! Last Day to Grab Dividend Proposed by Soaltee Hotel Limited
articles.content: Today is the last day to claim the proposed Soaltee Hotel Limited (SHL) dividend. The company has also called its 50th AGM on Poush 4, 2081. The meeting will be held at the Nepal Academy, Kamaladi, Kathmandu, starting from 11:00 AM that day. The board of directors' meeting on Kartik 13, 2081, distributed a 36.84% dividend for FY 2080/81. A 26.84210526% cash dividend and 10% bonus shares are proposed from the paid-up capital. The company's paid-up capital stands at Rs. 92.89 Crores. Thus, bonus shares are worth Rs. 9,28,95,370, and cash dividends are worth Rs 24,93,50,730. The cash dividend includes the tax amount for the bonus shares. Mangsir 13 is the book closure date. Thus, shareholders who have maintained their shares until today are entitled to the dividend payout and can attend the AGM. As of writing, SHL has an LTP of Rs. 562.00.

articles.title: Soaltee Hotels & Resorts Joins Nepal's First Tourism Expo as Hospitality Partner
articles.content: The Soaltee Hotels and Resorts has become the hospitality partner for the Nepal International Tourism Expo (NITE), Nepal's first-ever tourism expo. The agreement was signed at The Soaltee Kathmandu, aiming to promote tourism in Nepal through large-scale events. The NITE Expo will take place at Bhrikuti Mandap Exhibition Hall from June 14-15, 2024, with support from various organizations including the Nepal Tourism Board. Sudarshan Chapagain, Vice President of Soaltee Hotel Limited, expressed optimism about the expo's potential to boost Nepal's tourism sector. Bishnu Pandey, Managing Director of Summit Events, highlighted the expo's goal to showcase Nepal's natural and cultural heritage and foster global tourism partnerships. The expo expects participation from 16 countries, 250 buyers, and 1,000 visitors, focusing on tourism-related businesses and organizations. Swift Holidays, Hams Hospital, Khalti, and Landmark Hotels and Resorts have also partnered with the expo. NITE 2024 aims to be Nepal's premier international tourism exhibition, facilitating networking, collaborations, and discussions on tourism-related topics to promote the country's tourism industry.

articles.title: Soaltee Hotel Reports Net Profit Surge of 11.38% to Rs. 41.23 Crores in Q3 FY 2080/2081, Revenue Soars to Rs. 1.68 Arba
articles.content: Soaltee Hotel Limited (SHL) has reported a net profit of Rs. 41.23 crores for the third quarter of the fiscal year 2080/2081, marking a notable increase from the Rs. 37.11 crores recorded in the corresponding quarter of the previous fiscal year. The company's total revenue experienced a significant growth of 11.38%, reaching Rs. 1.68 Arba in the current quarter, compared to Rs. 1.5 Arba in the corresponding period last year. Simultaneously, total expenses for the quarter amounted to Rs. 1.16 crores, while finance expenses witnessed a substantial decline of 86.78% to stand at Rs. 5.89 Lakhs. An important facet of Soaltee Hotel Limited's financial portfolio is its investment, which stands at Rs. 27.54 crores. Additionally, the company's reserve and surplus displayed an increase of 30.73%, reaching Rs. 1.35 Arba in Q3, 2080/2081. The paid-up capital of the company remains stable at Rs. 92.89 crores. The net worth per share of the company was reported at Rs. 24.58, with an annualized EPS of Rs. 5.92 for this quarter. Report: Major Highlights:

articles.title: eSewa and Soaltee Hotels Forge Innovative Partnership for Enhanced Customer Benefits
articles.content: eSewa, Nepal's top digital wallet provider, and Soaltee Hotels & Resorts, a prominent hotel chain, have formed a significant partnership starting April 14, 2024. This collaboration benefits members of the Soaltee Heritage Club with added convenience and exclusive rewards. Members earn points for spending at Soaltee hotels like The Soaltee Kathmandu, Soaltee Westend Premier Nepalgunj, Soaltee Westend Itahari, Soaltee Westend Resort Chitwan, Soaltee Westend Resort Nagarkot, and Mithila Yatri Niwas Janakpur. These points can be redeemed as cashback rewards in their eSewa wallets, enhancing their stays. Mr. Jagdish Khadka, CEO of eSewa, and Mr. Sudarshan Chapagain, Director of Soaltee Hotel Limited, signed the agreement, expressing enthusiasm for the mutual benefits. This strategic cooperation reflects a commitment to improving customer satisfaction and streamlining the digital experience for travelers and patrons. Through this collaboration, both eSewa and Soaltee Hotels & Resorts aim to set new standards in Nepalese hospitality by blending digital convenience with premium services, providing customers with unparalleled value and a seamless experience throughout their stay.

articles.content: "Siddhartha Equity Fund (SEF)", a closed-end 10-year mutual fund managed by Siddhartha Capital Limited, has unveiled its net asset value (NAV) for the month of Ashwin. According to the financial report, the mutual fund scheme’s NAV stands at Rs. 9.38 as of Ashwin's end, 2082, which was Rs. 9.97 in the previous month. The scheme began with a total fund of Rs. 1.50 Arba and invested Rs. 1.15 Arba in the listed shares and Rs. 4.39 crores in public issues, rights shares, and bonus shares. The scheme has invested Rs. 1.44 crore in bonds and debentures. This scheme has Rs. 18.24 crores in the bank balance. SEF has posted a net loss of Rs. 14.07 crores till the month of Ashwin. In the month before, the net loss of Rs. 5.21 crores. Report: "Siddhartha Systematic Investment Scheme (SSIS)" has also unveiled its NAV report. articles.title: Siddhartha Capital Declares Book Closure Date for Proposed Dividend of SEF, SIGS2, And SIGS3
articles.content: Siddhartha Capital Limited has declared the book closure date for the dividend of its closed-end mutual fund scheme: 6th Bhadra, 2082. Thus, unit holders maintained until the 5th Bhadra are entitled to the dividend payout. In a meeting of the board of directors of Siddhartha Capital Limited decided to distribute a 20% cash dividend (including tax) worth Rs. 30 Crores for Siddhartha Equity Fund (SEF), 20% cash dividend (including tax) worth Rs. 24 Crores for Siddhartha Investment Growth Scheme-2 (SIGS2), and a 17% cash dividend (including tax) worth Rs. 13.69 Crores for Siddhartha Investment Growth Scheme 3 (SIGS3) for the fiscal year 2081/82. Siddhartha Equity Fund (SEF), Siddhartha Investment Growth Scheme-2 (SIGS2), and Siddhartha Investment Growth Scheme-3 (SIGS3) are closed-end mutual funds, each with a maturity period of 10 years. All these funds are sponsored by Siddhartha Bank Limited and managed by Siddhartha Capital Limited. As of the month of Ashadh, the Net Asset Value (NAV) of SEF is Rs. 12.32, with a closing price of Rs. 11.26. The NAV of SIGS2 is Rs. 12.49, with a closing price of Rs. 11.24, while SIGS3’s NAV stands at Rs. 12.53, with a closing price of Rs. 11.09. Book Close Notice:

articles.title: IPO shares of Sagar Distillery Listed in NEPSE; What is the Opening Ranges?
articles.content: 72,60,000 units IPO shares of Sagar Distillery Limited (SAGAR) have been listed in NEPSE. This includes the shares held by promoters and the quantity issued to the general public. The opening range for the first transaction is Rs.106.52 to Rs. 319.56. If the company signs an agreement with NEPSE, the IPO shares will be traded in the secondary market the next day. Out of a total of 72,60,000 unit shares, 11,90,640 units of IPO shares with a par value of Rs 100 were issued to general public from 30th Bhadra- 5th Ashwin, 2082. Note that the listed shares will be traded under the symbol 'SAGAR'.

articles.title: Sagarmatha Jalabidhyut Company Suspends Power Generation After Flood and Landslide Damage
articles.content: agarmatha Jalabidhyut Company Limited (SMJC) has halted power generation at its Supermai A Hydropower Project (9.6 MW) after the project sustained damage due to continuous rainfall, flooding, and landslides in the region. According to the company, the heavy downpour on Ashwin 18, 2082 (October 4, 2025) triggered floods and landslides that severely affected the project’s infrastructure, forcing a complete shutdown of electricity production from 10:45 PM the same night. SMJC stated that maintenance and assessment works are being planned and will proceed once the weather improves and conditions become safe for operations. The company has assured that all concerned authorities and stakeholders will be informed once the plant resumes electricity generation.

articles.title: 100% Right Shares of Sagarmatha Jalbidhyut Company Limited Added in SEBON Pipeline
articles.content: The Securities Exchange Board of Nepal (SEBON) has added the right shares of Sagarmatha Jalbidhyut Company Limited (SMJC) to its pipeline under preliminary review. The application was submitted to the board on Jestha 22, 2082. The insurance company is looking to issue 100% rights shares worth Rs. 1.17 Arba through the issue of 11,732,000 (1: 1) units of rights shares to its existing shareholders. The current paid-up capital of the company is Rs. 1.17 Arba. After the adjustment of the proposed right share, the paid-up capital of the company will increase to Rs. 2.34 Arba. NMB Capital Limited is appointed as the issue manager.

articles.title: ICRA Nepal Reaffirms BBB- Rating for Sagarmatha Jalabidhyut, Removes Watch Status
articles.content: ICRA Nepal Limited has reaffirmed the issuer rating of [ICRANP-IR] BBB- for Sagarmatha Jalabidhyut Company Limited and has removed it from the 'Watch with Developing Implications' list. This rating indicates a moderate degree of safety in fulfilling financial obligations and reflects a moderate credit risk. It is a general opinion on the company’s creditworthiness, not tied to any specific debt instrument. The BBB- rating places the company at the lower end of the moderate credit category, one notch below BBB.

articles.title: Sagarmatha Jalbidhyut Company Limited Proposes to Issue 100% Right Shares; Approval Received from ERC
articles.content: According to the decision made during the Board of Directors meeting of Sagarmatha Jalbidhyut Company Limited (SMJC), the company has proposed to issue right shares in the ratio of 1:1, equivalent to 100% of its existing paid-up capital. The board meeting, held on Jestha 13, 2082, approved the issuance of 100% right shares based on the current paid-up capital of Rs. 1.17 Arba. Following the allotment of 11,732,000 units of right shares, the company’s paid-up capital is expected to double to Rs. 2.34 Arba. These right shares have already received approval from the Electricity Regulatory Commission. However, the final issuance is subject to approval from the Securities Board of Nepal (SEBON). As of the latest market close, SMJC's share price stood at Rs. 500.89.

articles.title: Reminder! Last Day to Grab Dividend Proposed by Sagarmatha Jalbidhyut Company Limited
articles.content: Today is the last day to grab the dividend proposed by Sagarmatha Jalbidhyut Company Limited (SMJC). The company has also called its 4th AGM on 14th Mangsir, 2081. The meeting will be held in Smart Durbar, Shankha Park, Kathmandu, starting at 9 am that day. Among other proposals, the AGM will endorse a 5% dividend for the fiscal year 2080/81. The meeting of the board of directors has proposed a 4.75% bonus shares and 0.25% cash dividend for the fiscal year 2080/81. The company's existing paid-up capital is Rs. 1.12 Arba. Kartik 26 is the book closure date. Thus, shareholders maintained till today are entitled to the dividend payout and can attend the AGM. As of writing, SMJC has an LTP of Rs. 593.50.

The dividend will be distributed only after approval by the Electricity Regulatory Commission and endorsement by the company's upcoming AGM. As of writing, SMJC has an LTP of Rs. 578.40.

articles.title: Inauguration of Upper Ingwa Hydroelectric Project: Powering Nepal's Future
articles.content: Ingwa Hydropower Limited (IHL) completed the construction of the 9.7 MW Upper Ingwa Hydroelectric Project and connected it to the national grid on the 10th of Chaitra. The inauguration ceremony took place in Aapdada, Hilihang-1, with the project being connected to the Amarpur substation. Construction began in 2078 and finished in 2080, costing Rs 194 crore. The project is funded with 30% equity financing, contributed by promoters and the public, while the remaining 70% is financed by Nabil Bank Limited. The project includes a dam in ward no. 2 and a powerhouse in ward no. 3 of Yangwarak village municipality. With a net head of 189 meters, electricity is generated using a 4.5-kilometer-long penstock pipe and European-imported turbines and generators. The electricity is distributed across Nepal via the Arpur-Damak 132 Kb transmission line. IHL closed at Rs. 355.00.

articles.title: Successful Completion of Dry Test for 9.7 MW Upper Ingwa Khola Small Hydropower Project
articles.content: The commercial production for Ingwa Hydropower Limited (IHL), where Api Power Company Limited (API) holds a majority share investment, is set to commence by the end of Falgun 2080. Ingwa Hydropower is overseeing the construction of the 9.7 MW Upper Ingwa Khola Small Hydropower Project, located on the Ingwa River in Panchthar district. API has invested 15 crore rupees worth of founding shares in Ingwa Hydropower Limited. Mr. Dwarika Prasad Neupane, Director of Api Power Company Limited, expressed confidence that the project would yield significant profits for API upon its completion. Mr. Gokul Pandey, the finance manager of Ingwa Hydropower Limited, reported that the Upper Ingwa River Small Hydropower Project successfully completed its dry test on Magh 19, 2080. Mr. Pandey further mentioned that the charging of the transmission line is expected to be completed within the next week.

articles.title: IPO Shares of Ingwa Hydropower Now Listed in NEPSE; What are the Opening Ranges?
articles.content: 60,00,000 unit IPO shares of Ingwa Hydropower Limited have been listed in NEPSE. This includes the shares held by promoters and the quantity issued to the general public and project-affected locals. The opening range for the first transaction is Rs. 97.29 to Rs. 291.87. The IPO shares will trade in the secondary market the next day if the company signs the agreement with NEPSE. Out of a total of 60,00,000 units of shares worth Rs. 60 Crore, 12,68,639 units worth Rs 12.68 Crores were issued as Initial Public Offerings to the general public (Baisakh 13- 17, 2080). Nepal SBI Merchant Banking Limited was appointed as the issue manager for the IPO issuance. Ingwa Hydropower Limited was incorporated on June 23, 2009, as a Private Limited company, which was later converted into a Public Limited company on August 25, 2014. The company has been promoted by institutional promoters and individual businessmen of Nepal for setting up a 9.70 MW run-of-river, Upper Ingwa Khola hydroelectric project (UIKHP) in the Panchthar district of Nepal. The project is constructed under BOOT (Build, Own, Operate, and Transfer) mechanism.

articles.title: IPO Allotment of Ingwa Hydropower Concludes; 1,26,863 Applicants Get 10 Units Each, Lucky 9 Applicants Get 1 Unit Extra
articles.content: The IPO allotment of Ingwa Hydropower Limited is concluded today at the premises of Nepal SBI Merchant Banking Limited, Kathmandu. Ingwa Hydropower Limited had issued 12,68,639 units worth Rs 12.68 crores as Initial Public Offering (IPO) to the general public (Baisakh 13- 17, 2080). Earlier, the company had issued 6,00,000 unit shares worth Rs. 6 crores to the project-affected locals of Taplejung District out of which only 306,840 units were allotted to valid applicants. Thus, the remaining 293,160 units of unsubscribed shares of project-affected locals are added to 12,00,000 units (20% of the issued capital which is reserved for the general public) to make a total of 14,93,160 units for the general public. Out of the total 14,93,160 units; 120,000 units have already been issued and allotted to Nepalese citizens working abroad, 5% of the total offered shares i.e. 74,658 units have been set aside for the mutual funds, and 2% or 29,863 units have been set aside for employees of the company. The remaining 12,68,639 units are for the general public. Overall, 70% of shares are of the promoter shareholders in the company. The issue had received applications from 11,99,967 valid applicants who had applied for a total of 1,28,43,230 units. The issue was oversubscribed by more than 10.12 times. As per the allotment module, a total of 1,26,863 applicants were allotted 10 units each via lottery, and lucky 9 applicants got 1 unit extra and the remaining  10,73,104 applicants were returned with empty hands. A total of 74,658 units were allotted to the mutual funds and 29,863 units were allotted to the employees of the company. In total 4,028 applicants who applied for 52,260 units were disqualified. Allotment Module: The IPO result can be accessed by CDSC IPO Result, MeroShare, and SBI Merchant Banking Limited. articles.content: Shivam Cements Limited (SHIVM) has called the 10th AGM on 25th Mangsir, 2082. The meeting will be held in the Rastriya Sabha Griha, Pradarshani Marg, Kathmandu, starting at 10:30 am that day. Among the other agendas, the AGM will endorse a 12.5% dividend for FY 2081/82. The 142nd meeting of the board of directors held on Kartik 30 has proposed a 12.5% dividend for the fiscal year 2081/82. 2.5% bonus shares worth Rs. 13.64 Crores and 10% cash dividends (for tax purposes) worth Rs. 54.56 Crores have been proposed. The company's existing paid-up capital is Rs. 5.45 Arba. Furthermore, there is an agenda to endorse the auditor's report along with the profit and loss statements, financial reports, and cash flow reports, and to appoint an auditor for the fiscal year 2082/83. The book closure date is on Mangsir 11. Thus, shareholders maintained before that day are entitled to the dividend payout and can also attend this AGM. Notice:

The company's existing paid-up capital is Rs. 5.45 Arba. The book closure date is on Mangsir 11. articles.title: Shivam Cement Reinforces Ethical Responsibility in Fourth “No Compromise” Campaign Video
articles.content: Shivam Cement, a leading name in Nepal’s cement industry, has launched the fourth video in its acclaimed “No Compromise” brand campaign, emphasizing the theme of responsibility. The new installment tells the story of a devoted doctor who prioritizes an emergency patient over personal plans, symbolizing the message, “No compromise when it comes to responsibility.” This campaign goes beyond traditional marketing by intertwining Shivam Cement’s commitment to uncompromising product quality with broader ethical and civic values. Through relatable storytelling, it highlights moral principles such as duty, vigilance, punctuality, and accountability, values reflected in the quality and reliability of its Ordinary Portland Cement (O.P.C.). Building on previous videos that focused on public service, caution, and time management, the series has become a nationwide social awareness initiative. It reinforces Shivam Cement’s philosophy of integrity and excellence, captured in slogans like “Shivam – The Identity of Quality” and “Trust is Our Bond.” Recognized nationally with the NS Quality Award 2019, Shivam Cement continues to position itself not just as a construction brand but as a socially responsible corporate leader inspiring ethical conduct and trust across Nepal.

articles.title: Shivam Holdings Declares Cash Dividend and Continues Strong Performance
articles.content: Shivam Cements Limited’s subsidiary, Shivam Holdings Limited, held its 4th Annual General Meeting under the chairmanship of Shiva Ratna Sharada. The meeting approved the distribution of Rs. 11.60 crore as cash dividend to shareholders for FY 2081/82 and appointed auditors for FY 2082/83, with all proposals passed unanimously. Shivam Holdings owns 85% of Shivam Cements Limited, a leading OPC cement producer in Nepal, with the remaining 15% held by local entrepreneurs. The company has distributed dividends consecutively for four years, with a current paid-up capital of Rs. 4.64 billion. Additionally, the company has applied to the Securities Board of Nepal (SEBON) to issue 20% of shares worth Rs. 1.16 billion to the public at a premium. Shivam Cements, located in Gandaki Province, Eastern Nawalparasi, operates with advanced technology capable of producing 6,000 metric tons of clinker and cement daily, while generating 12 MW of electricity from waste heat for internal use. The company has been operating at full capacity and delivering consistent dividends over the past five years, expressing gratitude to shareholders, partners, and stakeholders for their continued support.

articles.title: Shivam Cement Launches Cleanup Drive to Support Kathmandu’s Recovery After Gen-Z Protests
articles.content: Following the recent Gen-Z protests that led to arson and vandalism in Kathmandu, Shivam Cement has launched a cleanup campaign to help restore order and sanitation. In coordination with the Kathmandu District Administration Office, the company not only supported the office’s cleaning drive but also donated essential furniture to facilitate daily operations. Shivam Cement stated that it will continue to contribute through voluntary labor and sanitation drives, reaffirming its commitment to social responsibility by supporting community rebuilding and keeping the city clean, organized, and safe.

articles.title: Shivam Cement’s ‘No Compromise’ Campaign Strengthens Quality and Social Responsibility
articles.content: Shivam Cement, a leading name in Nepal’s cement industry, has released the third video in its popular campaign, “Quality को मामलामा No Compromise”. The latest video highlights the importance of time through the story of two friends, one reaching the airport on time, the other missing the flight, emphasizing “No Compromise on Time”. Earlier campaign phases focused on duty and caution, with the first video portraying a dedicated traffic police officer and the second illustrating trust and vigilance between a landlord and tenant. These socially responsible messages have been well received by audiences. Shivam Cement’s campaign goes beyond advertising, reflecting the company’s commitment to quality, reliability, and social awareness. Since its inception, Shivam has produced only Ordinary Portland Cement (O.P.C.) and consistently upheld its “No Compromise” promise, earning accolades such as the NS Quality Award 2019. Slogans like “गुणस्तरको पहिचान हो शिवम्”, “भरोसा अटुट सम्बन्धको”, and “कर्तव्यको मामलामा No Compromise” encapsulate the brand’s dedication to quality and trust.

articles.title: Shivam Cements’ Profit Triples in Q4 Despite Flat Revenue Growth; EPS Reaches to Rs. 14.55
articles.content: Shivam Cements Limited (SHIVM) concluded the fourth quarter of FY 2081/82 with a net profit of Rs. 79.41 Crore, a sharp 205.85% increase compared to Rs. 25.96 Crore in the same period last year. The strong profit growth came despite a marginal 0.78% rise in revenue from operations, which stood at Rs. 7.76 Arba against Rs. 7.70 Arba previously. Annualized earnings per share surged to Rs. 14.55 from Rs. 5.16 a year earlier. Paid-up capital increased by 8.55% to Rs. 5.45 Arba, while retained earnings improved by 10.46% to Rs. 3.87 Arba. Property, plant, and equipment grew by 7.55% to Rs. 3.88 Arba, and total investments rose by 3.71% to Rs. 4.75 Arba. On the other hand, trade receivables declined significantly by 27.22% to Rs. 81.99 Crore, indicating improved collections. Other income fell by 30.78% to Rs. 13.94 Crore, while total expenses edged down by 1.66% to Rs. 94.06 Crore. The company’s net worth per share remained stable at Rs. 188.57, compared to Rs. 188.84 last year. At the end of the quarter, Shivam Cements’ shares were priced at Rs. 535.04, with a price-to-earnings ratio of 36.77 times. Report:

articles.title: Shivam Cement’s ‘No Compromise’ Campaign Continues with Powerful Social Message on Vigilance
articles.content: Shivam Cement, a leading name in Nepal's cement industry, has released the second video of its brand campaign “No Compromise in Quality.” This installment focuses on the theme “No Compromise in Caution,” portraying a storyline between a landlord and tenant to emphasize the importance of vigilance and thoughtful decision-making in daily life. The first video in the campaign featured a dutiful traffic police officer and spread the message “No Compromise in Duty,” which was highly appreciated by the audience. This campaign is more than just advertising; it's a social awareness initiative reflecting Shivam Cement’s strong commitment to quality, responsibility, and ethical standards. Through the message, “It’s easy to say No Compromise, but hard to practice,” Shivam reinforces its promise to never compromise on product quality. Since its inception, Shivam Cement has exclusively produced and sold Ordinary Portland Cement (OPC), maintaining consistent quality, trust, and long-term relationships. Recognized for these principles, Shivam Cement is Nepal’s first cement company to win the prestigious NS Quality Award 2019, affirming its status as a brand built on excellence and integrity.

articles.title: Shivam Cement Launches 'No Compromise' Campaign Season 2 with Strong Message on Quality and Integrity
articles.content: Shivam Cement, a leader in Nepal’s cement industry known for its unwavering commitment to quality, has launched the second edition of its popular campaign ‘No Compromise’. The campaign delivers a strong social message that standing firm on one’s principles, especially in quality, brings pride and trust. Since its inception, Shivam Cement has focused solely on producing OPC cement without compromising on quality, earning it the NS Quality Award 2019. The newly released campaign teaser, styled like a cinematic trailer, has generated public excitement. Its first video portrays a traffic police officer unwavering in duty, symbolizing Shivam’s consistent stand on quality. This campaign continues the brand’s tradition of combining product promotion with meaningful social awareness, reinforcing the message that there should be “No Compromise” on values, duties, and quality.

articles.title: Shivam Cement Unveils 'No Compromise' Campaign Season 2, Reinforces Commitment to Quality and Social Message
articles.content: Shivam Cement, a leading name in Nepal’s cement industry known for its uncompromising quality, has launched the second edition of its popular brand campaign ‘No Compromise’. This new series emphasizes the message that upholding quality is not easy, but it brings pride. Since its inception, Shivam has only produced OPC cement, maintaining a strict no-compromise policy on quality, which earned it the NS Quality Award 2019. The campaign's teaser, presented like a movie trailer, created strong anticipation. The first ad showcases a traffic police officer uncompromising in duty, paralleling Shivam Cement’s stance on quality. More videos addressing social issues will follow, continuing the brand’s tradition of blending product promotion with impactful public awareness.

articles.title: NMB Laghubitta Posts Rs. 43.55 Crore Core Revenue in Q4 FY 2081/82, Swings to Rs. 6.38 Crore Profit from Loss Last Year
articles.content: NMB Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (NMBMF) has recorded a sharp rebound in its financial results for the fourth quarter of FY 2081/82, with a net profit of Rs. 6.38 crore, recovering from a net loss of Rs. 5.29 crore in the same quarter last fiscal year. The company’s core revenue — net interest income — jumped 61.83% to Rs. 43.55 crore from Rs. 26.91 crore a year ago, supported by strong growth in lending and deposits. Loans and advances to customers rose 27.02% to Rs. 6.75 Arba, while deposits from customers increased 17.57% to Rs. 1.56 Arba. Borrowings also surged 27.83% to Rs. 4.33 Arba. Retained earnings turned positive at Rs. 20.26 lakh from a negative Rs. 6.31 crore last year, while reserves and surplus grew 7.39% to Rs. 21.80 crore. Impairment charges, however, more than doubled, climbing 175.43% to Rs. 3.05 crore. The company’s asset quality improved, with the Non-Performing Loan (NPL) ratio falling to 4.43% from 6.35%, and the cost of funds dropping to 7.28% from 9.44%. Earnings per share stood at Rs. 8.85, compared to a loss per share of Rs. 7.33 in the previous year, while net worth per share increased 8.58% to Rs. 140.61. At the end of the quarter, NMB Laghubitta’s price-to-earnings ratio was 84.20 times, with the market price of its shares at Rs. 745.13. Report: Major Financial Highlights: * Figures are of the Immediate Previous Year Quarter Ending

articles.title: NMB Laghubitta Calls AGM On Ashad 32; When's the Book Closure Date?
articles.content:
NMB Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (NMBMF) has called its 12th AGM on 32nd Ashad, 2082, 2082. The meeting will be held in Hotel City Square Pvt. Ltd., Pokhara, starting at 9 am that day. These are the agendas of the AGM: 1. To discuss and approve the Annual Report for the fiscal year 2080/81 presented by the Chairman on behalf of the Board of Directors.
2. To discuss and approve the Balance Sheet as of Ashad-end 2081, Profit & Loss Account, Cash Flow Statement, and related schedules for FY 2080/81 along with the Auditor’s Report.
3. To appoint an Auditor for FY 2081/82 as per Section 111 of the Companies Act, 2063, and Section 63 of the BAFIA, 2073, and to determine their remuneration.
4. To approve amendments to Article 6(g) of the Memorandum to fix promoter shareholding at 51% and Article 6(ch) to fix public shareholding at 49%, and to amend Article 31(a) regarding the number of directors nominated/elected from the promoter group.
5. To amend Article 27(2) of the company’s bylaws regarding the structure, number, and tenure of the Board of Directors.
6. To authorize the Board of Directors or its designated official to proceed with a potential merger/acquisition with other licensed “D” class microfinance institutions, including the formation of a committee, the appointment of a valuer, signing of agreements, and all related actions.
7. To authorize the Board of Directors or its designated official to carry out any required changes to the Articles of Association or Bylaws as directed by the regulatory authorities.
8. Misc. Ashad 24 is the book closure date. Thus, the shareholders maintained before that day are entitled to attend the AGM. AGM Notice

articles.title: NMB Laghubitta Bounces Back to Profit of Rs. 2.75 Crores in Q3; EPS at Rs. 5.15
articles.content: NMB Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha (NMBMF) has made a strong comeback in the third quarter of fiscal year 2081/82 by posting a net profit of Rs. 2.75 crores, a significant turnaround from the loss of Rs. 7.49 crores reported in the same quarter of the previous fiscal year. The microfinance company’s earnings per share (EPS) stood at Rs. 5.15, a notable shift from the negative Rs. 13.85 recorded in Q3 of 2080/81. Its net interest income surged by 58.88% to reach Rs. 27.86 crores. NMB Laghubitta’s loans and advances to customers grew by 17.95%, rising to Rs. 6.26 Arba. The company’s borrowings also increased by 16.68% to Rs. 3.95 Arba, while customer deposits climbed by 9.31% to Rs. 1.45 Arba. On the expenses side, personnel expenses rose by 12.17% to Rs. 19.83 crores. However, a major contributor to profit improvement was a sharp decline in impairment charges, which plummeted by over 90%, from Rs. 2.24 crores last year to just Rs. 21.04 lakhs this quarter. NMB Laghubitta reported an operating profit of Rs. 2.74 crores, a complete reversal from the operating loss of Rs. 7.50 crores in the previous year. The institution also holds a distributable profit of Rs. 1.97 crores after necessary appropriations. In terms of financial health, capital adequacy ratio declined to 13.96% from 15.84%, but non-performing loans (NPL) improved significantly, falling from 8.29% to 5.59%. Similarly, the cost of funds reduced by 23.59%, now standing at 7.45%. The net worth per share rose slightly to Rs. 132.19, up 1.85% year-on-year. As of Q3 end, the company’s market price stood at Rs. 740.50, with a PE ratio of 143.75 times. Report: Major Highlights: * Figure is of the Immediate Fiscal Year Ending

articles.title: No Dividend To NMB Laghubitta Shareholders for FY 2080/81
articles.content: NMB Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (NMBMF) announces it will not distribute dividends for the Fiscal Year 2080/81. The 170th Board Meeting of NMBMF, held on Falgun 23, 2081, has decided that the company will not distribute any dividends for FY 2080/81. It is important to note that this decision is contingent upon the approval of the financial statements by the regulatory authority, Nepal Rastra Bank, and the upcoming Annual General Meeting of the company. As of writing, NMBMF closed at Rs. 775.20. Past Dividend History:

articles.title: 10% Promoter Shares of NMB Laghubitta Converted into Public Shares
articles.content: 721,449 units of promoter shares of NMB Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (NMBMF) have been converted into public shares making the promoter-to-public shares ratio of the company 60: 40. Currently, the company has 7,214,491.48 unit shares listed in NEPSE. Likewise, the shareholding structure consisted of promotors (70%) i.e. 5,050,144.04 units, and the public (30%) i.e. 2,164,347.44 units. Now, it has been converted to 60% Promoter shares i.e. 4,328,695.04 units, and 40% Public shares i.e. 2,885,796.44 units. As of writing, NMBMF has an LTP of Rs. 755.20.

articles.title: NMB Laghubitta Swings to Profit in Q1 2081/82, Reports Rs. 71.55 Lakhs in Net Profit Driven by Surge in Core Revenue
articles.content: NMB Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (NMBMF) has reported a substantial turnaround in its financial performance for the first quarter (Q1) of fiscal year 2081/82, achieving a net profit of Rs. 71.55 lakhs. This marks a remarkable improvement compared to the net loss of Rs. 4.73 crores recorded during the same period in the previous fiscal year. The company’s net interest income rose by 40.86%, reaching Rs. 8.08 crores, up from Rs. 5.74 crores in Q1 2080/81. Additionally, operating profit turned positive at Rs. 71.39 lakhs, a significant improvement from a negative Rs. 4.70 crores in the previous year. Loans and advances to customers increased by 3.47%, reaching Rs. 5.49 Arba, reflecting growth in lending activities. Meanwhile, deposits saw a slight decline of 2.42%, amounting to Rs. 1.30 Arba, and borrowings remained stable at Rs. 3.38 Arba. For shareholders, earnings per share (EPS) improved to Rs. 3.97 from a negative Rs. 26.25, and net worth per share increased marginally to Rs. 130.24. At the end of the quarter, the price-to-earnings (PE) ratio stood at 182.00, with the market price per share at Rs. 722. Report: * Figures are of Immediate Previous Year Quarter Ending

articles.title: NMB Laghubitta Proposes to Change the Share Structure of the Shareholders from the Current 70% to 60%
articles.content: To change the share structure of the shareholders from the current 70% share structure to 60%, NMB Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (NMBMF) has published a notice for all the promoter shareholders on whether or not to change their share ratio. The current paid-up capital of NMBMF is Rs. 72.14 Crores. Likewise, the current shareholding structure consisted of promotors (70%) and the public (30%). If the conversion of 70% to 60% is completed then the company’s share structure will be 60% Promoter shares and 40% Public shares. If the promoter shareholder does not want to change to ordinary shares, they are requested to contact the Central Office of NMBMF, Pokhara, Kaski, within 21 days from the date of publication of this notice and submit a written request. In the case of the promoter shareholders who do not submit a request to change the share structure within the deadline of this notice, the process will be carried forward to change the proportion of the promoter shares to the general shares. Notice:
