articles.title: Sayapatri Hydropower to Release 50% Pledged Shares of Shareholders and Officials
articles.content: Sayapatri Hydropower Limited (SPHL) has decided to release 50 percent of the pledged shares held by shareholders and company officials, following the 84th Board of Directors meeting held on 11th Ashwin 2082. According to the decision, the move comes as the company has repaid more than 50 percent of the co-financing loan taken for the Daram Khola ‘A’ Hydropower Project. The pledged shares were deposited with co-financing banks, Nepal Bank Limited and Global IME Bank Limited, during the loan period. The Board resolved that half of the pledged shares of all shareholders and officials will be released. For this purpose, Nepal Bank Limited, the lead bank, will be requested to coordinate the process. The company’s Chief Accountant, Krishna Chalise, has been granted full authority to execute all necessary actions related to the release of the pledged shares.

articles.title: Sayapatri Hydropower Receives Approval to Issue Rights Shares in 1:0.74 Ratio
articles.content: Sayapatri Hydropower Limited (SPHL) has received preliminary approval from the Electricity Regulatory Commission to issue rights shares in the ratio of 1:0.74 of its paid-up capital. The company’s 8th Annual General Meeting, held on 2082/03/21, had initially decided to issue rights shares in the ratio of 1:1. Following this decision, the company submitted an application to the Electricity Regulatory Commission for pre-approval. However, as per the commission’s letter dated 2082/05/20, the company has been approved to proceed with the rights issue at a reduced ratio of 1:0.74. The company has officially informed stakeholders about this change.

articles.title: Sayapatri Hydropower Announces Conclusion of Lock-in Period for Promoters, Project-Affected Area Locals and Employee Shares on Shrawan 23
articles.content: Sayapatri Hydropower Limited (SPHL) published a notice regarding the expiration of the lock-in period of its promoters, local residents of the project affected area, and employee shares, and the lock-in period will expire on 23rd Shrawan, 2082. According to the recent guidelines issued by the Securities Board of Nepal (SEBON), Sayapatri Hydropower has officially notified its investors and stakeholders of the conclusion of the lock-in period for the shares held by its promoters, local residents of the project-affected area, and employee shares. In the next month of the 23rd Shrawan, 2082, the lock-in period will end. SPHL now has 3,000,000 units of shares listed on the Nepal Stock Exchange (NEPSE). Within the total of 3,000,00 units of shares, the promoters held 21,00,000 units, the residents of the project-affected area had 178,940 units of shares, and the company's employees had 14,421 units of shares, all subject to a lock-in period since the IPO allotment three years ago. As outlined in the official notice, the shares held by the Board of Directors and employees at higher management won't be tradable after the lock-in period. SPHL closed at Rs. 673.51. Notice:

articles.title: Sayapatri Hydropower Limited Calls AGM on Ashadh 21; To Discuss Right Shares Related Agenda
articles.content:
Sayapatri Hydropower Limited (SPHL) has called its 8th AGM on 21st Ashadh, 2082. The meeting will be held in Jyoti Banquet and Event Management Pvt Ltd, Maijubahal, Kumarigal, Kathmandu starting at 8 am that day. These are the agendas of the AGM: 1) Endorsement of the annual report of the company
2) Endorse the auditor's report of 2080/081 with PNL statements, financial reports, and cash flow reports.
3) Appointment of the auditor and determination of their remuneration for the fiscal year 2081/82.
4) Miscellaneous. Among the other agendas, there is an agenda to issue the right shares of a 1:1 ratio to increase the company's authorized and issued capital. The book closure date is announced on Ashadh 9. Investors who maintained before that day are eligible to attend the AGM. AGM Notice:

articles.title: Sayapatri Hydropower Limited Proposes to Issue 100% Right Shares; Decision Subject to Approval from ERC
articles.content: According to the decision of the Board of Directors meeting of Sayapatri Hydropower Limited (SPHL), the company has proposed to issue right shares in the ratio of 1:1 or 100% right shares. The 76th meeting of the board of directors held on Mangsir 2, 2081 has decided to issue the 100% right shares on the paid-up capital of Rs. 30 Crore. Hence, after the issue of 30,00,000 units of right shares, the paid-up capital of the company will increase to Rs. 60 Crore. The funds raised from the rights share issuance will be utilized to settle the company's debts and liabilities, as well as for the maintenance and repair of the Dharam Khola 'A' Hydropower Project. However, it is important to note that the issuance of these right shares is contingent upon receiving approvals from both the regulatory bodies, namely the Electricity Regulatory Commission and the Securities Board of Nepal (SEBON). SPHL closed at Rs. 796.00.

articles.title: Sayapatri Hydropower Unveils Book Closure Date; Calls AGM on Poush 21
articles.content:
Sayapatri Hydropower Limited (SPHL) has called its 7th AGM on 21st Poush, 2080. The meeting will be held in Jyoti Banquet and Event Management Pvt Ltd, Maijubahal, Kumarigal, Kathmandu starting at 8 am that day. These are the agendas: 1) Endorse the annual report of the fiscal year 2079/80.
2) Endorse the auditor's report with PNL statements, financial reports, and cash flow reports for FY 2079/80.
3) Endorse the appointment of the auditor for the fiscal year 2080/81 Similarly, the company's trading will remain closed for one day i.e. Poush 9, 2080. Therefore those shareholders who hold the company's shares up to Poush 8 can participate in AGM.

articles.title: Sayapatri Hydropower Calls AGM on 23rd Poush with These Agendas; When's the Book Closure Date?
articles.content:
Sayapatri Hydropower Limited (SPHL) has called its 6th AGM on 23rd Poush, 2079. The meeting will be held in the Surya Catering & Party Palace, Dhumbarahi, Kathmandu, starting at 8:30 am that day. These are the agendas of the AGM: 1) Endorsement of financial reports for the fiscal year 2078/79.
2) Endorse the auditor's report with PL statements, financial reports, and cash flow reports.
3) Endorse the appointment of the auditor for the fiscal year 2079/80.
4) Elect 2 directors from the public shareholding group.
5) Determine meeting allowances of the audit committee and other committees.
6) Misc. Poush 11 is the book closure date. Thus, shareholders maintained before that day are entitled to the dividend payout and can also attend this AGM. AGM Notice

articles.title: National Life Insurance Honors Top Agents Through Chairperson Club Program
articles.content: National Life Insurance Company Limited successfully concluded its three-day “Chairperson Club, Training, and Honor Program” under the Elite Leaders Conclave theme at Hotel Royal Tulip, Lalitpur. 526 top-performing agents for FY 2081/82 (2024/25) were inducted into the exclusive Chairperson Club, recognizing their dedication, professionalism, and contribution to the company’s success. The program included special awards for seven outstanding agents, leadership and professional development training by Anil Keshary Shah, and mandatory AML/CFT compliance training by the Insurance Board of Nepal. CEO Suresh Prasad Khatri emphasized the company’s commitment to investing in its agent network, enhancing professionalism, and maintaining market leadership. The conclave concluded with entertainment, celebrating agents’ achievements, and reinforcing their vital role in National Life’s ongoing success.

articles.title: National Life Insurance Donates NPR 1 Crore for Post-Protest Infrastructure Reconstruction
articles.content: National Life Insurance Company Limited contributed NPR 1 crore to the Government of Nepal’s Physical Infrastructure Reconstruction Fund to support rebuilding and relief efforts after damages caused during the Gen Z protests on Bhadra 23–24. The cheque was handed over to Finance Minister Rameshwar Prasad Khanal by the company’s CEO, Suresh Prasad Khatri, and Deputy General Manager, Prajwol Sayami, in a special ceremony. This contribution is part of the company’s corporate social responsibility (CSR) initiatives, which allocate 1% of annual net profit to social development projects. The CEO reaffirmed the company’s commitment to continuing support in areas like education, health, disaster management, and environmental protection.

articles.title: National Life Insurance Honors Top Agents of Gandaki Province at CEO Club Program
articles.content: National Life Insurance Company Ltd. (NLICL) successfully held its CEO Club Member Honor Program in Pokhara, honoring top-performing agents from Gandaki Province for their outstanding achievements in FY 2081/82. The event, chaired by CEO Suresh Prasad Khatri, recognized 220 qualified agents with certificates, medals, and special awards such as the “National Ratna” and “National Star.” CEO Khatri highlighted that this was the first provincial-level program under NLIC’s plan to expand honors nationwide, with over 1,600 agents qualifying for the CEO Club across Nepal. The ceremony also featured a motivational training session by international trainer Kazim Raza, inspiring agents to strengthen their professional commitment and client engagement in the insurance sector.

articles.title: National Life Insurance Empowers Top Agents Through “Start of Success” Program in Pokhara
articles.content: National Life Insurance Company Limited successfully organized a two-day motivational event, “Start of Success,” at Hotel Pokhara Grand, honoring around 300 top-performing agents who achieved their Bhadra 2082 incentive targets. The program, inaugurated by CEO Suresh Prasad Khatri, highlighted the company’s deep commitment to its agent network, the driving force behind its strong performance in FY 2081/82. The event combined recognition with professional development, featuring sales training sessions led by Marketing Head Vivek Sharma and an inspiring keynote from cultural icon Rajesh Hamal, who emphasized persistence, responsibility, and dedication. By integrating motivation, skills enhancement, and recognition, National Life reaffirmed its strategy of empowering agents, boosting morale, and strengthening its leadership in Nepal’s life insurance sector.

articles.title: 5% Bonus Shares of National Life Insurance Listed in NEPSE
articles.content: 26,06,066.54 unit bonus shares of National Life Insurance Co. Ltd. (NLICL) have been listed in NEPSE. The company convened it's 37th AGM on 5th Ashadh, 2082, and endorsed a 15% dividend for FY 2080/81. The company decided to distribute a 5% bonus share and a 10% cash dividend (including tax). The same bonus shares are now listed in NEPSE. As of writing, NLICL has an LTP of Rs. 606.54 .

articles.title: National Life Insurance Concludes Annual Conference Focusing on Growth, Leadership, and Regulatory Awareness
articles.content: National Life Insurance Company recently held its four-day Branch Managers Annual Conference in Dhulikhel, gathering over 150 participants, including department heads and marketing professionals. The event recognized branches that excelled in fiscal year 2081/82 and focused on planning for the upcoming year. Chairperson Prema Rajya Laxmi Singh emphasized expanding business through dedication amid market competition. Motivational leadership training was provided by Anil Keshary Shah, while Padam Prasad Sodari from Nepal Insurance Authority highlighted the need for vigilance against insurance misuse for asset laundering.

articles.title: National Life Hosts Grand Gala Concert to Honor Top-Performing Agents in Bhairahawa
articles.content: National Life Insurance Company organized a grand Gala Concert at Hotel Siddhartha Vilasa in Bhairahawa to honor agents who successfully met targets under the Jestha 2082 monthly plan. The event featured stress management training by expert Ramhari Paudel and musical performances by popular artists including Prakash Saput, Samikshya Adhikari, and Sonu Kumar Mandal, along with stand-up comedy and DJ entertainment. CEO Suresh Prasad Khatri inaugurated the event, which was attended by around 350 participants, including department and branch heads.

articles.title: National Life Insurance’s 37th AGM Approves 15% Dividend and Sets Growth Vision
articles.content: National Life Insurance held its 37th Annual General Meeting at its Lazimpat office, chaired by Prema Rajya Laxmi Singh. Shareholders approved a total 15% dividend, 10% in cash and 5% in bonus shares, raising the paid-up capital to over NPR 5.47 billion. The AGM endorsed financial reports, appointed auditors, and amended official documents to support capital growth. Five directors were elected unanimously. Chairperson Singh addressed plans, pledging timely AGMs and strong returns. The book closure date for dividend eligibility is June 5, 2024. The meeting emphasized transparency, leadership stability, and future growth.

articles.title: Sampada Laghubitta Marks 9th Anniversary with Nationwide Blood Donation and Social Impact Programs
articles.content:
On the occasion of its 9th anniversary, Sampada Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (SMPDA) organized a blood donation program under the slogan “Your one drop of blood can save a life.” Held at the central office in Dumre, Tanahun, the event collected 32 units of blood, while a parallel program in Bara district collected 41 units, totaling 73 units of blood. The event saw participation from local representatives, Red Cross officials, and institutional executives, who praised the initiative. As part of its corporate social responsibility, various branches of SMPDA carried out diverse community activities: i. Jhapa: Support for women's cultural group with traditional instruments.
ii. Rautahat, Parsa, Mahottari: Donations of ceiling fans to temples.
iii. Nuwakot, Rupandehi, Kapilvastu: Distribution of fruits and educational materials to orphanages and elderly homes.
iv. Banke & Kailali: Distribution of school and health supplies.
v. Kaski: Installation of traffic awareness boards. SMPDA currently operates in 45 districts across 7 provinces with 171 offices and a staff of 574, serving over 178,778 households, with a loan investment of NPR 9.95 billion and savings collection of NPR 2.66 billion.

articles.title: Sampada Laghubitta’s Net Profit Soars by 74.88% to Rs. 10.70 Crores in Q3; Net Interest Income at Rs. 48.33 Crores, EPS Climbs to Rs. 20.37
articles.content: Sampada Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha (SMPDA) has posted a significant net profit growth of 74.88% in the third quarter of fiscal year 2081/82, reaching Rs. 10.70 crores, compared to Rs. 6.12 crores in the same period last year. The company’s earnings per share (EPS) increased to Rs. 20.37, a notable jump from Rs. 11.65 in Q3 of 2080/81. Backed by strong lending operations, its net interest income more than doubled by 127.54%, rising to Rs. 48.33 crores from the previous Rs. 21.24 crores. Loans and advances to customers increased slightly by 3.22%, totaling Rs. 10.06 Arba, while customer deposits rose by 3.85% to Rs. 2.64 Arba. In contrast, borrowings declined by 3.45%, standing at Rs. 6.33 Arba. The microfinance company recorded a sharp rise in personnel expenses, up by 93.61% to Rs. 23.47 crores. Additionally, impairment charges skyrocketed by more than 8000%, reaching Rs. 5.87 crores, compared to just Rs. 7.23 lakhs in the previous year—an indicator of elevated credit risk provisions. Despite these rising expenses, operating profit jumped to Rs. 15.29 crores, also up by 74.88%, aligning with its bottom-line growth. However, the company reported a negative distributable profit of Rs. 72.89 lakhs after P/L appropriation and regulatory adjustments. Sampada Laghubitta’s capital adequacy ratio stood at 8.46%, slightly down from 8.50%, while non-performing loans (NPL) deteriorated to 6.71%, up from 4.10%. The cost of funds improved, dropping to 7.84% from 9.90%. The company's net worth per share rose by 10.83% to Rs. 153.98. As of the end of Q3, Sampada Laghubitta traded at Rs. 971.08 with a PE ratio of 47.68 times. Report: Major Highlights: * Figure is of the Immediate Fiscal Year Ending

articles.title: No Dividend To Sampada Laghubitta Shareholders for FY 2080/81
articles.content: Sampada Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (SMPDA) announces it will not distribute dividends for the Fiscal Year 2080/81. The 15th Board Meeting of SMPDA held on Falgun 11, 2081 has decided that the company will not distribute any dividend for FY 2080/81. It is important to note that this decision is contingent upon the approval of the financial statements by the regulatory authority, Nepal Rastra Bank, and the upcoming Annual General Meeting of the company. As of writing, SMPDA closed at Rs. 1,020.00.

articles.title: Promoter Shares of Sampada Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited in Auction From Today
articles.content: The existing promoter of Sampada Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (SMPDA) is auctioning 2,14,674 units of shares to the interested general public/institutions from today. The existing promoter shareholders intend to sell 2,14,674 units of promoter shares to the interested general public/institutions. Interested individuals are requested to bid for the auction within 15 days from the date of publication of this notice, i.e. 28th Kartik. The shareholders should submit their bids at the central office of the bank located at Dumre, Bandipur. Since no bids were received from existing founder shareholders within the specified timeframe, the shares are opened for auction to the general public from today. SMPDA closed at Rs. 955.50. Auction Notice:

articles.title: Sampada Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited Hosts Financial Literacy Training
articles.content: Sampada Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (SMPDA), based in Bandipur Village, Tanahun District, recently conducted a "Financial Literacy Training" at its Urahari branch. The training, which included a program on financial literacy, savings, and credit benefits, was attended by 81 client members, 20 parents, and 8 employees, totaling 109 participants. Key figures at the event included CEO Mr. Keshav Kumar Paudel, and trainers Mr. Komal Prasad Joshi, Mr. Bikram Upadhyaya, and Mr. Rima Kadel. The program featured a feeding session and performances related to financial literacy. Additionally, the institution held a similar training in Thori, Parsa District, with 211 participants. The program emphasized the importance of savings and responsible credit use and included speeches by local officials, highlighting the role of financial institutions in poverty alleviation and community development. Sampada Laghubitta, which operates 183 branches across 45 districts, provides microfinance services and financial literacy training to over 177,000 poor households. As of the end of Shravan 2081, the institution's investments totaled NPR 9.56 billion, with savings amounting to NPR 2.53 billion.

articles.title: After Successful Merger Between SABSL and SDLBSL, Shares of Sampada Laghubitta Listed in NEPSE
articles.content: 70,08,584 shares of Sampada Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha (SMPDA) after a successful merger between Sabaiko Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (SABSL) and Sadhana Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (SDLBSL) have been listed in NEPSE. SABSL and SDLBSL signed the merger agreement with each other at a swap ratio of 1:1. SABSL had a paid-up capital of Rs. 31.86 crores, while SDLBSL's paid-up capital was Rs. 38.22 crores. Following the merger, the combined paid-up capital has been recalculated to Rs. 70.08 crores SABSL and SDLBSL commenced the joint transaction in the name of "Sampada Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha (SMPDA)" on 30th Ashadh, 2081. The open price range is set as Rs. 1057 for the first transactions.

articles.title: Joint Trading of Sadhana Laghubitta and Sabaiko Laghubitta Shares Transactions Suspended
articles.content: The share transaction of Sadhana Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (SDLBSL) and Sabaiko Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (SABSL) has been halted in preparation for their joint integrated transaction. This step follows the completion of the final merger procedure between the two companies, which recently received approval from Nepal Rastra Bank (NRB). In accordance with Section 9 (2) of the Merger and Acquisition Directive 2079, the Nepal Stock Exchange (NEPSE) has issued a circular to suspend the share transactions of SDLBSL and SABSL. The new entity is to be named "Sampada Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited." The joint business operations are set to commence on Ashad 30, 2081. It is important to note that all services from both companies will be temporarily suspended on Ashadh 29th to facilitate the smooth transition of data. After the merger, the central office of "Sampada Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited" will be located at Bandipur-1, Dumre, Tanahun. SDLBSL closed at Rs. 1,067.00 and SABSL closed at Rs. 1,045.00 yesterday.

articles.title: After The Successful Merger of SabaikoLaghubitta And Sadhana Laghubitta to Commence Joint Transaction from Ashadh 30
articles.content: Sabaiko Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (SABSL) and Sadhana Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (SDLBSL), a licensed financial institution of the "D" category from Nepal Rastra Bank have completed the final merger procedure. By the letter from the NRB, SEBON, and the Office of the Registrar of Companies, the merger has also gained final permission. The Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) agreement had been signed between the two companies on Bhadra 15, 2080. "Sampada Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited" has been agreed upon as the name of the new company that will be formed as a result of the merger and the integrated business will be carried out from 30th Ashadh, 2081. However, given that the integrated business is scheduled to commence on Ashadh 30th, it is important to note that all services from both companies will be temporarily suspended on Ashadh 29th to facilitate the smooth transition of data. SABSL's current paid-up capital stands at Rs. 31.86 crores, while SDLBSL's paid-up capital is Rs. 38.22 crores. After the acquisition, the location of the central office of 'Sampada Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited' will remain at Bandipur-1, Dumre, Tanahun. SDLBSL closed at Rs. 1,055.00 and SABSL closed at Rs. 984.90. Notice:

articles.title: ICRA Nepal Places Ratings of Three Hydropower Companies on “Watch with Developing Implications”
articles.content: ICRA Nepal Limited has placed Samling Power Company Limited’s issuer rating on “Watch with Developing Implications”, assigning it a rating of [ICRANP-IR] BB-&. This indicates a moderate risk of default in meeting financial obligations. The symbol ‘&’ signifies that the rating is under observation for potential change. In ICRA’s rating scale, a “+” or “–” denotes a company’s relative standing within the same category, for example, BB+ is higher than BB, while BB– is lower. Similarly, ICRA Nepal Limited has placed Mai Khola Hydropower Limited’s issuer rating on “Watch with Developing Implications”, assigning it a rating of [ICRANP-IR] BB+&. This indicates a moderate risk of default in meeting financial obligations. The ‘&’ symbol shows that the rating is under review for possible changes. In ICRA’s rating scale, BB+ represents a level above BB, while BB– is one notch below BB. And, ICRA Nepal Limited has placed Sagarmatha Jalabidhyut Company Limited’s issuer rating on “Watch with Developing Implications”, assigning it a rating of [ICRANP-IR] BBB-&. This rating signifies a moderate degree of safety in meeting financial obligations. The ‘&’ symbol indicates that the rating is currently under review and may change based on future developments. In ICRA’s rating scale, BBB+ is one notch higher than BBB, while BBB– is one notch lower.

articles.title: Samling Power Company Ltd. Reports Major Damage to Mai Beni Hydropower Project Due to Landslides and Floods
articles.content: Samling Power Company Ltd. has informed that, as per prior warnings issued by the Government of Nepal and relevant authorities, continuous rainfall has been recorded across various regions of the country, including Ilam district and surrounding areas, since 18th Ashwin 2082 BS. These rains have already caused both human and material losses, which are widely known. In the early hours of 19th Ashwin 2082, around 2–3 AM, unexpected landslides and flooding occurred, severely damaging the physical infrastructure of the Mai Beni Hydropower Project (9.51 MW), constructed and operated by Samling Power Company Ltd. Since flooding in the river has not yet fully subsided, the assessment of damages is ongoing. Currently, electricity generation from the project has been completely suspended.

articles.title: Samling Power Swings to Rs. 38.59 Lakh Profit Despite 10% Drop in Electricity Revenue; EPS at Rs. 0.77
articles.content: Samling Power Company Limited (SPC) has reported a net profit of Rs. 38.59 lakh in the fourth quarter of FY 2081/82, marking a strong turnaround from a net loss of Rs. 3.72 crore in the same period last fiscal year. The company generated revenue of Rs. 22.58 crore during the quarter, down 10.30% from Rs. 25.18 crore a year ago, primarily due to lower electricity sales. Cost of sales increased by 11.42% to Rs. 2.49 crore, while administrative expenses fell 22.39% to Rs. 1.23 crore, aiding the return to profitability. Reserves rose 28.96% to Rs. 3.92 crore, while borrowings decreased 3.73% to Rs. 1.46 Arba. The company’s property, plant, and equipment stood at Rs. 2.01 Arba, reflecting a slight 2.63% decline compared to last year. Annualized earnings per share improved to Rs. 0.77 from a loss per share of Rs. 7.43 in the previous fiscal year, while net worth per share edged up 1.66% to Rs. 107.84. At the end of the quarter, the company’s shares traded at Rs. 538.17, with a high price-to-earnings ratio of 697.36 times. Report:

articles.title: Samling Power Company Calls AGM on Poush 2; What are the Agendas?
articles.content:
Samling Power Company Limited (SPC) has called its 6th AGM on 2nd Poush, 2081. The meeting will be held in The Entrance Cafe, Lalitpur, starting at 10:30 AM that day. These are the agendas of the AGM: 1) Endorsement of financial reports for the fiscal year 2080/81.
2) Endorse the auditor's report with PL statements, financial reports, and cash flow reports.
3) Endorse the appointment of the auditor for the fiscal year 2081/82.
4) Miscellaneous. Mangsir 19 is the book closure date. Thus, shareholders maintained before that day can attend the AGM. AGM Notice:

articles.title: Samling Power Company Announces Conclusion of Lock-in Period for Promoters, Local Residents of the Project-Affected Area, And Employee Shares on Kartik 15
articles.content: Samling Power Company Limited (SPC) published a notice regarding the expiration of the lock-in period of its promoter shares, employee shares, and residents of the project-affected area will expire on 15th Kartik, 2081. As per the recent guidelines issued by the Securities Board of Nepal (SEBON), Samling Power Company Limited (SPC) has officially provided notice to its investors and stakeholders on the conclusion of the lock-in period for the shares held by its promoter shareholders, and employees. In the next month of the 15th Kartik, the lock-in period will end. SPC now has 5,000,000 units of shares listed on the Nepal Stock Exchange (NEPSE). Within the total of 5,000,000 units of shares, the promoters held 3,770,000 units, the residents of the project-affected area had 5,00,000 units of shares, and the company's employees had 14,600 units of shares, all subject to a lock-in period since the IPO allotment three years ago. The total paid-up capital of the company is Rs. 50 Crores. As outlined in the official notice, the shares held by the Board of Directors and employees at higher management won't be tradable after the lock-in period. SPC closed at Rs. 519.30. Notice:

articles.title: ICRA Nepal reaffirms issuer rating of ICRANP-IR BB- to Samling Power Company indicating moderate risk of default regarding timely servicing of financial obligations
articles.content: ICRA Nepal Limited has reaffirmed the issuer rating of [ICRANP-IR] BB- (Pronounced ICRA NP issuer rating double B minus) to Samling Power Company Limited. Issuers with this rating are considered to have moderate risk of default regarding timely servicing of financial obligations. For the Rating categories [ICRANP-IR] AA through to [ICRANP-IR] C the sign of + (plus) or – (minus) may be appended to the Rating symbols to indicate their relative position within the Rating categories concerned. Thus, the Rating of [ICRANP-IR] BB+ is one notch higher than [ICRANP-IR] BB, while [ICRANP-IR] BB- is one notch lower than [ICRANP-IR] BB.

articles.title: MERO's Share Structure Change: Promoter to Public Transfer Approved
articles.content: Mero Microfinance Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (MERO) has requested the recording of the changed share structure following the conversion of its shares. Out of the total listed shares of 1,41,90,000, the new structure post-conversion will allocate 72,36,900 shares (51%) to the promoter shareholding group and 69,53,100 shares (49%) to the public shareholding group. As per the decision made on 25th Falgun 2081, 11,91,960 shares from the promoter shareholding shares have been transferred to the public shareholding group. The company has officially requested the recording of this change in the securities registry.

articles.title: Bonus Shares of Mero Microfinance and Sarbottam Cement Now Listed in NEPSE
articles.content: 9,90,000 unit bonus shares of Mero Microfinance Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Ltd. (MERO) have been listed in NEPSE. The company convened its 12th AGM on 4th Magh, 2081, and endorsed a 7.8947% dividend for FY 2080/81 from the paid-up capital stands of Rs. 1.32 Arba. 7.5% bonus share worth Rs. 9.90 crores and a 0.3947% cash dividend (including tax) worth Rs. 52.10 lakhs were proposed. The same bonus shares are now listed in NEPSE. As of writing, MERO has an LTP of Rs. 717.92. 32,55,000 unit bonus shares of Sarbottam Cement Limited (SARBTM) have been listed in NEPSE. The company convened its 6th AGM on Poush 26, 2081, and endorsed a 10% dividend for the fiscal year 2080/81. A 3% cash dividend worth Rs. 13.95 Crores (including tax) and 7% bonus shares worth Rs. 32.55 crores were proposed from the paid-up capital is Rs. 4.65 Arba. The same bonus shares are now listed in NEPSE. As of writing, SARBTM has an LTP of Rs. 783.82.

articles.title: Mero Microfinance Laghubitta Calls AGM on 4th Magh To Endorse 7.8947% Dividend; When's the Book Closure?
articles.content: Mero Microfinance Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (MERO) has called its 12th AGM on 4th Magh, 2081. The meeting will be held in the Siddhartha Hotel Water Tower, Nuwakot, starting at 11:30 am that day. Among the other agendas, the AGM will endorse a 7.8947% dividend for FY 2080/81. The company’s current paid-up capital stands at Rs. 1.32 Arba. Out of this, the proposed dividend includes a 7.5% bonus share worth Rs. 9.90 crores and a 0.3947% cash dividend (including tax) worth Rs. 52.10 lakhs. Furthermore, there is an agenda to endorse the auditor's report with PL statements, financial reports, and cash flow reports and appoint an auditor for the fiscal year 2081/82. There's also an agenda to elect 2 directors from the public shareholding group. After the bonus share distribution, the capital structure will shift from 59.40% promoter shareholders and 40.60% public shareholders to 51% promoter shareholders and 49% public shareholders. The book closure date is on Poush 19. Thus, shareholders maintained before that day are entitled to the dividend payout and can also attend this AGM. AGM Notice:

articles.title: Mero Microfinance Laghubitta Proposes 7.8947% Dividend for FY 2080/81; How Much is Bonus and Cash Dividend?
articles.content: From the 165th meeting of the Board of Directors of Mero Microfinance Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (MERO) held on Poush 1, the company has decided to distribute a total dividend of 7.8947%, amounting to Rs. 10.42 crores, for the fiscal year 2080/81. The company’s current paid-up capital stands at Rs. 1.32 Arba. Out of this, the proposed dividend includes a 7.5% bonus share worth Rs. 9.90 crores and a 0.3947% cash dividend (including tax) worth Rs. 52.10 lakhs. The financial statement will be submitted to Nepal Rastra Bank for necessary approval, and the proposed dividend will be distributed after receiving approval from Nepal Rastra Bank and the company’s Annual General Meeting (AGM). Dividend History:

articles.title: Mero Microfinance Unveils Q4 Report with 362.59% Increase in Net Profit; EPS Reached to Rs. 16.63
articles.content: In its recently disclosed fourth-quarter report for the fiscal year 2080/2081, Mero Microfinance Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (MERO) demonstrated an impressive financial performance, reporting a remarkable 362.59% increase in net profit. The net profit surged from Rs. 4.74 crores to Rs. 21.95 crores compared to the same quarter last year. MERO experienced a significant 14.06% rise in core revenue (net interest income), which increased to Rs. 87.48 crores from Rs. 76.7 crores in the corresponding quarter of the previous year, substantially contributing to the growth in net profits. Additionally, while deposits saw a marginal decline of 0.49% to Rs. 3.40 Arba, loans and advances experienced a slight decrease of 0.48%, reaching Rs. 13.85 Arba during this quarter. In Q4, MERO reported impairment charges amounting to Rs. 1.94 crores, reflecting a significant decline of 84.48%, which positively impacted the net profit. MERO's financial position showed a paid-up capital of Rs. 1.32 Arba, reserves and surplus at Rs. 69.27 crores, and retained earnings of Rs. 19.62 crores. The annualized earnings per share (EPS) stood at Rs. 16.63, with a net worth per share of Rs. 160.53. During this period, MERO traded at a P/E multiple of 42.08 times. Report: Major Financial Highlights: * Figures are of Immediate Previous Year Quarter Ending

articles.title: Conversion of Promoter Shares of Mero Microfinance Laghubitta; Shareholding Ratio Changed To 59.4 :40.6
articles.content: A notice has been published by Mero Microfinance Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (MERO) where the promoter-public shares conversion from the existing 69.40% - 30.60% has been changed to 59.40% - 40.60% as granted by Nepal Rastra Bank and endorsed by their 11th AGM. As of now, the company has 13,200,000 unit shares listed in NEPSE. Likewise, the shareholding structure consisted of promotors (69.40%) i.e. 9,160,800 units, and the public (30.60%) i.e. 4,039,200 units. Now, it has been converted to 59.40% Promoter shares i.e. 78,40,800 units, and 40.60% Public shares i.e. 53,59,200 units. This means about 13,20,000 units were added to the public shareholders. MERO closed at Rs.716.00.

articles.title: Lower Piluwa River Small Hydroelectric Project Resumed Electricity Production Following Devastating Flood Damage
articles.content: In a bid to recover from the extensive damage inflicted by the catastrophic flood on Ashadh 2, 2080, the Lower Piluwa River Small Hydroelectric Project (990 kW) has initiated reconstruction efforts. Operated by Shuvam Power Limited (SPL), the project suffered a halt in electricity production since the date of the flood. However, recent developments indicate significant progress in the restoration process. Following meticulous testing and repair work on the electrical equipment, the project is now poised to resume its vital role in electricity generation. With reconstruction nearing completion and connections to the powerhouse and switchyard underway, the project is expected to reinitiate electricity production imminently. In a formal request, Shuvam Power Limited (SPL) has urged authorities to authorize the commencement of electricity generation from the project starting from the 22nd of Jestha 2081. This request underscores the readiness of the project to contribute to the regional power supply once again, marking a pivotal step towards recovery from the setback caused by the natural disaster. The swift response and dedication demonstrated by Shuvam Power Limited (SPL) in restoring the Lower Piluwa River Small Hydroelectric Project underscore its commitment to sustainable energy production and resilience in the face of adversity. As efforts continue to ensure the project's seamless operation, stakeholders anticipate its reinstatement as a reliable source of electricity for the region.

articles.title: IPO Shares of Shuvam Power and Super Madi Hydropower Listed in NEPSE; What are the Opening Ranges?

The IPO shares will trade in the secondary market the next day if the company signs the agreement with NEPSE. Out of a total of 20,00,000 units of shares worth Rs. 20 crores, 481,882 units worth Rs 4.81 crores had been issued as Initial Public Offering to the general public from (Magh 18-22, 2079). Similarly, 2,10,00,000 unit IPO shares of Super Madi Hydropower Limited (SMHL) have also been listed in NEPSE. This includes the shares held by promoters and the quantity issued to the general public and project-affected locals. The opening range for the first transaction is Rs. 99.80 to Rs. 299.40. The IPO shares will trade in the secondary market the next day if the company signs the agreement with NEPSE. Out of a total of 2,10,00,000 units of shares worth Rs. 2.1 Arba, 17,43,000 units worth Rs 17.43 crore as Initial Public Offering to the general public from (Magh 9-12, 2079).

articles.title: Shuvam Power IPO Allotment Concludes; Lucky 48,188 Applicants Got 10 Units Each Via Lottery System
articles.content: The IPO allotment of Shuvam Power Limited (SHUVAM) is concluded today at the premises of Muktinath Capital Limited, Kathmandu. Shuvam Power Limited (SHUVAM) had issued 4,81,882 units worth Rs 4.81 crore as Initial Public Offering (IPO) to the general public (Magh 18-22, 2079). A total of 11,610 units were allotted to the employees and 29,030 units were allotted to the mutual funds. In total 3587 applicants who applied for 47,200 units were disqualified due to duplicate applications from Local Shareholders, Foreign Employee Shareholders, Staff, and C-ASBA Suspect. articles.title: IPO Allotment of Shuvam Power to be Concluded Tomorrow Morning; 48,188 Lucky Applicants will Get 10 units Each
articles.content: The IPO allotment of Shuvam Power Limited (SHUVAM) will take place tomorrow morning, i.e. on 27th Magh, 2079. The allotment program will be held on the premises of the issue manager Muktinath Capital Limited, Naxal. The company issued 481,882 units of shares of Rs 100 face value as an Initial Public Offering worth Rs 4.81 crore to the general public from the 18th Magh till the 22nd Magh. Out of the total 580,580 units; 10% i.e. 58,058 units have already been allotted to Nepalese citizens working abroad, whereas 2% i.e 11,610 units were set aside for the employees of the company and 5% of the total offered shares i.e. 29,030 units were set aside for the mutual funds. The remaining 481,882 units were for the general public. The paid-up capital of the company will reach Rs. 20 Crores after the IPO issuance. According to data presented by CDSC, the issue has received approx 13,64,756 applications applying for a total of 15,121,130 units of shares till the last day. Thus, the IPO was oversubscribed by 31.37 times in terms of the number of units through ordinary applicants as of the closing day. Looking at the data, it is apparent that only 48,188 lucky applicants will get ownership of the company. CARE Ratings Nepal Limited (CRNL) has assigned the issuer rating assigned of ‘CARE-NP BB+ (Is)’ to Shuvam Power Limited. Issuers with this rating are considered to have a moderate risk of default regarding the timely servicing of financial obligations in Nepal.

articles.title: Shuvam Power IPO Collects Rs. 1.51 Arba From 13.64 Lakh Applicants Till Last Day; IPO Oversubscribed by More Than 31.37 Times
articles.content: Shuvam Power Limited (SHUVAM) issued 481,882 units of shares worth Rs. 4.81 crores to the general public as a part of their Initial Public Offering (IPO) from 18th Magh till 22nd Magh, 2079. Out of the total 580,580 units; 10% i.e. 58,058 units have already been issued and allotted to Nepalese citizens working abroad, whereas 2% i.e 11,610 units were set aside for the employees of the company and 5% of the total offered shares i.e. 29,030 units were set aside for the mutual funds. The remaining 481,882 units were for the general public. The paid-up capital of the company will reach Rs. 20 Crores after the IPO issuance. According to CDSC, 13,64,756 applicants have applied for a total of 15,121,130 units worth Rs. 1.51 Arba till the last day. Thus, the IPO was oversubscribed by more than 31.37 times in terms of the number of units through ordinary applicants as of closing day. Muktinath Capital Limited was appointed as the issue manager for the IPO issuance. Applications could be placed for a minimum of 10 units and a maximum of 5,000 units. Shuvam Power Limited is a public limited company, incorporated on December 29, 2015. SPL is involved in the operation of the 0.99MW run-of-the-river Lower Piluwa Khola Small Hydroelectric Project (LPKHP) at Sankhuwasabha District which has been in commercial operation since July 17, 2011. The company obtained the Generation License, from the Government of Nepal – Ministry of Energy on April 15, 2008.

articles.title: Bids Received in Auction of NLG Insurance Company Ordinary And Promoter Shares Opened; What is the Cut-Off Rate?
articles.content: NLG Insurance Company Limited (NLG) opened the bids for its unclaimed right shares auction on Falgun 1. LS Capital was appointed as the auction manager. The bidding process took place at the Agrawal Bhawan premises in Kamalpokhari, Kathmandu, starting at 8:30 am. The auction opened on 20th Magh and concluded on 27th Magh, 2081 at the end of banking hours. In total 29,977.31 units of promoter right shares and 2,90,555.91 units of ordinary right were auctioned. Individuals and companies were all eligible to bid in the auction. This is the unclaimed portion of the rights offering. The company opened a 10:6.256 ratio right share issue to its shareholders from 11th Mangsir to 16th Poush, 2081. The same unsold right shares were auctioned to the general public. The minimum bid rate for the auction was Rs. 100. While the minimum bid quantity for shares was 1,000 units, there was no upper limit. Although bidders could bid for the entirety of the issue, they were required to abide by the regulatory body's rule not to exceed the specified quantity of shares per entity. According to the auction manager, a total of 1,311 applicants placed bids for 2,90,555.91 units of ordinary right shares, and 6 applicants placed bids for 29,977.31 units of promoter right shares. The tentative cut-off rate is Rs. 951 whereas the maximum bid rate stood at Rs. 1,131. Once all of the checks get reconciled and cleared, the cut-off price may vary. The last traded price of the scrip stands at Rs 1,100.00 per share.

articles.title: Sana Kisan Bikas Laghubitta Reports Rs. 51.77 Crore Net Profit in Q2 2081/82, EPS at Rs. 24.01, Driven by Lower Impairment Charges
articles.content: Sana Kisan Bikas Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (SKBBL) has reported a net profit of Rs. 51.77 crore in the second quarter (Q2) of the fiscal year 2081/82, reflecting a 17.01% growth compared to Rs. 44.25 crore in the same period last year. Despite a decline in net interest income and loans and advances, the company’s profitability improved due to lower impairment charges and operational efficiency. The company's net interest income stood at Rs. 96.81 crore, a slight decrease of 2.23% from Rs. 99.02 crore in Q2 2080/81. However, impairment charges dropped significantly by 69.52% to Rs. 3.05 crore, easing pressure on the bottom line. As a result, operating profit increased by 6.84% to Rs. 75.27 crore. Total loans and advances to customers declined by 12.16% to Rs. 33.48 arba, while deposits from customers remained relatively stable at Rs. 2.82 Arba. On the other hand, reserves increased by 4.94% to Rs. 4.09 arba, strengthening the company's financial position. The company’s capital adequacy ratio declined to 14.66% from 18.50%, while the non-performing loan (NPL) ratio increased to 2.27% from 2.00%, indicating a slight deterioration in asset quality. However, the cost of funds dropped significantly to 3.71% from 6.19%, reducing borrowing costs. In terms of market performance, Sana Kisan Bikas Laghubitta’s annualized earnings per share (EPS) improved to Rs. 24.01 from Rs. 23.25, while the net worth per share declined by 7.25% to Rs. 231.18. At the end of the quarter, the company’s stock was trading at Rs. 811 per share, with a price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 33.78 times. Report: * Figure is of Immediate Fiscal Year Ending

articles.title: Sana Kisan Bikas Laghubitta Posts 22.77% Surge in Q4 Net Profit to Rs. 94.96 Crore; Core Revenue Jumps 31.44%
articles.content: Sana Kisan Bikas Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (SKBBL) has reported strong financial results for the fourth quarter of FY 2080/2081, with net profit rising by 22.77% to Rs. 94.96 crore, up from Rs. 77.35 crore in the same period last year. This significant growth was driven by a 31.44% increase in core revenue, with net interest income reaching Rs. 2.19 Arba, compared to Rs. 1.66 Arba in the previous year. Despite a 14.07% decline in its loan and advance portfolio to Rs. 38.12 Arba, SKBBL saw a 4.40% increase in borrowings, totaling Rs. 20.14 Arba. The financial report also highlighted impairment charges of Rs. 43.65 crore for the quarter. SKBBL's financial position remains with a paid-up capital of Rs. 3.806 Arba, retained earnings of Rs. 1.72 Arba, and reserves and surplus amounting to Rs. 3.91 Arba. The company’s annualized earnings per share (EPS) stood at Rs. 24.95, with a net worth per share of Rs. 248.81. SKBBL shares were traded at a price-to-earnings (P/E) multiple of 34.22 times during the period, and the company reported a distributable profit of Rs. 1.72 Arba. Report Major Highlights: * Figures are of Immediate Previous Year Quarter Ending

The current paid-up capital is Rs. 1.47 Arbas. After adjusting the proposed right share, i.e., 14,764,000 units, the company's paid-up capital will increase to Rs. 2.95 Arba. Citizens Capital Limited is appointed as the issue manager. Notice:

The company will be issuing 100% right shares worth Rs. 1.47 Arba through the issue of 14,764,000 (1: 1) units of right shares to its existing shareholders. The current paid-up capital is Rs. 1.47 Arbas. After the adjustment of the proposed right share, i.e., 14,764,000 units, the company's paid-up capital will increase to Rs. 2.95 Arba. Citizens Capital Limited is appointed as the issue manager. As of writing, SSHL closed at Rs. 263.69.

articles.title: Pure Energy Posts Rs. 9 Million Profit in Q1, Strengthens Position as Nepal’s Leading Solar Power Producer
articles.content: Pure Energy Limited has reported a net profit of Rs. 9.05 million in the first quarter of FY 2082/83, up from Rs. 5.26 million in the same period last year, marking a strong start to the fiscal year. The company earned Rs. 65.5 million in revenue from electricity sales during the quarter, generated by its two 10 MW solar plants in Banke, which began commercial operations in Baisakh 2080 after signing a Power Purchase Agreement (PPA) with the Nepal Electricity Authority (NEA). Pure Energy, a subsidiary of the Golyan Group, continues to supply uninterrupted electricity to NEA and has maintained timely repayment of loans and interest as per Nepal Rastra Bank regulations. Following its IPO issuance earlier this year, the company’s paid-up capital has reached Rs. 800 million. Financial indicators also showed improvement, Earnings Per Share (EPS) rose from Rs. 3.29 to Rs. 4.50, while net worth per share increased from Rs. 97.27 to Rs. 101.61 year-on-year. In addition, Pure Energy holds a 26% stake in Solar Power, which is developing five solar projects that recently signed PPAs with NEA. With consistent profitability and expansion, Pure Energy continues to lead Nepal’s transition toward sustainable solar energy production.

articles.title: Lock-in Period of 72,000 Units of Pure Energy Limited Shares Held by Mutual Funds to Expire on Kartik 11
articles.content: Pure Energy Limited (PURE) has informed that the lock-in period of 72,000 ordinary shares allocated to mutual funds will end on 11th Kartik, 2082. The company had issued a total of 8,000,000 unit shares, equivalent to 20% of its issued capital of Rs. 80 crores. Out of this, 5%, or 72,000 shares, were allocated to mutual funds with a mandatory six-month lock-in period. With the completion of the lock-in period, these shares will be free for trading from the specified date. This notice is intended to inform all investors and concerned stakeholders accordingly. Notice

articles.title: Pure Energy Ltd Announces Rescheduled 8th Annual General Meeting Amid Improved National Situation
articles.content: Pure Energy Ltd, a leading company in the energy sector, had initially scheduled its 8th Annual General Meeting (AGM) for 10:00 AM on 24th Bhadra 2082 at Anand Bhumi Events, Baneshwor. However, due to prevailing conditions in the country, the company had published a notice on 23rd Bhadra 2082 postponing the meeting to ensure the safety and security of its shareholders. With the situation in the country gradually returning to normal and becoming safer, Pure Energy Ltd has now confirmed that the 8th AGM will be held as per the original agenda. The rescheduled meeting will take place on 7th Ashwin 2082 at Ananda Bhumi Events, Baneshwor, Kathmandu, starting at 10:00 AM. Notice:

articles.title: Pure Energy Limited Calls 8th AGM on Bhadra 24
articles.content:
Pure Energy Limited (PURE) has called its 8th AGM on 24th Bhadra, 2082. The meeting will be held at Ananda Bhumi Events, Baneshwor, Kathmandu, starting at 10:00 a.m. that day. These are the agendas of the AGM: 1) Endorsement of the annual report of the company
2) Endorse the auditor's report of 2081/082 with PNL statements, financial reports, and cash flow reports.
3) Appointment of the auditor and determination of their remuneration for the fiscal year 2082/83.
4) To discuss with the board of directors.
5) Miscellaneous. The book closure date is announced on Bhadra 9. Investors who maintained before that day are eligible to attend the AGM.

articles.title: IPO Shares of Pure Energy Limited Listed In NEPSE; What is the Opening Ranges?

The opening range for the first transaction is Rs. 96.45 to Rs. 289.35. If the company signs an agreement with NEPSE, the IPO shares will be traded in the secondary market the next day. Out of a total of 80,00,000 unit shares, 16,00,000 units of IPO shares with a par value of Rs 100 were issued to the general public from 28th Chaitra- 2nd Baishakh, 2082. Note that the listed shares will be traded under the symbol 'PURE'.

articles.title: Reminder! Last Day to Grab Dividend Proposed by RSDC Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited
articles.content: Today is the last day to grab the dividend proposed by RSDC Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (RSDC). The company has also called its 12th AGM on 12th Mangsir, 2082. The meeting will be held in Western Asian Hotel Pvt. Ltd., Butwal, starting at 11:00 am that day. Among the other agendas, the AGM will endorse an 8% dividend from the profits of FY 81/82 for shareholders. The 176th meeting of the Board of Directors (BODs) held on Ashwin 11 has decided to distribute an 8% dividend from the paid-up capital of Rs. 1.03 Arba. 8% for cash dividend (including tax) has been proposed. The book closure date is from Kartik 25. Therefore, the shareholders who maintained before that day are entitled to dividend payout and can attend this AGM.

articles.title: RSDC Laghubitta’s Net Profit Declines by 19.12% in Q1; EPS Declined to Rs. 8.17
articles.content: RSDC Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (RSDC) has published its unaudited financial report for the first quarter of the fiscal year 2082/83, revealing a decline in profitability compared to the corresponding period of the previous fiscal year. The microfinance institution posted a net profit of Rs. 2.11 crore, marking a 19.12% drop from the Rs. 2.6 crore earned in Q1 of FY 2082/83. Similarly, operating profit declined sharply by 19.12%, falling from Rs. 3.72 crore to Rs. 3.01 crore. Despite the decline in profit, the company maintained growth in its core financial base. Its paid-up capital stood at Rs. 1.03 arba. Likewise, reserves rose by 4.07% to Rs. 19.06 crore. However, RSDC Laghubitta experienced a notable drop in net interest income, which fell by 30.04% to Rs. 4.48 crore. Personnel expenses were reduced by 0.73%, amounting to Rs. 99.48 lakhs during the review period. The institution’s impairment charges for loans and advances stood at Rs. 42.87 lakhs in Q1. In terms of market performance, the company’s annualized earnings per share (EPS) declined to Rs. 8.17, and its net worth per share increased by 1.8% to Rs. 128.04. articles.title: RSDC Laghubitta’s Net Profit Declines by 27.19% in Q4; Operating Profit Contracts Over 40%
articles.content: RSDC Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (RSDC) has published its unaudited financial report for the fourth quarter of the fiscal year 2081/82, revealing a decline in profitability compared to the corresponding period of the previous fiscal year. The microfinance institution posted a net profit of Rs. 10.31 crore, marking a 27.19% drop from the Rs. 14.17 crore earned in Q4 of FY 2080/81. Similarly, operating profit declined sharply by 40.39%, falling from Rs. 25.14 crore to Rs. 14.99 crore. Despite the decline in profit, the company maintained a growth in its core financial base. Its paid-up capital increased by 9.50% to reach Rs. 1.03 arba, up from Rs. 94.43 crore in the previous year. Likewise, reserves rose by 11.19% to Rs. 18.29 crore. However, RSDC Laghubitta experienced a notable drop in net interest income, which fell by 22.52% to Rs. 22.45 crore. Personnel expenses were reduced by 18.59%, amounting to Rs. 3.78 crore during the review period. A significant rise was recorded in borrowings, which surged by 27.05% to Rs. 68.09 crore. Meanwhile, loans and advances to customers remained relatively stable, with a marginal decline of 0.98% to Rs. 62.44 crore. The institution’s impairment charges for loans and advances stood at Rs. 2.68 crore in Q4, compared to a reversal of Rs. 65.66 lakh in the previous year. Key financial indicators also showed signs of strain: Annualized Earnings Per Share (EPS) dropped to Rs. 9.98 from Rs. 15.01, a decline of 33.51%. Net worth per share stood at Rs. 125.95, slightly lower than last year’s Rs. 127.73. Capital adequacy ratio was maintained at 18.45%, a minimal drop from 18.49%. Non-performing loan (NPL) ratio rose marginally to 3.34% from 3.31%. Cost of fund significantly improved, falling by 43.24% to 6.17%. As of the end of the quarter, the company’s price-to-earnings (PE) ratio stood at 70.26 times, with a quarter-end market price of Rs. 701.19 per share. articles.content: NRN Infrastructure and Development Limited (NRN) has called its 13th AGM on Poush 4, 2082. The meeting will be held in the Amrapali Banquet, Kathmandu, starting from 9:00 AM that day. articles.title: NRN Infrastructure and Development Reports 889% Surge in Net Profit in Q4; EPS Reaches to Rs. 52.23
articles.content: NRN Infrastructure and Development (NRN) has published its financial results for the fourth quarter of FY 2081/82, revealing a significant jump in profitability and revenue. The company’s net profit stood at Rs. 67.08 crore, soaring by 889.03% from Rs. 6.78 crore in the same period last year. Annualized earnings per share (EPS) surged to Rs. 52.23 from Rs. 5.55, marking an 841.93% increase. Total revenue reached Rs. 100.10 crore, a sharp rise of 900.44% compared to Rs. 10.00 crore in Q4 2080/81. Total expenses also climbed substantially to Rs. 11.38 crore, up 912.57% year-on-year. The company’s paid-up capital grew by 5% to Rs. 1.28 arba, while retained earnings expanded 521.41% to Rs. 72.20 crore. Investment revaluation reserve almost doubled, reaching Rs. 120.64 crore. Cash and cash equivalents more than doubled to Rs. 15.79 crore, while property, plant, and equipment stood at Rs. 1.40 crore, up 51.29%. Net worth per share increased to Rs. 250.15 from Rs. 158.99. As of the quarter’s end, the company’s P/E ratio was 43.64, with a closing share price of Rs. 2,279.19. Report:

articles.title: NRN Infrastructure & Development Ltd. Invests in Varnabas Museum Hotel Limited
articles.content: NRN Infrastructure & Development Limited (NRN) has officially informed the Securities Board of Nepal (SEBON) about its recent investment decision in the hospitality sector. As per the decision made in the 145th board meeting held on Ashadh 28, 2082, the company has entered into a share purchase agreement with Varnabas Museum Hotel Limited, a luxury heritage boutique hotel located in Shubarna Shamsher Marg, Kathmandu. The agreement was finalized on Ashadh 29, 2082, at 3:30 PM, whereby NRN committed to acquiring 9.09% of the total issued capital, equating to 14.2% of the promoter shares of Varnabas Museum Hotel Ltd. The deal involves the purchase of 10,00,000 promoter shares at a rate of Rs. 125 per share, amounting to a total investment of Rs. 12.5 crore. A key term of the agreement includes securing at least one seat on the Board of Directors of Varnabas Museum Hotel Limited for NRN’s representative, ensuring active involvement in the company's governance. Varnabas Museum Hotel Limited is a registered hospitality venture (Registration No. 341571/081) engaged in operating a luxury heritage boutique hotel. This strategic investment reflects NRN's diversification approach and interest in Nepal’s growing tourism and hospitality industry.

articles.title: CARE Ratings Assigns ‘BBB- (Is)’ Rating to NRN Infrastructure and Development Limited
articles.content: CARE Ratings Nepal Limited has assigned an issuer rating of ‘CARE-NP BBB- (Is)’ to NRN Infrastructure and Development Limited (NRN), indicating a moderate risk of safety regarding the timely servicing of financial obligations. The rating is supported by NRN's experienced management, solid capital structure, and association with a strong group in the hydropower sector. However, the rating is constrained by the company's concentrated investments in less-liquid promoter shares and high dependence on the hydropower sector, which exposes it to hydrology and sector-specific risks. The company's ability to generate returns from its investments and adapt to market volatility and regulatory changes will be key factors in determining its future financial stability.

articles.title: NRN Infrastructure Reports 400% Surge in Net Profit
articles.content: NRN Infrastructure and Development Limited has recorded an impressive 400% increase in net profit, as per its recently published financial report. The company achieved a net profit of Rs. 5.37 crore in the second quarter of the current fiscal year, a significant rise from Rs. 1.63 crore during the same period last year. Total revenue grew by 209.94% to Rs. 8.01 crore, while total expenses stood at Rs. 98.67 lakh, up from Rs. 54.91 lakh in the previous year. The company's retained earnings reached Rs. 10.55 crore, with total assets and liabilities standing at Rs. 38.14 crore and Rs. 1.41 crore, respectively. Earnings per share (EPS) saw a notable rise from Rs. 2.67 to Rs. 8.37, while the company's net worth per share reached Rs. 172.10, and the price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio was recorded at 135.65 times.

articles.title: NRN Infrastructure and Development Limited Appoints Nepal SBI Merchant Banking for Rights Share Issuance Management
articles.content: NRN Infrastructure and Development Limited (NRN) has partnered with Nepal SBI Merchant Banking Limited to manage the issuance of 12,843,724 units of ordinary shares in a 1:1 rights share ratio to its existing shareholders, as approved by the company’s AGM for fiscal year 2080/81. Established in 2069, NRN invests in sectors like hydropower, tourism, and hospitality. Nepal SBI Merchant Banking Limited, a subsidiary of Nepal SBI Bank Limited, offers investment and securities management services. This collaboration aims to enhance investment opportunities and strengthen Nepal’s capital market.

articles.title: Conversion of Promoter Shares of Samudayik Laghubitta; Shareholding Ratio To Be Changed To 61.11:38.89
articles.content: A notice has been published by Samudayik Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (SLBSL) where the promoter-public shares conversion from the existing 69.65% - 30.35% will be changed to 61.11% - 38.89% as granted by Nepal Rastra Bank. As of now, the company has 1,708,050 unit shares listed in NEPSE. Likewise, the shareholding structure consisted of promotors (69.65%) i.e. 1,189,657 units, and the public (30.35%) i.e. 518,393 units. Now, it will be converted to 61.11% promoter shares i.e. 10,43,789.355 units, and 38.89% Public shares i.e. 6,64,260.645 units Promoter shareholders must inform the company's head office within 35 days from the notice publication if they wish to retain their shares under the new structure. SLBSL closed at Rs. 1,800.00. Notice:

articles.title: For the Purpose of Joint Integrated Transaction, Share Trading of Samudayik Laghubitta And BPW Laghubitta To be Halted from Falgun 24
articles.content: The final procedure for a merger between Samudayik Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (SLBSL) and BPW Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (BPW) has been recently completed. Hence, as per Section 9 (3) of the Merger and Acquisition Directive 2079, Act, the Nepal Stock Exchange (NEPSE) has issued a circular regarding the suspension of share transactions of the company by Section 9 (3) of the Directory 2079. SLBSL and BPW had signed a merger deal at a swap ratio of 1:0.8535. As per the merger agreement, "Samudayik Laghubitta (SLBSL) and BPW Laghubitta (BPW)" have been agreed upon as the name of the new company that will be formed as a result of the merger. The companies will start the joint business on Falgun 24. The paid-up capital of SLBSL at the present is Rs. 14.52 Crores. Meanwhile, the paid-up capital of BPW is Rs. 3 Crores. As of writing, BPW and SLBSL have an LTP of Rs. 1,141.50 and Rs. 804.00 respectively.

articles.title: Samudayik Laghubitta and BPW Laghubitta Receives Green Light from Company Registrar For Merger
articles.content: Samudayik Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (SLBSL) has received official approval from the Company Registrar for its merger with BPW Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (BPW) on 8th of Falgun, 2080. The decision, sanctioned during the annual/special general meeting on Poush 27, 2080, heralds the creation of a unified entity poised for a strengthened financial foundation. Endorsing the decision made on Falgun 08, 2080, the office of the Registrar of Companies has granted its approval for the merger and accompanying capital amendment. SLBSL's issued and paid-up capital, initially pegged at Rs. 14.52 Crore each, has undergone a substantial increase, to stand at Rs. 17.08 Crores each post-merger. Notably, Nepal Rastra Bank issued its Final Approval on the 14th of Magh, 2080. The agreed-upon swap ratio for the merger stands at 1:0.8535, as established during the signing of the Memorandum of Understanding on Poush 3, 2079. BPW, with 3 lakh units of IPO shares listed, and SLBSL, with 14.52 lakh units listed on the Nepal Stock Exchange (NEPSE), contribute to a total paid-up capital of Rs. 3 Crores and Rs. 14.52 Crores, respectively. The merger, endorsed during a special general meeting on Ashwin 30, 2080, outlines that all debts and liabilities from the merging companies will be seamlessly absorbed by the consolidated entity, SLBSL. Post-merger, the company is obligated to adhere to several conditions: 1. Submission of the detailed capital structure of the company following the merger. 2. Disclosure and submission of the director's fees as per the company's regulations post-merger. 3. Conversion of issued share certificates of the merging companies and informing stakeholders accordingly. 4. Publication of public notice regarding the merger in national-level daily newspapers within 30 days. 5. Assumption of all debts and liabilities of the merging company by the consolidated entity, SLBSL.

articles.title: BPW Laghubitta and Samudayik Laghubitta Receive Final Approval From NRB for Merger
articles.content: BPW Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (BPW) and Samudayik Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (SLBSL) have received final approval from Nepal Rastra Bank (NRB) for the merger. As per the notice published in NEPSE, the letter issued by NRB dated Magh 24 has provided final approval for a merger between the two microfinance companies. Both companies had signed an MoU for the merger on Poush 3, 2079. BPW has 3 lakh units of its IPO shares listed and SLBSL has 14.52 lakh units of its shares listed on the Nepal Stock Exchange (NEPSE). Therefore, the total paid-up capital of BPW is Rs. 3 Crores whereas the same of SLBSL is Rs. 14.52 Crores. The swap ratio for the merger is fixed at 1: 0.8535. As of writing, BPW and SLBSL have an LTP of Rs. 1,425.00 and Rs. 823.00 respectively.

articles.title: Samudayik Laghubitta Decides Not To Distribute Dividend For FY 79/80
articles.content: Samudayik Laghubitta Bittiya Sanstha Limited (SLBSL) has declared that it will not be distributing any dividends for the Fiscal Year 2079/80. The decision was made during the 231st Board Meeting held on Mangsir 25. The SLBSL Board has approved the financials for the fiscal year 2079/80 and has not suggested any cash dividends or bonus shares for the fiscal year 2079/80. It is important to note that this decision is contingent upon the approval of the financial statements by the regulatory authority, Nepal Rastra Bank, and the upcoming Annual General Meeting of the company. As of writing, SLBSL has an LTP of Rs. 662.20. Past Dividend History:

articles.title: Sanvi Energy Ltd. Reports Significant Damage to Hydropower Plants Due to Landslides and Floods
articles.content: Sanvi Energy Ltd. has informed that, as per prior warnings issued by the Government of Nepal and relevant authorities, continuous rainfall has been observed across various regions of the country, including Ilam district and its surrounding areas, since 18th and 19th Ashwin 2082 BS. These rains have caused both human and material losses, which are already known to the public. On the morning of 19th Ashwin 2082, around 2–3 AM, unexpected landslides and flooding occurred, severely impacting the physical infrastructure of the Jogmai Khola Small Hydropower Project (7.6 MW) and the Jogmai Cascade Hydropower Project (5.2 MW), both constructed and operated by Sanvi Energy Ltd. As flooding in the river has not yet fully subsided, the assessment of damages is still ongoing. At present, electricity generation from these projects has been completely suspended.

articles.title: IPO Shares of Sanvi Energy Limited Listed In NEPSE; What is the Opening Ranges?
articles.content: 88,00,000 unit IPO shares of Sanvi Energy Limited (SANVI) have been listed in NEPSE. This includes the shares held by promoters and the quantity issued to the general public. The opening range for the first transaction is Rs. 120.74 to Rs. 362.22 . If the company signs an agreement with NEPSE, the IPO shares will be traded in the secondary market the next day. Out of a total of 88,00,000 unit shares, 3,790,000 units of IPO shares with a par value of Rs 100 were issued to the general public from 9th Jestha to 13th Jestha - 2082. Note that the listed shares will be traded under the symbol 'SANVI'.

articles.title: Sanvi Energy Limited IPO Allotment Concludes: Lucky 241,530 Applicants Allotted 10 Units Each via Lottery System
articles.content: Sanvi Energy Limited's IPO allotment was concluded today at the premises of the issue manager, Nepal SBI Merchant Banking Limited, Central Plaza, Kathmandu. Sanvi Energy Limited had issued 24,15,300 units worth Rs 24.15 crores as an Initial Public Offering (IPO) to the general public (9th Jestha- 13th Jestha, 2082). Out of the total 2,910,000 units, 1,45,500 (i.e., 5% of 29,10,000) have been set aside for mutual funds, and 58,200 (i.e., 2% of 29,10,000) units have been set aside for the company's employees. The remaining 2,415,300 units were issued to the general public at a par value of Rs. 100. The issue received a total of 20,30,157 applications for 23,795,640 units, resulting in an oversubscription of more than 9.85 times. Meanwhile, 3,674 applications were rejected. As per the allotment module, a total of 241,530 applicants were allotted 10 units each via lottery. The IPO result can be accessed by CDSC IPO Result, MeroShare, and Nepal SBI Merchant Banking. CARE Ratings Nepal Limited (CRNL) has reaffirmed the issuer rating of ‘CARE-NP BB+ (Is)’ for Sanvi Energy Limited (SEL). Issuers with this rating are considered to have a moderate risk of default in meeting their financial obligations on time in Nepal. Sanvi Energy Limited (SEL) is a public limited company, originally established in 2011 as a private entity and converted to a public limited company in July 2020. The company is promoted by individuals with extensive experience in hydropower and other sectors. SEL currently has two hydropower projects, one operational and the other under construction, both developed under the BOOT (Build, Own, Operate, Transfer) model.

articles.title: Super Madi Hydropower Reports 15.27% Rise in Net Profit in Q4; EPS Reaches to Rs. 6.33
articles.content: Super Madi Hydropower (SMHL) has released its fourth-quarter financial results for FY 2081/82, showing improved profitability supported by reduced financing costs, despite a drop in revenue from power sales. The company’s paid-up capital increased by 5% to Rs. 2.2 Arba, while other equity rose by 20.84% to Rs. 16.82 Crore. Property, plant, and equipment stood at Rs. 8.49 Arba, reflecting a 1.69% decline compared to the previous fiscal year. During the review period, the company made an investment worth Rs. 50 Crore, against no such investment in the prior year. Income from power sales fell by 11.01% to Rs. 1.13 Arba. However, financial costs dropped sharply by 25.16% to Rs. 55.48 Crore, significantly boosting profitability. As a result, net profit climbed by 15.27% to Rs. 13.95 Crore. Earnings per share (EPS) improved to Rs. 6.33 from Rs. 5.76, marking a 9.78% increase, while net worth per share inched up by 0.94% to Rs. 107.63. At the end of Q4 FY 2081/82, the company’s price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio stood at 174.82 times, with a quarter-end market price of Rs. 1,106.34 per share. Report

articles.title: 5% Bonus Shares of Super Madi Hydropower Now Listed in NEPSE
articles.content: 10,50,000 unit bonus shares of Super Madi Hydropower Limited (SMHL) have been listed in NEPSE. The company convened its 15th AGM on 5th Kartik, 2081, and endorsed a 5.263% dividend of FY 2080/81 for shareholders. The meeting of the board of directors held on Ashwin 8 has proposed a 5% bonus shares worth Rs. 10.50 Crores and 0.263% cash dividend worth Rs. 55,26,316 for the fiscal year 2080/81. The company's existing paid-up capital is Rs. 2.10 Arba. The same bonus shares are now listed in NEPSE. As of writing, SMHL has an LTP of Rs. 1,640.00.

articles.title: ICRA Nepal Downgrades Super Madi Hydropower Limited’s Issuer Rating to [ICRANP-IR] B-
articles.content: ICRA Nepal Limited has downgraded the issuer rating for Super Madi Hydropower Limited from [ICRANP-IR] BB+ to [ICRANP-IR] B-, indicating a high risk in meeting financial obligations on time. This rating reflects the issuer's general creditworthiness, not any specific bond. Ratings from [ICRANP-IR] AA to [ICRANP-IR] C, with "+" or "-" signs, denote relative positions within each rating class, where [ICRANP-IR] B+ is one level above [ICRANP-IR] B, and [ICRANP-IR] B- is one level below.

articles.title: Super Madi Hydropower Reports Strong Q1 Growth with 50.84% Profit Surge and Reduced Finance Costs; EPS Rose to Rs. 30.72
articles.content: Super Madi Hydropower Limited (SMHL) has reported impressive financial growth for the first quarter of 2081/82. The company’s reserves and surplus surged by 86.91%, reaching Rs. 30.05 crore, signaling a strengthened financial foundation. Investments in property, plant, and equipment rose by 11.33%, bringing the total to Rs. 8.56 Arba, underscoring the company's focus on long-term asset development. Notably, finance expenses dropped by 29.32% to Rs. 16.35 crore, contributing to a substantial increase in net profit, which rose by 50.84% to Rs. 16.13 crore. As a result, earnings per share (EPS) also improved by 50.84%, now standing at Rs. 30.72. The net worth per share grew by 6.18%, reaching Rs. 114.31, reflecting the company's solid financial position. With a quarter-end market price of Rs. 600 and a price-to-earnings (PE) ratio of 19.53 times.

articles.title: Reminder! Last Trading Day to Secure Super Madi Hydropower's Dividend
articles.content: Today is the last day to grab the 5.263% dividend Super Madi Hydropower Limited ( SMHL) proposed. The company has called its 15th AGM on 5th Kartik, 2081. The meeting will be held at Hotel Imperial, Battisputali, Kathmandu, starting at 11:00 a.m. that day. The meeting of the board of directors held on Ashwin 8 has proposed a 5% bonus shares worth Rs. 10.50 Crores and 0.263% cash dividend worth Rs. 55,26,316 for the fiscal year 2080/81. The company's existing paid-up capital is Rs. 2.10 Arba. The book closure date is on Ashwin 18. Therefore, the shareholders maintained before that day are entitled to dividend payout and can attend this AGM.

articles.title: Super Madi Hydropower Limited Proposes 5.263% Dividend; How Much in Bonus Shares and Cash?
articles.content: Super Madi Hydropower Limited (SMHL) proposes a 5.263% dividend for FY 2080/81. The meeting of the board of directors held on Ashwin 8 has proposed a 5% bonus shares worth Rs. 10.50 Crores and 0.263% cash dividend worth Rs. 55,26,316 for the fiscal year 2080/81. The company's existing paid-up capital is Rs. 2.10 Arba. The dividend will be distributed only after approval by the Electricity Regulatory Commission and endorsement by the company's upcoming 15th AGM. As of writing, SMHL has an LTP of Rs. 565.00.

articles.title: Rs. 38.6 Arba Financial Closure Secured for 285 MW Upper Tamor Hydropower Project
articles.content: Investment has been secured for the 285 MW Upper Tamor Hydropower Project, a semi-reservoir-based project set to be the largest hydropower initiative undertaken by the domestic private sector in Nepal. The financing for this project will be led by Everest Bank Limited, with contributions from Agricultural Development Bank, HIDCL, Rastriya Banijya Bank, Prabhu Bank, Laxmi Sunrise Bank, Nepal SBI Bank, and Garima Bikas Bank. During the financial management ceremony held in Kathmandu on Thursday, Everest Bank's Chief Executive Officer Sudesh Khaling and Tamor Energy Private Limited's Chairman Pushpa Jyoti Dhungana signed the agreement. The estimated total cost of the project, including interest during the construction period, is Rs. 55.15 Arba. Out of this, Rs. 16.55 Arba will be raised through equity, while the remaining Rs. 38.60 Arba will be financed under the leadership of Everest Bank Limited. Reflecting on the progress since the introduction of the Electricity Act by Shailaja Acharya in 1992, Chairman Dhungana noted that the company has evolved from constructing a 1 MW project to undertaking a 285 MW project within two decades. Ganesh Karki, President of the Independent Power Producer's Association of Nepal (IPPAN), emphasized the capability of the domestic private sector to handle projects up to 500 MW. He advocated for the amendment of the Electricity Bill to allow such capacities, as current proposals restrict private-sector projects to 100 MW. "Today's ceremony has demonstrated that the domestic private sector can handle projects like the 285 MW Upper Tamor," Karki stated. "The Electricity Bill should be amended to permit private sector projects up to 500 MW." Karki expressed gratitude to all the banks and financial institutions involved in the investment. He highlighted that hydropower projects not only produce electricity but also contribute significantly to infrastructure development, such as building thousands of kilometers of roads, schools, hospitals, a

articles.title: Super Madi Hydropower Achieves Turnaround in Q3 FY 2080/81, Reports Significant Net Profit Increase and Surge in Power Sales
articles.content: Super Madi Hydropower Limited (SMHL) has showcased outstanding financial prowess during the third quarter of Fiscal Year 2080/81, evidenced by a noteworthy surge in earnings amounting to Rs. 9.02 Crores. This marks a substantial turnaround from the net loss of 1.07 Crores reported during the corresponding quarter last year. During this period, SMHL's loans and borrowings ascended to Rs. 6.16 Arba, reflecting a significant increase of 7.25%. The company experienced a remarkable uptick in revenue compared to the same quarter last year, raking in an impressive Rs. 94.55 Crores from power sales. Concurrently, operating expenses were reported at Rs. 5.75 Crores, while financial costs surged to Rs. 56.79 Crores. SMHL maintains a financial structure with a paid-up capital of Rs. 2.1 Arba and a commendable Reserves and Surplus portfolio valued at Rs. 10.84 Crores. The Annualized Earnings Per Share (EPS) stands at Rs. 5.73. Furthermore, the net worth of the company is reported at Rs. 105.16 Crores. The Supermadi Hydro Power Project, managed by Super Madi Hydropower, has officially commenced commercial operations as of Chaitra 27, 2079. Following its successful launch, trading for the shares has commenced on the Nepal Stock Exchange Limited since the 18th of Falgun, 2079. Benefiting from strong water flow within the Madi River, the project has reported substantial earnings exceeding the contracted energy output from Poush to the end of Chaitra. This favorable development has instilled optimism within the company, anticipating that the project will continue to meet or even surpass projected production levels in the foreseeable future.

articles.title: ICRA Nepal's Rating Upgrade: Super Madi Hydropower Moves Up to BB+
articles.content: ICRA Nepal Limited has upgraded Super Madi Hydropower Limited's issuer rating from [ICRANP-IR] BB to [ICRANP-IR] BB+. This signifies a moderate risk of meeting financial obligations on time. However, it's essential to note that the rating is a general creditworthiness opinion and not specific to any bonds. The addition or subtraction of a plus or minus sign after the rating class indicates the comparative position within the respective class. Therefore, [ICRANP-IR] BB+ is one level above [ICRANP-IR] BB, while [ICRANP-IR] BB- is one level below [ICRANP-IR] BB.
